video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:45.230 --> 00:00:47.680
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:47.680 --> 00:00:52.470
you'll want to have the trailer screen up
on your LCD productivity screen, here.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:54.840
To get there, go to Truck Apps,
00:00:54.840 --> 00:00:57.930
then push the right arrow twice
until you see the trailer display.
00:00:58.940 --> 00:01:03.460
Unless a trailer is connected, the display
will read, Trailer Disconnected.
00:01:03.460 --> 00:01:06.740
As soon as a trailer is connected,
you'll see this message.
00:01:06.740 --> 00:01:08.100
Press OK.
00:01:08.100 --> 00:01:12.680
Once the trailer connected message
goes away, you'll see gain setting.
00:01:12.680 --> 00:01:16.370
This is what we talked about earlier, and
a bar graph that lights up to show you
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:19.390
the amount of power going
to the trailer brakes.
00:01:19.390 --> 00:01:23.960
From the trailer display, press OK, and
choose the Connection Checklist option.
00:01:25.110 --> 00:01:27.640
It corresponds to
different trailer types and
00:01:27.640 --> 00:01:32.160
walks you through the connection process
to remind you of the necessary steps.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg3.mp4
question: What does the trailer connection ap do?

video_name: 180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc
video_trans:
00:01:19.380 --> 00:01:22.640
In addition, you'll notice that several
lines appear in the display while
00:01:22.640 --> 00:01:23.980
you're backing up.
00:01:23.980 --> 00:01:26.620
The colored guidelines,
the ones that are not moving,
00:01:26.620 --> 00:01:30.730
show you the actual path your car is going
in while reversing in a straight line.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc_seg6.mp4
question: How do I tell the display is working?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:01:28.840 --> 00:01:31.460
You'll also find
a Connection Checklist tab.
00:01:31.460 --> 00:01:33.332
Here, you can select a particular trailer,
00:01:33.332 --> 00:01:35.540
ensure you're wiring
is hooked up properly,
00:01:35.540 --> 00:01:39.030
your lights are functioning correctly,
and your mirrors are adjusted.
00:01:39.030 --> 00:01:42.310
Trailer Setup allows you to select
the type of trailer you're pulling
00:01:42.310 --> 00:01:45.470
such as Conventional,
Fifth Wheel, or Gooseneck.

question: In what tab can you check to make sure your lights are adjusted correctly?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:00.980 --> 00:01:04.100
Okay, now I'll quickly discuss
the short strap mentioned earlier.
00:01:04.100 --> 00:01:07.460
To fold the second row seats from
the third row, pull the short strap, and
00:01:07.460 --> 00:01:09.980
the seat back will fold down forward.
00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780
Next, pull the longer
strap to unlock the seat.
00:01:12.780 --> 00:01:15.490
Now, push the seat forward and down.
00:01:15.490 --> 00:01:18.690
Your vehicle also has folding floor
support panels that makes stowing
00:01:18.690 --> 00:01:20.150
cargo easier.
00:01:20.150 --> 00:01:20.910
With the second and
00:01:20.910 --> 00:01:25.670
third row seats folded down, grab hold of
the panels and pull to disconnect them.
00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:28.740
You may need to give them a little tug
to disengage them from their magnetic
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:29.850
fasteners.
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:31.910
Then unfold like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg3.mp4
question: How to fold the second row seats?

video_trans:

To close it,
00:00:22.345 --> 00:00:26.609
press the indent tab firmly and it will
automatically rotate into position.
00:00:26.609 --> 00:00:29.641
You'll know it's locked when
you feel it latch into place.

video_trans:

If you have a low battery,
you may find that your window closes and
00:00:31.980 --> 00:00:34.800

00:00:34.800 --> 00:00:37.440
If this happens,

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:02:12.160 --> 00:02:16.400
To unfold the second row seats,
pull the longer strap on the seat back up.
00:02:16.400 --> 00:02:20.020
When you feel it unlock from the floor,
move the entire seat back and
00:02:20.020 --> 00:02:22.690
push down until you feel it
lock into position again.
00:02:22.690 --> 00:02:24.622
And until you hear it click.
00:02:24.622 --> 00:02:27.481
Finally, pull up on the short strap and
flip the seat back up.
00:02:27.481 --> 00:02:30.019
[MUSIC]
00:02:30.019 --> 00:02:31.043
Any questions?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:19.140
To turn it on, using the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:22.070
scroll down to Track Apps,
then Launch Control.
00:00:22.070 --> 00:00:24.232
[MUSIC]
00:00:24.232 --> 00:00:27.330
There, you'll see Launch Control and
RPM set.
00:00:27.330 --> 00:00:29.290
The RPM feature allows you to set and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:35.030
hold a preferred RPM to launch at,
anywhere between 3,000 and 4,500 RPMs.
00:00:35.030 --> 00:00:38.410
To select your RPM,
use the up and down arrows.
00:00:38.410 --> 00:00:41.490
This helps you control the amount of
torque distributed to the rear wheels
00:00:41.490 --> 00:00:44.570
based on engine speed,
tire temperature and
00:00:44.570 --> 00:00:46.645
surface condition to
help prevent wheel spin.
00:00:46.645 --> 00:00:47.540
[MUSIC]

video_trans:
00:00:10.810 --> 00:00:14.600
For starters, your vehicle has
a high-strength steel frame with enhanced
00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.454

durability to help control your trailer.
00:00:17.454 --> 00:00:20.870
It also has something called
the Smart Trailer Tow Connector.
00:00:20.870 --> 00:00:24.692
You can access it under the towing tab
in the eight-inch productivity screen.
00:00:24.692 --> 00:00:27.872
It provides you with trailer connection

00:00:27.872 --> 00:00:30.510

video_trans:
00:00:46.610 --> 00:00:49.360
To adjust the recline of
the second row seat backs,
00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:52.610
pull up on the handle on the side
of the seat closest to the door.
00:00:52.610 --> 00:00:56.180
And push the seat back back for
a greater recline, or forward for
00:00:56.180 --> 00:00:57.560
a more upright position.

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.130
Auto Start-Stop technology is always on
00:00:17.130 --> 00:00:20.450
unless you turn it off by pushing
the Auto Start-Stop off button.
00:00:20.450 --> 00:00:23.760
So, it will be active every
time you start your vehicle.
00:00:23.760 --> 00:00:25.390
When you put your foot
on the brake pedal and
00:00:25.390 --> 00:00:29.625
come to a full start, like at a red light,
your engine automatically shuts off.
00:00:29.625 --> 00:00:31.530
You might not even notice it.
00:00:31.530 --> 00:00:34.720
But a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know that it's off.
00:00:34.720 --> 00:00:36.920
And, once you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:36.920 --> 00:00:40.240
your car automatically
restarts without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w_seg2.mp4
question: How does the auto start or stop option work in the vehicle?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.360
Here's how it works.
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.500
Auto Start Stop automatically turns on
at startup unless you decided to turn it
00:00:18.500 --> 00:00:22.840
off using the on off button located
on the center console, here.
00:00:22.840 --> 00:00:25.570
You'll know it's activated when
you see the start-stop icon
00:00:25.570 --> 00:00:28.180
illuminated in your instrument cluster.
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:29.590
When you put your foot on the brake and
00:00:29.590 --> 00:00:33.690
come to a full stop, like at a red light,
your engine shuts off.
00:00:33.690 --> 00:00:35.580
You might not even notice it, but
00:00:35.580 --> 00:00:38.800
a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know the engine is off.
00:00:38.800 --> 00:00:39.580
But don't worry.
00:00:39.580 --> 00:00:44.100
Your climate control settings, radio,
and head lamps will function normally.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.870
And when you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.710
your car automatically restarts,
without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the on/off button located for Auto Start/Stop?

video_trans:
00:00:46.465 --> 00:00:50.790
When a trailer is properly connected and
driving over five miles per hour, BLIS
00:00:50.790 --> 00:00:55.270
with trailer coverage uses sensors in the
vehicle's tail end to extend the detection
00:00:55.270 --> 00:00:59.300
area rearward from the vehicle's side
mirrors to the end of the trailer.

video_trans:
00:00:44.220 --> 00:00:46.456
Okay, now let's talk about SelectShift.
00:00:46.456 --> 00:00:47.911
[MUSIC]
00:00:47.911 --> 00:00:52.109
To use it,
move your gear shift to the S position.
00:00:52.109 --> 00:00:55.615
And press the plus-minus buttons on
the the side of the gear shift to
00:00:55.615 --> 00:00:56.425

00:00:56.425 --> 00:01:00.255
Press plus to upshift and
minus to downshift.
00:01:00.255 --> 00:01:03.488
Keep in mind your engine will rev
at various speeds depending on
00:01:03.488 --> 00:01:05.080
what gear you've shifted to.
00:01:05.080 --> 00:01:07.638
If your engine RPM is too high or too low,
00:01:07.638 --> 00:01:11.408
your vehicle will automatically
make some shifts for you.

00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.550

a little to help direct you to steer
00:01:39.550 --> 00:01:40.350

00:01:41.510 --> 00:01:43.660

00:01:43.660 --> 00:01:46.030

00:01:46.030 --> 00:01:48.490

the system is off.
00:01:49.660 --> 00:01:50.630
And don't worry.

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:01:38.526 --> 00:01:39.932
To remove the battery cover,
00:01:39.932 --> 00:01:44.100
first remove the small panel that
covers the negative battery cable.
00:01:44.100 --> 00:01:47.050
Once the panel is off, you'll need
to loosen the nuts on the negative
00:01:47.050 --> 00:01:49.680
pull clamps and
remove the cable from the battery.
00:01:49.680 --> 00:01:52.608
Next, unsnap the tab in the front, here.
00:01:52.608 --> 00:01:55.984
Then, slide the lid forward until
the two additional front-side tabs
00:01:55.984 --> 00:01:57.830
come unattached.
00:01:57.830 --> 00:02:01.028
Now, lift and pull the cover to remove it.
00:02:01.028 --> 00:02:03.426
Then, loosen the nuts on
the positive pull clamps and
00:02:03.426 --> 00:02:05.580
remove the clamps from the battery.
00:02:05.580 --> 00:02:09.139
Be sure to use the lift handles
provided when removing the batteries,
00:02:09.139 --> 00:02:10.539
since they are very heavy.
00:02:10.539 --> 00:02:14.739
You may have a single battery. To replace
it with the cover panel off, loosen and
00:02:14.739 --> 00:02:17.060
remove the negative pull clamp.
00:02:17.060 --> 00:02:20.798
Then rotate the battery and
remove the positive pull clamp.
00:02:20.798 --> 00:02:24.062
To install the new battery,
just follow the same directions, but
00:02:24.062 --> 00:02:25.180
in the reverse order.
00:02:26.520 --> 00:02:30.043
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg5.mp4
question: How heavy is the battery in this vehicle?

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg3.mp4
question: What will happen if you continue to get closer to the pedestrian?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:00:16.950 --> 00:00:20.190
Before you begin you'll need a few
things to help with the set up.
00:00:20.190 --> 00:00:24.425
Your supplied quick start set up guide
with measurement card, a tape measure,
00:00:24.425 --> 00:00:27.408
a pen or pencil, and
an assistant to help out if needed.
00:00:27.408 --> 00:00:30.308
As well as the checkered stickers
that comes with your guide
00:00:30.308 --> 00:00:32.915
which I'll tell you about later.
00:00:32.915 --> 00:00:36.985
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.985 --> 00:00:41.105
For best results, it's recommended to use
a drawbar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:41.105 --> 00:00:43.025
drop to position your
trailer level to the ground.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:47.030
Then, line up the vehicle and
trailer by pulling forward so
00:00:47.030 --> 00:00:48.270
they're in line with one another.
00:00:49.800 --> 00:00:54.330
Second, from inside the vehicle, use
the five-way steering wheel controls and
00:00:54.330 --> 00:00:59.200
go to the Towing menu, and select Trailer
Setup, then Add Trailer, and hit OK.
00:01:00.780 --> 00:01:04.940
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:09.030
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:09.030 --> 00:01:11.020
Press OK to confirm.
00:01:11.020 --> 00:01:13.842
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:13.842 --> 00:01:17.260
Electric/Surge is the default,
then press OK.
00:01:18.470 --> 00:01:21.850
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer: Low,
00:01:21.850 --> 00:01:26.190
which is the recommended setting for
most trailers, Medium, or High.
00:01:26.190 --> 00:01:29.770
If your trailer requires more aggressive
braking, like if you have a larger,
00:01:29.770 --> 00:01:34.815
heavier trailer for instance, you will
then need to select a trailer type.
00:01:34.815 --> 00:01:38.346
And since automatic features are only
available with conventional trailers
00:01:38.346 --> 00:01:41.288
within trailer reverse guidance,
trailer setup is required.
00:01:41.288 --> 00:01:44.288
If you choose not to set up
your conventional trailer, or
00:01:44.288 --> 00:01:46.787
if you have a Fifth wheel or
Gooseneck trailer,
00:01:46.787 --> 00:01:49.985
you can still use the trailer
reverse guidance views.
00:01:49.985 --> 00:01:53.105
But, some of the automatic
features will not available.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg2.mp4
question: What are the thing you need before you start the set up of connecting your vehicle to the trailer?

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:00:35.750 --> 00:00:37.500
With your gear shift lever in D,
00:00:37.500 --> 00:00:41.000
press the minus button to activate
progressive range selection.
00:00:41.000 --> 00:00:43.490
When you do,
you'll see the available gears
00:00:43.490 --> 00:00:47.150
as well as the current gear
indicated on the instrument cluster.
00:00:47.150 --> 00:00:51.350
So, if you press the minus button once,
it will lock out sixth gear.
00:00:51.350 --> 00:00:54.230
And press it again to lock out fifth,
and so on.
00:00:54.230 --> 00:00:57.640
Once you lock out gears,
only the available gears will be shown and
00:00:57.640 --> 00:00:59.960
your transmission will
automatically shift between them.
00:01:01.000 --> 00:01:03.950
The unlocked gears will automatically
reappear in the display
00:01:03.950 --> 00:01:05.070
when you restart your vehicle.
00:01:06.580 --> 00:01:09.170
To unlock a gear,
just press the plus button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg3.mp4
question: how do we lock out gears?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:01:02.740 --> 00:01:04.950
Every time that you turn your vehicle off,
and
00:01:04.950 --> 00:01:07.280
you've used plug in
energy during your trip,
00:01:07.280 --> 00:01:10.870
the Next Full Charge screen will appear on
the right side of your instrument cluster.
00:01:10.870 --> 00:01:15.470
It will show your estimated miles per
full charge, just like on the left side,
00:01:15.470 --> 00:01:19.880

00:01:19.880 --> 00:01:22.590

the electric range for your vehicle.

video_trans:

Great, now let's talk about what to do
if your lights do need to be adjusted.
00:01:12.670 --> 00:01:16.450
Or if you're going to be towing
something and need to move them.
00:01:16.450 --> 00:01:20.920
First, open your hood, do you see
the adjuster on your head lamps?
00:01:22.118 --> 00:01:26.320
With your screwdriver, twist each one
until your beams are at the right level.
00:01:26.320 --> 00:01:28.830
And remember to leave the marks
on your door or wall so
00:01:28.830 --> 00:01:31.700
that you can readjust the lights
back when you need to.
00:01:31.700 --> 00:01:32.670
Any questions?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:29.400
Let me explain, adaptive steering with
tow/haul mode, changes the ratio between
00:00:29.400 --> 00:00:32.570
the driver's actions with the steering
wheel, meaning how much the driver
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:36.630
turns the steering wheel, and
how much the front wheels actually turn.
00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg2.mp4
question: What does adaptive steering with tow haul do at lower speeds?

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:48.160 --> 00:00:49.250
Keep in mind,
00:00:49.250 --> 00:00:53.440
there are some factors that affect the
amount of energy being used while driving.
00:00:53.440 --> 00:00:57.330
For instance, mild or
aggressive acceleration or braking,
00:00:57.330 --> 00:01:01.905

accessories, such as climate control.
00:01:01.905 --> 00:01:06.232
The ambient temperature and other weather
conditions, as well as whether you're
00:01:06.232 --> 00:01:09.335
driving in the city or
on the highway, and the road grades.
00:01:09.335 --> 00:01:10.463
Any questions?

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:01:06.450 --> 00:01:10.310
If at any time the battery in your remote
dies or the signal is interrupted,
00:01:10.310 --> 00:01:14.320
you can use the removable key
inside to unlock the driver's door.
00:01:14.320 --> 00:01:16.110
Just press the button and
slide the key out.
00:01:17.180 --> 00:01:19.920
Next, insert the key into the slot located
00:01:19.920 --> 00:01:22.440
underneath the rear of
the driver's door handle and
00:01:22.440 --> 00:01:26.320
push up until you feel the internal
tab flex and unlock the plastic bezel.
00:01:27.520 --> 00:01:30.560
Slide the bezel back to
completely remove it.
00:01:30.560 --> 00:01:35.220
When you do, you'll be able to access
the key cylinder and unlock your door.
00:01:35.220 --> 00:01:36.350
To replace the bezel,
00:01:36.350 --> 00:01:39.410
slide it forward until you feel
it snap into the locked position.
00:01:40.650 --> 00:01:44.537
Once you're in, there's a pocket in the
center console made just for the key fob.
00:01:44.537 --> 00:01:46.680
It'll allow you to start your car.
00:01:46.680 --> 00:01:49.860
Place the key fob in the slot
with the button's facing up and
00:01:49.860 --> 00:01:52.810
the unlock button towards
the front of the vehicle.
00:01:52.810 --> 00:01:56.695
Keep in mind, because the key is
programmed to your car, if you lose it,
00:01:56.695 --> 00:01:59.050
you'll need to contact your dealer for
a replacement.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c_seg6.mp4
question: Does the key fob have an actual key?

video_name: SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw
video_trans:
00:01:45.930 --> 00:01:50.082
To set valet mode, which locks out the
SYNC 3 screen to the valet attendant while
00:01:50.082 --> 00:01:52.920
driving your car, press the Valet tile.
00:01:52.920 --> 00:01:56.440
You get a message asking you to enter
a personal identification number of your
00:01:56.440 --> 00:01:58.750
choice and if you want to continue.
00:01:58.750 --> 00:02:00.580
If so, press Yes.
00:02:00.580 --> 00:02:02.867
Then type in your PIN and press Done.
00:02:02.867 --> 00:02:05.810
Re-enter the PIN to complete the process.
00:02:05.810 --> 00:02:07.980
Once you get your key back from the valet,
00:02:07.980 --> 00:02:11.890
you need to enter the PIN again to turn
Valet Mode off and unlock the screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw_seg7.mp4
question: How do you turn on valet mode?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:02:09.570 --> 00:02:13.270
You may also notice that the charge
cord has multiple LED indicators
00:02:13.270 --> 00:02:17.580
to indicate that charging is in progress
or if any problems have occurred.
00:02:17.580 --> 00:02:21.340
When plugged into an AC outlet,
and you see a solid green light,
00:02:21.340 --> 00:02:24.080
power is available, but
vehicle charging has not begun.
00:02:25.470 --> 00:02:27.770
A flashing green light means
the vehicle is charging.
00:02:28.960 --> 00:02:32.270
If you see a flashing
solid red triangle LED,
00:02:32.270 --> 00:02:37.290
a ground fault circuit interrupter fault
or charge cord fault has been detected.
00:02:37.290 --> 00:02:41.610
However, if at any time you see a flashing
amber LED light in the shape of an outlet
00:02:41.610 --> 00:02:46.020
plug, that means high temperature
at the AC plug has been detected.
00:02:46.020 --> 00:02:48.610
Have the outlet checked by
a qualified electrician and
00:02:48.610 --> 00:02:50.839
make sure the AC plug fits
firmly into the outlet.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg7.mp4
question: What do the flashing lights mean?

video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:45.570 --> 00:00:48.950
There are a few things that you may
need to know to prevent damaging them.
00:00:48.950 --> 00:00:51.430
Before you put a jack
underneath your vehicle,
00:00:51.430 --> 00:00:54.790
you'll need to ensure that the power
running boards are turned off.
00:00:54.790 --> 00:00:58.400
Also, when using a jack,
be sure to check your owner's manual for
00:00:58.400 --> 00:01:00.440
proper mounting locations.
00:01:00.440 --> 00:01:04.510
And when using a hoist lift be sure to
place the lift arms under the frame rails
00:01:04.510 --> 00:01:09.130
at all times to avoid damage to the under
body and running board components.
00:01:09.130 --> 00:01:10.250
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs_seg4.mp4
question: Where to put the jack?

video_trans:
00:00:25.340 --> 00:00:27.780
To turn adaptive cruise control on,
press and
00:00:27.780 --> 00:00:30.690
release the on off switch
on your steering wheel.
00:00:30.690 --> 00:00:33.560
The information display will
show a gray indicator light
00:00:33.560 --> 00:00:35.470
as well as the current gap setting.
00:00:35.470 --> 00:00:38.170
Now, accelerate to the speed you want,
00:00:38.170 --> 00:00:40.720
press the set button on your wheel and
release.
00:00:40.720 --> 00:00:43.120
Then take your foot off the accelerator.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:38.782 --> 00:02:43.168
Keep in mind, you can cancel adaptive cruise
control one set anytime by braking or
00:02:43.168 --> 00:02:46.965
pressing the cancel button on
the steering wheel, which will cancel
00:02:46.965 --> 00:02:51.489
the adaptive cruise control and allow you
to gain manual control of your vehicle.
00:02:51.489 --> 00:02:55.998
Pressing the resume button will return the
vehicle to the previously set speed and
00:02:55.998 --> 00:02:56.790
gap setting.
 
00:02:56.790 --> 00:02:57.996
Any questions?

And finally, to extend the life
of the bright chrome grill and
00:01:12.960 --> 00:01:17.600

finishes regularly, especially before and
00:01:17.600 --> 00:01:19.050

00:01:19.050 --> 00:01:22.100

maintain the finishes luster and
00:01:22.100 --> 00:01:24.580

of rust spots.

00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:30.530
following product directions.

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:01:21.930 --> 00:01:26.230
Once plugged in and charging, the port
light will show the current charge status.
00:01:26.230 --> 00:01:30.020
When one bar is pulsing,
the charge is between 0 and 25%.
00:01:31.220 --> 00:01:34.017
One solid bar and
one pulsing bar is 25 to 50%.
00:01:34.017 --> 00:01:40.604
Two solids and one pulsing is 50 to 75%.
00:01:40.604 --> 00:01:44.169
Three solid and one pulsing is 75 to 100%.
00:01:45.300 --> 00:01:49.340
And when all four bars are solidly lit,
the charge is complete.

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:35.030
Here are a few helpful tips for
unfolding the third row seats.
00:01:35.030 --> 00:01:38.130
You may need to do the next two
steps from the rear of the vehicle.
00:01:38.130 --> 00:01:42.500
First, retract the floor panels by
pulling up on the attached strap.
00:01:42.500 --> 00:01:46.620
Next, grab the third row seat back strap
located behind the head restraint and
00:01:46.620 --> 00:01:47.830
lift it to its locked position.
00:01:49.130 --> 00:01:52.725
Now, go back to the rear side of the door
and use the strap on the front of
00:01:52.725 --> 00:01:55.070
the seat cushion to flip it
back to its original position.
00:01:56.380 --> 00:01:57.950
And here's something you'll appreciate.
00:01:57.950 --> 00:02:02.210
You can also move the third row seats
forward and back and recline them.
00:02:02.210 --> 00:02:04.250
Just lift the metal bar
under the seat cushion and
00:02:04.250 --> 00:02:06.140
slide the seat forward or back.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:09.530
And pull the same strap you used to
fold the seat back down to recline them.
00:02:09.530 --> 00:02:12.160
Only now, just lean back to recline.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg4.mp4
question: How do you retract the floor panels?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:00:16.950 --> 00:00:20.190
Before you begin you'll need a few
things to help with the set up.
00:00:20.190 --> 00:00:24.425
Your supplied quick start set up guide
with measurement card, a tape measure,
00:00:24.425 --> 00:00:27.408
a pen or pencil, and
an assistant to help out if needed.
00:00:27.408 --> 00:00:30.308
As well as the checkered stickers
that comes with your guide
00:00:30.308 --> 00:00:32.915
which I'll tell you about later.
00:00:32.915 --> 00:00:36.985
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.985 --> 00:00:41.105
For best results, it's recommended to use
a drawbar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:41.105 --> 00:00:43.025
drop to position your
trailer level to the ground.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:47.030
Then, line up the vehicle and
trailer by pulling forward so
00:00:47.030 --> 00:00:48.270
they're in line with one another.
00:00:49.800 --> 00:00:54.330
Second, from inside the vehicle, use
the five-way steering wheel controls and
00:00:54.330 --> 00:00:59.200
go to the Towing menu, and select Trailer
Setup, then Add Trailer, and hit OK.
00:01:00.780 --> 00:01:04.940
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:09.030
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:09.030 --> 00:01:11.020
Press OK to confirm.
00:01:11.020 --> 00:01:13.842
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:13.842 --> 00:01:17.260
Electric/Surge is the default,
then press OK.
00:01:18.470 --> 00:01:21.850
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer: Low,
00:01:21.850 --> 00:01:26.190
which is the recommended setting for
most trailers, Medium, or High.
00:01:26.190 --> 00:01:29.770
If your trailer requires more aggressive
braking, like if you have a larger,
00:01:29.770 --> 00:01:34.815
heavier trailer for instance, you will
then need to select a trailer type.
00:01:34.815 --> 00:01:38.346
And since automatic features are only
available with conventional trailers
00:01:38.346 --> 00:01:41.288
within trailer reverse guidance,
trailer setup is required.
00:01:41.288 --> 00:01:44.288
If you choose not to set up
your conventional trailer, or
00:01:44.288 --> 00:01:46.787
if you have a Fifth wheel or
Gooseneck trailer,
00:01:46.787 --> 00:01:49.985
you can still use the trailer
reverse guidance views.
00:01:49.985 --> 00:01:53.105
But, some of the automatic
features will not available.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg2.mp4
question: When is the automatic features not available on selecting the trailer type?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.727
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.727 --> 00:00:08.310
Did you know that your car may be equipped
with a feature that's designed to help
00:00:08.310 --> 00:00:10.150
reduce the amount of fuel you use?
00:00:10.150 --> 00:00:12.840
It's called Auto Start-Stop technology.

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:35.030
Here are a few helpful tips for
unfolding the third row seats.
00:01:35.030 --> 00:01:38.130
You may need to do the next two
steps from the rear of the vehicle.
00:01:38.130 --> 00:01:42.500
First, retract the floor panels by
pulling up on the attached strap.
00:01:42.500 --> 00:01:46.620
Next, grab the third row seat back strap
located behind the head restraint and
00:01:46.620 --> 00:01:47.830
lift it to its locked position.
00:01:49.130 --> 00:01:52.725
Now, go back to the rear side of the door
and use the strap on the front of
00:01:52.725 --> 00:01:55.070
the seat cushion to flip it
back to its original position.
00:01:56.380 --> 00:01:57.950
And here's something you'll appreciate.
00:01:57.950 --> 00:02:02.210
You can also move the third row seats
forward and back and recline them.
00:02:02.210 --> 00:02:04.250
Just lift the metal bar
under the seat cushion and
00:02:04.250 --> 00:02:06.140
slide the seat forward or back.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:09.530
And pull the same strap you used to
fold the seat back down to recline them.
00:02:09.530 --> 00:02:12.160
Only now, just lean back to recline.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg4.mp4
question: How the third row seats unfolded?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:34.270 --> 00:01:36.670
When you see yellow,
the Aid mode is active.
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.550
Then you'll feel the steering wheel move
a little to help direct you to steer
00:01:39.550 --> 00:01:40.350
back into you lane.
00:01:41.510 --> 00:01:43.660
If you see red, the Alert mode is active,
00:01:43.660 --> 00:01:46.030
and you'll feel
the steering wheel vibrate.
00:01:46.030 --> 00:01:48.490
And if you don't see any lines,
the system is off.
00:01:49.660 --> 00:01:50.630
And don't worry.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg7.mp4

00:01:24.990 --> 00:01:27.910

00:01:30.570 --> 00:01:34.766

00:01:34.766 --> 00:01:37.800

of where your trailer will go
00:01:37.800 --> 00:01:40.420
based on your current
steering wheel position.

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:01:55.850 --> 00:01:59.360
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:01:59.360 --> 00:02:03.473
The sticker acts as a target with
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist feature and
00:02:03.473 --> 00:02:07.537
rear-view camera used to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:07.537 --> 00:02:09.147
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:09.147 --> 00:02:11.419
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:11.419 --> 00:02:15.521
You want to place the sticker within 7 to
22 inches from the center of the trailer
00:02:15.521 --> 00:02:16.198
hitch ball.
00:02:16.198 --> 00:02:19.879
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal service that
00:02:19.879 --> 00:02:21.681
is visible by the rear-view camera.
00:02:21.681 --> 00:02:24.369
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:24.369 --> 00:02:28.192
One the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:28.192 --> 00:02:29.841
record several measurements.

video_name: Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA
video_trans:
00:00:11.960 --> 00:00:14.580
First, keep in mind that
convertible top fabric
00:00:14.580 --> 00:00:16.710
does not promote mildew growth itself.
00:00:16.710 --> 00:00:20.705
Mildew may develop on dirt or
other foreign substances if not removed.
00:00:20.705 --> 00:00:25.090
So keeping the fabric clean through
regular washings will enhance the life and
00:00:25.090 --> 00:00:26.696
beauty of the top material.
00:00:26.696 --> 00:00:29.595
When washing vehicles
with cloth top roofs.
00:00:29.595 --> 00:00:33.012
Start by vacuuming with a soft
bristle brush attachment and
00:00:33.012 --> 00:00:35.070
be sure to use a non detergent soap.
00:00:35.070 --> 00:00:40.925
Scrub gently in a circular pattern using
a terrycloth towel or soft bristle brush.
00:00:40.925 --> 00:00:44.030
More specifically horse hair or
soft nylon.
00:00:44.030 --> 00:00:45.950
Do not use stiff bristle brushes or
00:00:45.950 --> 00:00:49.420
any abrasive materials or
cleaners as they can damage the fabric.
00:00:50.840 --> 00:00:54.760
When finished, rinse thoroughly
removing all soap residues.
00:00:54.760 --> 00:00:59.040
Allow the top to air dry completely
before folding it otherwise, mold or
00:00:59.040 --> 00:01:02.340
mildew may develop and
discolor the cloth material.
00:01:02.340 --> 00:01:07.090
To clean away lint debris like cottonwood,
use a standard clothes lint roller or
00:01:07.090 --> 00:01:09.320
a vacuum attachment with
a soft bristle brush.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA_seg2.mp4
question: When do I need to clean my convertable fabric top?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:00:15.740 --> 00:00:19.560
First press the lock button on your
key fob to lock all the doors.
00:00:20.620 --> 00:00:24.120
Then press the remote start button,
the one with the 2x icon two times.
00:00:24.120 --> 00:00:29.300
Your outside lights will flash twice and
then your car will start.
00:00:30.490 --> 00:00:31.340
For some vehicles,
00:00:31.340 --> 00:00:35.225
a light on your your remote will also let
you know if your car has started or not.
00:00:35.225 --> 00:00:37.235
Pretty convenient, right?

video_name: SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw
video_trans:
00:01:45.930 --> 00:01:50.082
To set valet mode, which locks out the
SYNC 3 screen to the valet attendant while
00:01:50.082 --> 00:01:52.920
driving your car, press the Valet tile.
00:01:52.920 --> 00:01:56.440
You get a message asking you to enter
a personal identification number of your
00:01:56.440 --> 00:01:58.750
choice and if you want to continue.
00:01:58.750 --> 00:02:00.580
If so, press Yes.
00:02:00.580 --> 00:02:02.867
Then type in your PIN and press Done.
00:02:02.867 --> 00:02:05.810
Re-enter the PIN to complete the process.
00:02:05.810 --> 00:02:07.980
Once you get your key back from the valet,
00:02:07.980 --> 00:02:11.890
you need to enter the PIN again to turn
Valet Mode off and unlock the screen.

video_trans:
00:01:04.980 --> 00:01:09.490
You also have a Towing tab which can be
very helpful if you do a lot of towing.
00:01:09.490 --> 00:01:12.770
Just use the five-way switch on your
steering wheel to scroll to towing.
00:01:12.770 --> 00:01:16.490
Then view trailer status, which tells
you which trailer you're connected to,
00:01:16.490 --> 00:01:20.140
the accumulated miles on it, and
the trailer's breaking output and
00:01:20.140 --> 00:01:24.498
gain status. Trailer options, which lets
you turn the Trailer Sway Control feature

00:00:27.872 --> 00:00:30.510

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:00:22.760 --> 00:00:25.970
Summer tires are ideal for
performance vehicles and
00:00:25.970 --> 00:00:29.366
do not have the same traction
characteristics of all-season tires.
00:00:29.366 --> 00:00:32.902
As they are designed for
superior traction, cornering, and
00:00:32.902 --> 00:00:37.010
braking performance for
both wet and dry road conditions.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:41.240
This is attributed to specialized tread
patterns, like less grooving, to provide
00:00:41.240 --> 00:00:46.159
more tire contact with the road, shallower
tread depth, and softer rubber compounds.
00:00:47.330 --> 00:00:51.550
Keep in mind, since summer tires
are composed of softer materials,
00:00:51.550 --> 00:00:53.360
they tend to lose flexibility.
00:00:53.360 --> 00:00:55.766
and are less suitable in colder temps and
00:00:55.766 --> 00:00:58.755
generally wear faster
than an all-season tire.
00:00:58.755 --> 00:01:02.646
And unlike all-season tires,
summer tires do not have a mud and
00:01:02.646 --> 00:01:05.601
snow traction rating and
are not recommended for
00:01:05.601 --> 00:01:09.870
cold weather below 45 degrees or
snowy and icy driving conditions.
00:01:11.220 --> 00:01:12.540
As a matter of fact,
00:01:12.540 --> 00:01:17.230
driving on summer tires in below
freezing conditions can damage them.
00:01:17.230 --> 00:01:21.590
If you must drive in these conditions,
Ford recommends using all-season or
00:01:21.590 --> 00:01:23.240
winter snow tires.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg2.mp4
question: What do summertime tires lose in colder temperatures?

00:00:46.486 --> 00:00:49.273
you're not done yet and
will have to take few extra steps.
00:00:49.273 --> 00:00:50.899

00:00:50.899 --> 00:00:52.750
Don't worry, I'll walk you through them.
00:00:52.750 --> 00:00:55.032

few steps in 30 seconds, so
00:00:55.032 --> 00:00:57.542

you if you think it would be easier.

on your garage door opener motor, here.
00:01:04.900 --> 00:01:07.170
Next, get back in your car and press and
00:01:07.170 --> 00:01:11.360
hold the selected function button on your
HomeLink for two seconds then release it.
00:01:11.360 --> 00:01:14.500
Then press and hold it for
two seconds again and release it.

video_trans:
00:01:10.071 --> 00:01:13.546
To access the battery compartment
on Transit Wagon models,
00:01:13.546 --> 00:01:17.973
first remove the protective plastic
molding, by pulling up on the tabs, and
00:01:17.973 --> 00:01:19.420
sliding it towards you.
00:01:19.420 --> 00:01:23.326
Next, lift the fabric covered trim by
pulling up on the tabs, and tuck, or
00:01:23.326 --> 00:01:25.074
fold it to keep it out of your way.
00:01:25.074 --> 00:01:28.962
You'll need to remove the rear metal
battery cover by unscrewing two fastening
00:01:28.962 --> 00:01:30.130
bolts, here and here.
00:01:31.350 --> 00:01:34.113
Next, unfasten the two electrical cords,
00:01:34.113 --> 00:01:38.526
by unclipping them from the fasteners
like this, and remove the bar.

video_name: Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA
video_trans:
00:00:11.960 --> 00:00:14.580
First, keep in mind that
convertible top fabric
00:00:14.580 --> 00:00:16.710
does not promote mildew growth itself.
00:00:16.710 --> 00:00:20.705
Mildew may develop on dirt or
other foreign substances if not removed.
00:00:20.705 --> 00:00:25.090
So keeping the fabric clean through
regular washings will enhance the life and
00:00:25.090 --> 00:00:26.696
beauty of the top material.
00:00:26.696 --> 00:00:29.595
When washing vehicles
with cloth top roofs.
00:00:29.595 --> 00:00:33.012
Start by vacuuming with a soft
bristle brush attachment and
00:00:33.012 --> 00:00:35.070
be sure to use a non detergent soap.
00:00:35.070 --> 00:00:40.925
Scrub gently in a circular pattern using
a terrycloth towel or soft bristle brush.
00:00:40.925 --> 00:00:44.030
More specifically horse hair or
soft nylon.
00:00:44.030 --> 00:00:45.950
Do not use stiff bristle brushes or
00:00:45.950 --> 00:00:49.420
any abrasive materials or
cleaners as they can damage the fabric.
00:00:50.840 --> 00:00:54.760
When finished, rinse thoroughly
removing all soap residues.
00:00:54.760 --> 00:00:59.040
Allow the top to air dry completely
before folding it otherwise, mold or
00:00:59.040 --> 00:01:02.340
mildew may develop and
discolor the cloth material.
00:01:02.340 --> 00:01:07.090
To clean away lint debris like cottonwood,
use a standard clothes lint roller or
00:01:07.090 --> 00:01:09.320
a vacuum attachment with
a soft bristle brush.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA_seg2.mp4
question: Why is it important to keep fabric free of dirt and debris when mildew won't grow on the fabric itself?

00:00:44.679 --> 00:00:45.591
And one more thing.
00:00:45.591 --> 00:00:50.590
If for any reason it doesn't engage
reverse gear, press the clutch pedal down,
00:00:50.590 --> 00:00:55.532
take it out of gear, release the clutch
pedal, then repeat the process again.

00:01:25.890 --> 00:01:28.380

00:01:28.380 --> 00:01:30.950

light flash slowly at first
00:01:30.950 --> 00:01:34.590

been sent and accepted again.

Still with me?

You also have a Towing tab which can be

00:01:20.140 --> 00:01:24.498

00:01:24.498 --> 00:01:28.840
on, change trailers, delete,

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:51.980 --> 00:00:55.130
In addition to being able to personalize
your left side screen choices,
00:00:55.130 --> 00:00:58.734
there are also a few screens that
are only available in MyView.
00:00:58.734 --> 00:01:03.010
Like Accessory Power, which indicates the
electrical power demands being put on your
00:01:03.010 --> 00:01:04.650
vehicle from your climate system, and
00:01:04.650 --> 00:01:08.680
other accessories like your radio,
headlights, and windshield wipers.
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.700
Coolant temp, which indicates if your

00:01:12.700 --> 00:01:16.550
Keep in mind, whichever two choices you
select, the far right side of the screen
00:01:16.550 --> 00:01:19.540

video_name: How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.081 --> 00:00:03.902
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.902 --> 00:00:06.147
Your vehicle may be equipped
with power outlets,
00:00:06.147 --> 00:00:09.900
where you can charge devices like laptops,
rechargeable power tools, and more.
00:00:09.900 --> 00:00:12.030
Let me explain.
00:00:12.030 --> 00:00:14.190
There are two outlets in your vehicle.
00:00:14.190 --> 00:00:18.710
One in the instrument panel, here, and
one in the rear of the center console
00:00:18.710 --> 00:00:21.650
that is easily accessible for
someone in the back seat.
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:25.510
The outlets can charge when your truck is
running ,and can deliver up to 400 watts
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:29.650
when you're parked or idling, and
up to 300 watts when you're driving.
00:00:29.650 --> 00:00:33.970
Keep in mind, when using power tools,
the power outlets are only to be used for
00:00:33.970 --> 00:00:37.600
recharging and
should not be used as a main power source.
00:00:37.600 --> 00:00:38.303
Any questions?
00:00:38.303 --> 00:00:40.149
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:40.149 --> 00:00:50.149
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo_seg1.mp4
question: How do you use the power outlets?

video_name: Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.277
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.277 --> 00:00:06.654
Did you know that dirty glass or wiper
blades are one of the major reasons for
00:00:06.654 --> 00:00:09.020
streaks and
smears on your windshield when wiping?
00:00:10.170 --> 00:00:12.640
If this happens,
lift your wiper blades up and
  
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:16.680
clean the entire windshield glass,
as well as the rubber blades.
00:00:16.680 --> 00:00:19.270
Be sure to clean the windshield
using a neutral detergent
00:00:19.270 --> 00:00:23.030
such as Motorcraft Premium
Windshield Washer Concentrate or
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.960
Motorcraft Ultra-Clear Spray
Glass Cleaner, and a soft cloth.
00:00:26.960 --> 00:00:28.090
Then rinse with clear water.
00:00:29.330 --> 00:00:32.405
In extreme cases,
you may need to use a mild abrasive,
00:00:32.405 --> 00:00:36.480
non-chlorinated cleaner, and
wash the wiper blades using a sponge or
00:00:36.480 --> 00:00:40.860
soft cloth and rubbing alcohol, or
Premium Windshield Washer Fluid.
00:00:40.860 --> 00:00:45.060
If your wipers continue to smear your
windshield, you may need to replace them.
00:00:45.060 --> 00:00:45.920
Any questions?
00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.075
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.075 --> 00:00:58.075
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM_seg1.mp4
question: If washing your wiper blades and window does not stop the smearing, what should you do?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:22.880 --> 00:00:24.570
When ready to charge the vehicle,
00:00:24.570 --> 00:00:28.560
first be sure that the cord is
completely unwound to avoid overheating.
00:00:28.560 --> 00:00:33.250
And plug the AC plug into an AC outlet,
making sure to use a dedicated line that
00:00:33.250 --> 00:00:37.010
no other appliances are connected to,
to avoid tripping a circuit.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:40.910
Then, connect the charging coupler
to the charge port on the vehicle.
00:00:40.910 --> 00:00:43.410
You'll know it's properly attached
when you hear a click and
00:00:43.410 --> 00:00:44.760
the lock release button pops up.
00:00:45.830 --> 00:00:49.580
The FORD charge port LED lights
will flash in sequence two times,
00:00:49.580 --> 00:00:52.540
to confirm an electrical
connection has been made.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg3.mp4
question: How do I know the charging coupler is properly attached?

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:45.230 --> 00:00:47.680
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:47.680 --> 00:00:52.470
you'll want to have the trailer screen up
on your LCD productivity screen, here.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:54.840
To get there, go to Truck Apps,
00:00:54.840 --> 00:00:57.930
then push the right arrow twice
until you see the trailer display.
00:00:58.940 --> 00:01:03.460
Unless a trailer is connected, the display
will read, Trailer Disconnected.
00:01:03.460 --> 00:01:06.740
As soon as a trailer is connected,
you'll see this message.
00:01:06.740 --> 00:01:08.100
Press OK.
00:01:08.100 --> 00:01:12.680
Once the trailer connected message
goes away, you'll see gain setting.
00:01:12.680 --> 00:01:16.370
This is what we talked about earlier, and
a bar graph that lights up to show you
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:19.390
the amount of power going
to the trailer brakes.
00:01:19.390 --> 00:01:23.960
From the trailer display, press OK, and
choose the Connection Checklist option.
00:01:25.110 --> 00:01:27.640
It corresponds to
different trailer types and
00:01:27.640 --> 00:01:32.160
walks you through the connection process
to remind you of the necessary steps.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg3.mp4
question: How to check whether trailer is connected to car?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:52.500
To use Launch Control, select Launch
Control under the Track App menu.
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.105
Once enabled quickly press
the accelerator all the way to the floor.
00:00:56.105 --> 00:00:58.365
The feature will automatically
set your preferred RPM.
00:00:58.365 --> 00:01:01.535
You'll know it's set when you see
the set icon in the lower right
00:01:01.535 --> 00:01:02.795
corner of the display.
00:01:02.795 --> 00:01:03.296
When ready,
00:01:03.296 --> 00:01:06.265
quickly release the clutch while
maintaining pressure on the accelerator.
00:01:06.265 --> 00:01:08.252
[MUSIC]
00:01:08.252 --> 00:01:09.580
One more thing.
00:01:09.580 --> 00:01:12.110
You can turn it off by
following the same steps.
00:01:12.110 --> 00:01:14.220
Simply select Launch Control and press OK.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg3.mp4
question: How do you know if your preferred RPMs are set?

video_trans:

To fold the seats flat, pull up on the
same handle you used to recline the seat,

the way forward until it's flat.

question: How do you fold the seats flat?

Or any of the fans feed buttons.

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: what does the five way switch do?

video_name: Double Pivot Mirror _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pdsBuJu7fnQ
video_trans:
00:00:15.090 --> 00:00:18.154
Your vehicle's rear view
mirror has two pivot points,
00:00:18.154 --> 00:00:21.621
one at the rear of the mirror housing and
one at the windshield.
00:00:21.621 --> 00:00:25.173
To adjust the mirror stem,
grab a hold of the mirror housing, and
00:00:25.173 --> 00:00:29.380
with a little pressure,
pull down to lower and push up to raise.
00:00:29.380 --> 00:00:31.430
It can also be pivoted side to side.
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:35.620
The mirror housing can also
be adjusted left or right and
00:00:35.620 --> 00:00:37.692
tilted up or down with a little pressure.
00:00:37.692 --> 00:00:39.436
It's that simple.

input, and takes on a more powerful tone.
00:01:10.650 --> 00:01:15.280
When you're in track mode a performance
oriented advance track calibration
00:01:15.280 --> 00:01:17.020
is automatically selected.
00:01:17.020 --> 00:01:21.110
And the usual advance track intervention
is reduced and tunes specifically for
00:01:21.110 --> 00:01:22.550
race track usage.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI_seg6.mp4
question: When should I use the Track Drive Mode?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.301 --> 00:00:03.842
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.842 --> 00:00:07.639
Your truck may be equipped with a system
that helps with lining up your trailer,
00:00:07.639 --> 00:00:10.870
to where you want it while in
reverse quickly and easily.
00:00:10.870 --> 00:00:12.970
It's called Trailer Reverse Guidance, and
00:00:12.970 --> 00:00:15.630
there are a few things that you
need to do before using it.
00:00:15.630 --> 00:00:16.950
Let me explain.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg1.mp4
question: What is the narrator about to explain?

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:01:16.650 --> 00:01:20.350
Here are a few more things you'll
need to know when using the feature.
00:01:20.350 --> 00:01:24.990
After setting up and selecting a trailer,
the display always shows you a small top
00:01:24.990 --> 00:01:27.910
view representation of your truck and
trailer.
00:01:27.910 --> 00:01:30.570
You'll also see two
different colored lines.
00:01:30.570 --> 00:01:34.766
A black line shows you where your
trailer is in relation to your vehicle.
00:01:34.766 --> 00:01:37.800
And a white line gives you a projection
of where your trailer will go
00:01:37.800 --> 00:01:40.420
based on your current
steering wheel position.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg4.mp4
question: When using the trailer reverse guidance system, what do the black and white lines on the screen indicate?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:00:54.680 --> 00:00:57.700
The green area of the gauge
represents miles per charge
00:00:57.700 --> 00:01:00.590
that is greater than the rated value for
your vehicle.
00:01:00.590 --> 00:01:01.640
Still with me?
00:01:01.640 --> 00:01:02.740
Great.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg5.mp4
question: How do I know how much MPC I have?

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:01:23.240 --> 00:01:24.670
One more thing.
00:01:24.670 --> 00:01:27.310
When storing summer tires,
be sure to store them
00:01:27.310 --> 00:01:32.024
away from direct heating devices where
the temperatures are above 19 degrees Fahrenheit
00:01:32.024 --> 00:01:36.900
as lower temperatures may
result in loss of rubber flexibility and
00:01:36.900 --> 00:01:39.470
develop surface cracks in the treads.
00:01:39.470 --> 00:01:43.636
If the tires have been stored and
conditioned at 19 degrees or cooler,
00:01:43.636 --> 00:01:47.190
warm them to 41 degrees Fahrenheit for
at least 24 hours
00:01:47.190 --> 00:01:50.510
before installing them on a vehicle or
checking the tire pressure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg3.mp4
question: What temperature should you store your summer tires above?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:01:51.770 --> 00:01:52.390
Settings and
00:01:52.390 --> 00:01:56.100
Advanced Settings which allows you to
configure certain things like lighting,
00:01:56.100 --> 00:02:00.810
locks and wipers, remote start, climate
controls, and let's you create a MyKey.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk_seg7.mp4
question: what are some of the setting and advanced setting?

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:12.168 --> 00:00:15.280
The customer placed trailer
camera prep kit can be mounted to
00:00:15.280 --> 00:00:16.530
the rear of a trailer.
00:00:16.530 --> 00:00:20.820
And provides added driver convenience
when backing up with an attached trailer.
00:00:20.820 --> 00:00:25.660
The kit includes a camera, wiring harness,
mounting bracket, and mounting parts.
00:00:25.660 --> 00:00:30.100
To use the camera requires the available
Sync 3 system, and either the available
00:00:30.100 --> 00:00:35.700
ultimate trailer tow camera system, or
rear center high mounted stop lamp camera.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs_seg2.mp4
question: What is the maximum length of trailer this will work for?

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:00:18.830 --> 00:00:19.730
To access it,
00:00:19.730 --> 00:00:24.040
from the home screen touch Apps on your
SYNC 3 touch screen, then Power Flow.
00:00:25.080 --> 00:00:26.710
The power flow screen will appear and
00:00:26.710 --> 00:00:29.240
you'll see your vehicles
current operating status.
00:00:29.240 --> 00:00:36.020
Either idle, hybrid drive, electric
drive or charging high voltage battery.
00:00:36.020 --> 00:00:38.620
Now depending on which status
you're currently running in
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:41.320
such as electric drive mode
when the engine is off
00:00:41.320 --> 00:00:45.730
you'll see a blue power flow path
indicating which components are in use.
00:00:45.730 --> 00:00:49.360
In this case power from the battery
is being used for accessories like
00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:54.060
the climate control, high voltage electric
heater or air conditioning compressor and
00:00:54.060 --> 00:00:58.500
other low voltage accessories such
as the radio, fans or heated seats.
00:00:58.500 --> 00:01:01.090
You'll also notice power
flowing to the electric motor
00:01:01.090 --> 00:01:02.720
which is driving the wheels.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg2.mp4
question: What does the power flow screen show me?

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:01:40.420 --> 00:01:44.360
As you turn the wheel,
you'll see two zones, yellow and red.
00:01:44.360 --> 00:01:48.630
Yellow being a caution alert that warns
you of a potential jackknife position.
00:01:48.630 --> 00:01:52.160
And red signaling that you need to stop,
pull forward, and
00:01:52.160 --> 00:01:55.610
put the truck and
trailer back into an inline position.
00:01:55.610 --> 00:01:59.550
One more thing, when using the Straight
Backup mode, a steering wheel graphic
00:01:59.550 --> 00:02:02.920
shows you which way to turn your steering
wheel to keep your trailer straight.
00:02:03.990 --> 00:02:05.060
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg5.mp4
question: What does the yellow zone color mean when I am turning the wheel?

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.813
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.813 --> 00:00:06.210
Your vehicle has a standard
cruise control function.
00:00:06.210 --> 00:00:09.680
But did you know that it has an additional
feature that's designed to help you drive
00:00:09.680 --> 00:00:12.690
more efficiently, and
save your vehicle energy too?
00:00:12.690 --> 00:00:14.380
It's called ECO Cruise.

question: What is the benefit of using EcoCruise?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:17.860 --> 00:00:22.440
BLIS, or Blind Spot Information System,
is active anytime you put your vehicle in
00:00:22.440 --> 00:00:25.160
drive and are driving forward
above five miles per hour.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg2.mp4

video_name: Drive vs. Sport Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7I38idrdK2E
video_trans:
00:00:44.220 --> 00:00:46.456
Okay, now let's talk about SelectShift.
00:00:46.456 --> 00:00:47.911
[MUSIC]
00:00:47.911 --> 00:00:52.109
To use it,
move your gear shift to the S position.
00:00:52.109 --> 00:00:55.615
And press the plus-minus buttons on
the the side of the gear shift to
00:00:55.615 --> 00:00:56.425
select gears.
00:00:56.425 --> 00:01:00.255
Press plus to upshift and
minus to downshift.
00:01:00.255 --> 00:01:03.488
Keep in mind your engine will rev
at various speeds depending on
00:01:03.488 --> 00:01:05.080
what gear you've shifted to.
00:01:05.080 --> 00:01:07.638
If your engine RPM is too high or too low,
00:01:07.638 --> 00:01:11.408
your vehicle will automatically
make some shifts for you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Drive vs. Sport Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7I38idrdK2E_seg3.mp4
question: How do you use selection?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.279 --> 00:00:04.070
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.070 --> 00:00:07.650
Your vehicle may be equipped with the
feature that is designed to help alert you
00:00:07.650 --> 00:00:11.825
when a vehicle is in your blind spot while
travelling with or without a trailer.
00:00:11.825 --> 00:00:14.510
It can also alert you of
vehicles approaching when backing
00:00:14.510 --> 00:00:16.280
out of a parking space.
00:00:16.280 --> 00:00:17.860
Let me explain.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg1.mp4

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:34.270 --> 00:01:36.670
When you see yellow,
the Aid mode is active.
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.550
Then you'll feel the steering wheel move
a little to help direct you to steer
00:01:39.550 --> 00:01:40.350
back into you lane.
00:01:41.510 --> 00:01:43.660
If you see red, the Alert mode is active,
00:01:43.660 --> 00:01:46.030
and you'll feel
the steering wheel vibrate.
00:01:46.030 --> 00:01:48.490
And if you don't see any lines,
the system is off.
00:01:49.660 --> 00:01:50.630
And don't worry.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg7.mp4
question: What does the yellow line indicate that the steering wheel to do?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.130
Auto Start-Stop technology is always on
00:00:17.130 --> 00:00:20.450
unless you turn it off by pushing
the Auto Start-Stop off button.
00:00:20.450 --> 00:00:23.760
So, it will be active every
time you start your vehicle.
00:00:23.760 --> 00:00:25.390
When you put your foot
on the brake pedal and
00:00:25.390 --> 00:00:29.625
come to a full start, like at a red light,
your engine automatically shuts off.
00:00:29.625 --> 00:00:31.530
You might not even notice it.
00:00:31.530 --> 00:00:34.720
But a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know that it's off.
00:00:34.720 --> 00:00:36.920
And, once you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:36.920 --> 00:00:40.240
your car automatically
restarts without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w_seg2.mp4
question: When does your car automatically restart without delay.

Brake Controller, or TBC,

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:

Adaptive cruise control helps keep
a preset distance when in cruise control,
00:01:31.757 --> 00:01:35.994
plus when used in conjunction with tow
haul mode, it will increase the follow
00:01:35.994 --> 00:01:39.921
distance slightly to compensate for
more braking distance if needed.

video_trans:
00:00:47.480 --> 00:00:50.450
You also have an auto function
feature that automatically controls
00:00:50.450 --> 00:00:53.870
the temperature, air distribution and
air flow to reach and
00:00:53.870 --> 00:00:56.429
maintain a comfort level based on
the temperature that you selected.

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:03:34.680 --> 00:03:38.160
Okay, now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the systems
00:03:38.165 --> 00:03:42.200
information display using
the five-way steering wheel controls.
00:03:42.200 --> 00:03:46.380
To input the measurements you recorded
outside of the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:46.380 --> 00:03:49.900
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:49.900 --> 00:03:53.960
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed, like this.
00:03:53.960 --> 00:03:58.510
Then OK to confirm each measurement and
to and to move onto the next measurement.
00:03:58.510 --> 00:04:00.310
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:04:00.310 --> 00:04:03.740
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:04:03.740 --> 00:04:06.255
If correct select confirm and hit OK.
00:04:07.400 --> 00:04:10.570
Once you confirm the measurements
the system will automatically search for
00:04:10.570 --> 00:04:13.720
the sticker target and
highlight it with the red circle.
00:04:13.720 --> 00:04:15.990
A message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:04:15.990 --> 00:04:18.590
If it is, select Yes to confirm.
00:04:18.590 --> 00:04:21.730
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know set-up is complete and
00:04:21.730 --> 00:04:22.640
measurements are saved.
00:04:23.870 --> 00:04:26.850
If you do not see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:04:26.850 --> 00:04:29.210
Make sure the measurements are correct,
and that the trailer and
00:04:29.210 --> 00:04:31.530
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:04:31.530 --> 00:04:35.710
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straight forward between four and
00:04:35.710 --> 00:04:37.340
25 miles per hour as directed,
00:04:37.340 --> 00:04:41.100
until you get a message confirming
calibration is complete.
00:04:41.100 --> 00:04:44.100
Keep in mind,
once you input your trailer's information
00:04:44.100 --> 00:04:47.360
into the information display,
it is stored for easy recall.
00:04:47.360 --> 00:04:49.960
So, you'll only need to do this one time.
00:04:49.960 --> 00:04:52.868
Every additional trailer will
require repeating the process.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg5.mp4
question: How do I input measurements into the display?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:03:07.000 --> 00:03:09.700
Now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the system's
00:03:09.700 --> 00:03:10.640
information display.
00:03:11.720 --> 00:03:15.190
To input the measurements you recorded
outside the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:15.190 --> 00:03:18.540
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:18.540 --> 00:03:21.130
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed.
00:03:21.130 --> 00:03:24.444
Like this,
then OK to confirm each measurement and
00:03:24.444 --> 00:03:26.769
to move on to the next measurement.
00:03:26.769 --> 00:03:28.618
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:03:28.618 --> 00:03:31.761
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:03:31.761 --> 00:03:35.591
If correct, select Confirm and hit OK.
00:03:35.591 --> 00:03:39.573
Once you've confirmed the measurements,
the system will automatically search for
00:03:39.573 --> 00:03:42.172
the sticker target and
highlight it with a red circle and
00:03:42.172 --> 00:03:44.391
the message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:03:44.391 --> 00:03:47.495
If it is, select yes to confirm.
00:03:47.495 --> 00:03:50.762
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know setup is complete and
00:03:50.762 --> 00:03:51.927
measurements are saved.
00:03:51.927 --> 00:03:54.753
If you don't see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:03:54.753 --> 00:03:57.201
Make sure the measurements are correct and
that the trailer and
00:03:57.201 --> 00:03:59.115
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:03:59.115 --> 00:04:03.779
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straightforward between 4 and 25 miles per
00:04:03.779 --> 00:04:07.844
hour as directed until you get a message
confirming calibration is complete.
00:04:07.844 --> 00:04:08.911
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg6.mp4
question: How can you input the measurements into the systems information display?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:

Keep in mind, braking at any time turns
off the adaptive cruise control function
00:01:50.260 --> 00:01:52.860
and gives you manual control
of your speed again.

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:

Let me tell you about it. The message
center or the productivity screen
00:00:14.130 --> 00:00:17.920
has a 4.2 inch screen that's located
between the tachometer and speedometer.
00:00:19.030 --> 00:00:21.720
Use the five-way switch on the left
side of your steering wheel
00:00:21.720 --> 00:00:26.190
to scroll to the main menu. From here, you
can get to display mode, which shows
00:00:26.190 --> 00:00:29.940
you your distance to empty, transmission
temperature, tire pressure for
00:00:29.940 --> 00:00:34.570
each wheel, engine information,
MyKey status and a digital speedometer.

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.483
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.483 --> 00:00:07.630
How do I know if I have heated mirrors?
00:00:08.970 --> 00:00:10.330
>> How do I turn my heated mirrors on?
00:00:11.340 --> 00:00:14.300
>> Did you know that your vehicle may
have heated mirrors to help keep them
00:00:14.300 --> 00:00:15.790
clear in bad weather?
00:00:15.790 --> 00:00:18.080
You'll know you have them
if you see this icon.
00:00:18.080 --> 00:00:19.780
If you have power folding mirrors or
00:00:19.780 --> 00:00:23.600
Bliss, you'll still have heated mirrors
but you won't see the heated mirror icon.
00:00:23.600 --> 00:00:27.500
Instead, you'll either see this or this.

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:01:49.340 --> 00:01:54.030
Keep in mind, the charge port light
illumination will time out after 1 minute.
00:01:54.030 --> 00:01:57.439
If a fault is detected at any time,
all the lights will flash continuously.
00:01:58.760 --> 00:02:02.930
And if the charge scheduled for later,
the number of lights which represents your
00:02:02.930 --> 00:02:06.140
current minimum state of
charge will be solidly lit.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:08.550
And the charge port lights
will timeout after one minute.

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:00:13.370 --> 00:00:15.540
Once you've input
the correct measurements and
00:00:15.540 --> 00:00:18.270
placed the sticker as explained
in the how to set up video.
00:00:19.570 --> 00:00:21.130
When you shift into reverse,
00:00:21.130 --> 00:00:25.170
press the Camera button to expand
the menu options on the display screen.
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:28.420
Then press the Trailer icon and
select the trailer you want.
00:00:28.420 --> 00:00:34.030
You will then see the camera view on
the side where your trailer is moving,
00:00:34.030 --> 00:00:36.300
or both sides when the trailer
is directly behind you.
00:00:37.360 --> 00:00:41.960
Auto mode, which is the default mode,
changes views with the trailer direction.

working which you're programming,
00:01:23.630 --> 00:01:25.890
you'll have to hold the function
button while you press and
00:01:25.890 --> 00:01:28.380

00:01:28.380 --> 00:01:30.950
You'll see the indicator
light flash slowly at first
00:01:30.950 --> 00:01:34.590
then faster once the signal has
been sent and accepted again.

Still with me?

00:01:26.350 --> 00:01:30.560

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:34.270 --> 00:01:36.670
When you see yellow,
the Aid mode is active.
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.550
Then you'll feel the steering wheel move
a little to help direct you to steer
00:01:39.550 --> 00:01:40.350
back into you lane.
00:01:41.510 --> 00:01:43.660
If you see red, the Alert mode is active,
00:01:43.660 --> 00:01:46.030
and you'll feel
the steering wheel vibrate.
00:01:46.030 --> 00:01:48.490
And if you don't see any lines,
the system is off.
00:01:49.660 --> 00:01:50.630
And don't worry.

video_name: Using Sport Mode - Ford Trucks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYZKTkmXyro
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.263
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.263 --> 00:00:07.204
You may be interested to know that
your vehicle may be equipped with
00:00:07.204 --> 00:00:11.430
a feature to enhance its performance when
driven on hilly and mountainous roads.
00:00:11.430 --> 00:00:12.750
Let me explain.
00:00:12.750 --> 00:00:15.200
It's called Sport Mode,
and when activated,
00:00:15.200 --> 00:00:19.140
the transmission extends the duration
between shifts of the lower gears.
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:23.170
So the engine stays in the sweet spot
of the engine's RPM power band for
00:00:23.170 --> 00:00:25.580
a more spirited throttle response.
00:00:25.580 --> 00:00:27.350
So instead of constant up and
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.420
down gear shifts, the transmission
holds a specific gear longer for
00:00:31.420 --> 00:00:35.720
peak performance when driving on twisty,
rolling roads with a steep grade.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Sport Mode - Ford Trucks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYZKTkmXyro_seg1.mp4
question: How is the vehicle equipped to drive in hilly roads?

video_name: Drive vs. Sport Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7I38idrdK2E
video_trans:
00:00:18.653 --> 00:00:22.840
Here's how, to use Sport Mode,
move your gear shift to the S position.
00:00:22.840 --> 00:00:24.277
[MUSIC]
00:00:24.277 --> 00:00:27.210
It gives you extra braking on
various grades of road and
00:00:27.210 --> 00:00:30.864
lets you use lower gears if you're
on a hilly or mountainous drive.
00:00:30.864 --> 00:00:35.105
Keep in mind, Sport Mode shifts at
higher engine speeds than drive mode, so
00:00:35.105 --> 00:00:37.306
your engine may run faster than usual.
00:00:37.306 --> 00:00:39.697
But that doesn't mean
you've lost any power.
00:00:39.697 --> 00:00:44.220
And remember, your vehicle will stay in
Sport Mode until you shift out of it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Drive vs. Sport Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7I38idrdK2E_seg2.mp4
question: What is the specialty of sports mode?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:26.290 --> 00:00:28.460
When a vehicle enters into
a lane to the right or
00:00:28.460 --> 00:00:33.215
left, BLIS warns you with a solid light
on the corresponding side view mirror.
00:00:33.215 --> 00:00:36.115
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:37.155 --> 00:00:39.805
Also, whenever you
activate your turn signal,
00:00:39.805 --> 00:00:42.995
if a vehicle is within the blind
spot zone, BLIS will give you
00:00:42.995 --> 00:00:46.465
a flashing light warning on
the corresponding side view mirror.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg3.mp4
question: When will BLIS turn off the solid light?

video_trans:

To tumble the seats all the way into
the floor, pull the number 2 strap and
00:01:54.070 --> 00:01:57.030
the strap on the top of
the seat back at the same time.
