video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:00.980 --> 00:01:04.100
Okay, now I'll quickly discuss
the short strap mentioned earlier.
00:01:04.100 --> 00:01:07.460
To fold the second row seats from
the third row, pull the short strap, and
00:01:07.460 --> 00:01:09.980
the seat back will fold down forward.
00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780
Next, pull the longer
strap to unlock the seat.
00:01:12.780 --> 00:01:15.490
Now, push the seat forward and down.
00:01:15.490 --> 00:01:18.690
Your vehicle also has folding floor
support panels that makes stowing
00:01:18.690 --> 00:01:20.150
cargo easier.
00:01:20.150 --> 00:01:20.910
With the second and
00:01:20.910 --> 00:01:25.670
third row seats folded down, grab hold of
the panels and pull to disconnect them.
00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:28.740
You may need to give them a little tug
to disengage them from their magnetic
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:29.850
fasteners.
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:31.910
Then unfold like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg3.mp4

00:00:12.076 --> 00:00:16.030

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:00:15.740 --> 00:00:19.560
First press the lock button on your
key fob to lock all the doors.
00:00:20.620 --> 00:00:24.120
Then press the remote start button,
the one with the 2x icon two times.
00:00:24.120 --> 00:00:29.300
Your outside lights will flash twice and
then your car will start.
00:00:30.490 --> 00:00:31.340
For some vehicles,
00:00:31.340 --> 00:00:35.225
a light on your your remote will also let
you know if your car has started or not.
00:00:35.225 --> 00:00:37.235
Pretty convenient, right?

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:01:23.240 --> 00:01:24.670
One more thing.
00:01:24.670 --> 00:01:27.310
When storing summer tires,
be sure to store them
00:01:27.310 --> 00:01:32.024
away from direct heating devices where
the temperatures are above 19 degrees Fahrenheit
00:01:32.024 --> 00:01:36.900
as lower temperatures may
result in loss of rubber flexibility and
00:01:36.900 --> 00:01:39.470
develop surface cracks in the treads.
00:01:39.470 --> 00:01:43.636
If the tires have been stored and
conditioned at 19 degrees or cooler,
00:01:43.636 --> 00:01:47.190
warm them to 41 degrees Fahrenheit for
at least 24 hours
00:01:47.190 --> 00:01:50.510
before installing them on a vehicle or
checking the tire pressure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg3.mp4
question: Where do I store my tires?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:07.404
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.404 --> 00:00:10.866
The second and third row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded down
00:00:10.866 --> 00:00:13.800
when you need extra space for
transporting cargo.
00:00:13.800 --> 00:00:15.050
Here's how to do it.
00:00:15.050 --> 00:00:19.640
To fold the second row seats,
first push down the head restraints, like this.
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:24.793
Now, find the strap located on the side of
the seat back closest to the door, here.
00:00:24.793 --> 00:00:26.442
And pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:26.442 --> 00:00:28.665
[MUSIC]
00:00:28.665 --> 00:00:32.680
You'll notice that you have two straps on
the seat back, a long one and a short one.
00:00:32.680 --> 00:00:35.050
I'll tell you about the shorter one later.
00:00:35.050 --> 00:00:38.920
So, for now, find the longer strap and
pull up to unlock it.
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:41.850
Now, move the entire seat forward and
down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg1.mp4

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:15.650 --> 00:00:19.640
Adaptive cruise control maintains
a pre-set gap by adjusting the vehicle's
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:22.250
speed so you don't need to
constantly use your brake and
00:00:22.250 --> 00:00:25.340
accelerator to adjust with
the speed of traffic.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg2.mp4

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:01:39.921 --> 00:01:44.632
Adaptive steering helps reduce under steer
at higher speeds, while allowing the front
00:01:44.660 --> 00:01:48.720
wheels to turn fully with fewer turns
of the steering wheel at lower speeds.
00:01:48.720 --> 00:01:51.640
And when used with tow haul
the vehicle delays upshifts and
00:01:51.646 --> 00:01:55.359
provides engine breaking when descending
hilly roads with heavy loads.
00:01:55.359 --> 00:01:56.568
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg7.mp4

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:58.497 --> 00:01:01.470
Now, let's talk about Cross-Traffic alert.
00:01:01.470 --> 00:01:05.650
It warns you of moving cars coming from
either side when you're in reverse or
00:01:05.650 --> 00:01:09.550
backing up and gives you three warnings,
a light on the corresponding
00:01:09.550 --> 00:01:13.470
side view mirror, a chime, and
a message in your message center.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:16.970
Extreme weather conditions
could block the sensors, but
00:01:16.970 --> 00:01:20.370
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:01:20.370 --> 00:01:23.234
And keep in mind,
as with the most radar, infrared, and
00:01:23.234 --> 00:01:27.246
ultrasonic-type sensing system,
there is the possibility of false alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg4.mp4
question: What does the cross-traffic alert do?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:20.540
Before you begin, you'll need a few
things to help with the setup.
00:00:20.540 --> 00:00:25.230
Your supplied quick start setup guide with
measurement card, a tape measure, a pen or
00:00:25.230 --> 00:00:29.490
pencil, an assistant to help out if needed
as well as the checkered sticker that
00:00:29.490 --> 00:00:32.110
comes with your guide which
I'll tell you about later.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg2.mp4
question: WHat are some things I will need to get set up for hitching my trailer?

video_trans:
00:00:46.610 --> 00:00:49.360
To adjust the recline of
the second row seat backs,
00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:52.610
pull up on the handle on the side
of the seat closest to the door.
00:00:52.610 --> 00:00:56.180
And push the seat back back for
a greater recline, or forward for
00:00:56.180 --> 00:00:57.560
a more upright position.

video_trans:

To open all of your windows at once and
vent the moon roof if you have one,
00:00:19.831 --> 00:00:24.141
press and hold the unlock button on
your key fob for at least three seconds.
00:00:24.141 --> 00:00:27.449
If you want to stop them from opening,
just press the lock or
00:00:27.449 --> 00:00:28.738
unlock button again.
00:00:28.738 --> 00:00:30.999

Normal, which is the default mode, and

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
00:00:46.760 --> 00:00:49.690
To put the seats back into their
original upright position,
00:00:49.690 --> 00:00:53.640
unfasten the prop rod and
stow it back into the slot in the floor.
00:00:53.640 --> 00:00:57.700
Then pull the entire seat down and
press it into its locked position.
00:00:57.700 --> 00:00:59.410
You'll hear it click into place.
00:00:59.410 --> 00:01:03.220
Finally, pull up on the shorter strap
closest to the seat back side, and
00:01:03.220 --> 00:01:04.600
flip the seat back up.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg2.mp4

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:03:05.580 --> 00:03:08.610
To do so, touch the Alert button here.
00:03:08.610 --> 00:03:10.760
Then the Enable Alerts button.
00:03:10.760 --> 00:03:14.970
To set an alert, anytime you hear a song
or artist you want to be notified of,
00:03:14.970 --> 00:03:19.210
touch the Alert button,
choose either the artist, song title, or
00:03:19.210 --> 00:03:20.989
both, to add them to your alert.
00:03:22.030 --> 00:03:24.710
You'll get a message letting
you know they've been saved.
00:03:24.710 --> 00:03:26.470
Now, anytime that song or
00:03:26.470 --> 00:03:30.210
artist is being played on any channel
you'll receive a message on your screen
00:03:30.210 --> 00:03:35.150
asking if you'd like to tune to that
channel, delete, or disable alerts.

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:00:26.460 --> 00:00:29.570
To lock your doors, simply press
the sensor on the door handle for
00:00:29.570 --> 00:00:30.890
about a half a second.
00:00:30.890 --> 00:00:33.470
It'll have ridges or
a square sensor like this.
00:00:34.530 --> 00:00:36.300
When you hear them click,
you'll know they're locked.
00:00:37.450 --> 00:00:41.090
Or you can press the lock/unlock
button on the inside door panel
00:00:41.090 --> 00:00:44.280
before closing the door and
it will automatically lock.

video_name: How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.081 --> 00:00:03.902
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.902 --> 00:00:06.147
Your vehicle may be equipped
with power outlets,
00:00:06.147 --> 00:00:09.900
where you can charge devices like laptops,
rechargeable power tools, and more.
00:00:09.900 --> 00:00:12.030
Let me explain.
00:00:12.030 --> 00:00:14.190
There are two outlets in your vehicle.
00:00:14.190 --> 00:00:18.710
One in the instrument panel, here, and
one in the rear of the center console
00:00:18.710 --> 00:00:21.650
that is easily accessible for
someone in the back seat.
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:25.510
The outlets can charge when your truck is
running ,and can deliver up to 400 watts
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:29.650
when you're parked or idling, and
up to 300 watts when you're driving.
00:00:29.650 --> 00:00:33.970
Keep in mind, when using power tools,
the power outlets are only to be used for
00:00:33.970 --> 00:00:37.600
recharging and
should not be used as a main power source.
00:00:37.600 --> 00:00:38.303
Any questions?
00:00:38.303 --> 00:00:40.149
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:40.149 --> 00:00:50.149
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo_seg1.mp4
question: Where are the power outlets located?

video_name: Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.168
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.168 --> 00:00:07.829
Your Mustang has a feature that measures
the rate at which your car decelerates for
00:00:07.829 --> 00:00:10.130
an improved track experience.
00:00:10.130 --> 00:00:14.310
It's called Brake Performance, which
measures your stopping time and distance.
00:00:14.310 --> 00:00:17.500
To get to it, go to Track Apps
in your information display,
00:00:17.500 --> 00:00:19.590
scroll to Brake Performance, and press OK.
00:00:20.590 --> 00:00:26.490
Then choose whether you want to record
60 to 0, or 100 to 0, and hit OK.
00:00:26.490 --> 00:00:30.520
You'll then be instructed on how to
acquire your car's braking performance.
00:00:30.520 --> 00:00:34.660
First, you'll be instructed to
accelerate to or above the set speed.
00:00:34.660 --> 00:00:38.620
Once the speed has been reached,
it'll instruct you to hit the brakes.
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:40.748
Once you've come to a complete stop,
00:00:40.748 --> 00:00:44.815
your braking performance results will
be posted in the message center.
00:00:44.815 --> 00:00:45.870
Any questions?
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.022
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.022 --> 00:00:58.022
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs_seg1.mp4
question: What feature measures the rate at which your car decelerates?

video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:30.320 --> 00:00:34.199
And select either Auto, which extends or
retracts every time you open or
00:00:34.199 --> 00:00:35.160
close the doors.
00:00:35.160 --> 00:00:37.096
Out, to keep them open all the time,
00:00:37.096 --> 00:00:41.120
which can be helpful when
accessing items from a roof rack.
00:00:41.120 --> 00:00:45.570
Or Off, to disable them, which is
useful if you're using a hoist or jack.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs_seg3.mp4
question: When is the off option useful?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:13.790 --> 00:00:16.520
Brake Coach works to help you
maximize the amount of energy
00:00:16.520 --> 00:00:19.350
captured through your
regenerative braking system.
00:00:19.350 --> 00:00:21.910
Regenerative braking works with
your standard brake system by
00:00:21.910 --> 00:00:25.170
recovering energy that is usually
lost through your friction brakes and
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:27.350
engine drag during braking or coasting.
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.810
And then storing that recovered energy
in your battery to help maximize efficiency.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg2.mp4
question: How does Brake Coach work?

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:00:17.482 --> 00:00:22.109
There are a few in vehicle technology
features that can aid you when hooking up,
00:00:22.109 --> 00:00:25.160
backing up, and
maneuvering an attached trailer.
00:00:25.160 --> 00:00:29.640
The available center high mounted stop
lamp camera offers an elevated perspective
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:34.000
and dynamic center guidelines to help line
up your vehicle with the fifth wheel or
00:00:34.000 --> 00:00:35.160
gooseneck trailer.
00:00:35.160 --> 00:00:40.120
There's also a 360 degree camera feature
that delivers multiple views from
00:00:40.120 --> 00:00:42.139
the top down and all four sides
00:00:42.140 --> 00:00:46.180
as well as  a customer placed trailer
camera kit option that can be mounted to
00:00:46.180 --> 00:00:47.540
the rear of your trailer,
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:51.100
that provides added driver convenience
when backing up a trailer.
00:00:51.120 --> 00:00:55.160
And they all can be viewed on
the center stack console display screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the backup camera located?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:18.866 --> 00:02:23.348
To switch between adaptive cruise control
or normal cruise use the 5-way switch on
00:02:23.348 --> 00:02:26.134
your steering wheel and
the information displays.
00:02:26.134 --> 00:02:30.544
Select Driver Assist, Cruise Control,
then select Adaptive to enable,
00:02:30.544 --> 00:02:33.847
or in Normal for
a conventional cruise control system.
00:02:33.847 --> 00:02:36.399
Meaning, it will not
automatically adjust speed,
00:02:36.399 --> 00:02:38.782
based on the speed of
the vehicle in front of you.

video_trans:
00:01:13.290 --> 00:01:17.170
And to help give you control of how long
your car stays running, you can program
00:01:17.170 --> 00:01:21.910
your engine to run in five, ten, or
15 minute intervals using the five way
00:01:21.910 --> 00:01:26.300

to navigate through the settings menu.
00:01:26.300 --> 00:01:28.010
And if you want some extra run time,
00:01:28.010 --> 00:01:31.820
you can repeat the remote
start process to extend it.

video_trans:

lights to stay on that long,
00:00:48.467 --> 00:00:51.260
you could always change the duration.
00:00:51.260 --> 00:00:55.306
Just go to the message center,
scroll to Settings, Lightning and
00:00:55.306 --> 00:00:56.687
then Autolamp Delay.
00:00:56.687 --> 00:01:00.422
Here you can select the length of
time you want them to stay on for.

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.183 --> 00:00:07.223
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.223 --> 00:00:10.453
The second row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded up or
00:00:10.453 --> 00:00:12.770
even removed for extra cargo space.
00:00:12.770 --> 00:00:14.480
Let me show you how to do it.
00:00:14.480 --> 00:00:16.400
To fold the second row seats forward,
00:00:16.400 --> 00:00:18.450
first push down the head
restraints like this.
00:00:19.530 --> 00:00:23.830
Now, find the strap located on the side
of the seat back closest to the door,
00:00:23.830 --> 00:00:26.260
here, and
pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:27.670 --> 00:00:32.380
Next, find the longer strap located in the
center of the backside of the seat back.
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:35.610
Pull up to unlock it,
then lift the entire seat up to tumble it.
00:00:36.980 --> 00:00:39.820
Now, secure the seat by
locating the prop rod
00:00:39.820 --> 00:00:42.470
directly below the seat inside the floor.
00:00:42.470 --> 00:00:45.530
Lift it out and snap it onto
the prop rod latch, like this.

video_trans:
00:00:29.510 --> 00:00:32.320
Electric range is the estimated
distance you can travel
00:00:32.320 --> 00:00:35.280
while in plug-in power
mode with the engine off.
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:38.180
This range is based on
calculations determined by
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:43.090
the amount of energy stored in the battery
and the energy being used while driving.

00:00:14.840 --> 00:00:16.150

00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:20.250

the climate control system off and on.
00:00:20.250 --> 00:00:24.370

button that let's you switch between
00:00:24.370 --> 00:00:27.450
outside air and
air circulating within the car.
00:00:27.450 --> 00:00:30.395
A distribution control that lets you
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:30.395 --> 00:00:34.505
come through the dashboard vents,
the floor vents, the defrost
00:00:34.505 --> 00:00:39.085
vent at the base of the windshield,
or a combination of multiple vents.
00:00:39.085 --> 00:00:41.552
An air conditioning or AC, button.
00:00:41.552 --> 00:00:44.288
Max defrost and rear defrost buttons.
00:00:44.288 --> 00:00:45.850
And a max A/C button.

video_name: Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA
video_trans:
00:00:11.960 --> 00:00:14.580
First, keep in mind that
convertible top fabric
00:00:14.580 --> 00:00:16.710
does not promote mildew growth itself.
00:00:16.710 --> 00:00:20.705
Mildew may develop on dirt or
other foreign substances if not removed.
00:00:20.705 --> 00:00:25.090
So keeping the fabric clean through
regular washings will enhance the life and
00:00:25.090 --> 00:00:26.696
beauty of the top material.
00:00:26.696 --> 00:00:29.595
When washing vehicles
with cloth top roofs.
00:00:29.595 --> 00:00:33.012
Start by vacuuming with a soft
bristle brush attachment and
00:00:33.012 --> 00:00:35.070
be sure to use a non detergent soap.
00:00:35.070 --> 00:00:40.925
Scrub gently in a circular pattern using
a terrycloth towel or soft bristle brush.
00:00:40.925 --> 00:00:44.030
More specifically horse hair or
soft nylon.
00:00:44.030 --> 00:00:45.950
Do not use stiff bristle brushes or
00:00:45.950 --> 00:00:49.420
any abrasive materials or
cleaners as they can damage the fabric.
00:00:50.840 --> 00:00:54.760
When finished, rinse thoroughly
removing all soap residues.
00:00:54.760 --> 00:00:59.040
Allow the top to air dry completely
before folding it otherwise, mold or
00:00:59.040 --> 00:01:02.340
mildew may develop and
discolor the cloth material.
00:01:02.340 --> 00:01:07.090
To clean away lint debris like cottonwood,
use a standard clothes lint roller or
00:01:07.090 --> 00:01:09.320
a vacuum attachment with
a soft bristle brush.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA_seg2.mp4
question: What type of brush should I use to clean my soft top?

video_name: Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.168
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.168 --> 00:00:07.829
Your Mustang has a feature that measures
the rate at which your car decelerates for
00:00:07.829 --> 00:00:10.130
an improved track experience.
00:00:10.130 --> 00:00:14.310
It's called Brake Performance, which
measures your stopping time and distance.
00:00:14.310 --> 00:00:17.500
To get to it, go to Track Apps
in your information display,
00:00:17.500 --> 00:00:19.590
scroll to Brake Performance, and press OK.
00:00:20.590 --> 00:00:26.490
Then choose whether you want to record
60 to 0, or 100 to 0, and hit OK.
00:00:26.490 --> 00:00:30.520
You'll then be instructed on how to
acquire your car's braking performance.
00:00:30.520 --> 00:00:34.660
First, you'll be instructed to
accelerate to or above the set speed.
00:00:34.660 --> 00:00:38.620
Once the speed has been reached,
it'll instruct you to hit the brakes.
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:40.748
Once you've come to a complete stop,
00:00:40.748 --> 00:00:44.815
your braking performance results will
be posted in the message center.
00:00:44.815 --> 00:00:45.870
Any questions?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:04.630 --> 00:00:07.470
Did you know that there are a few
things you can do to maximize
00:00:07.470 --> 00:00:10.140
the electric range of your
plug in hybrid vehicle?
00:00:10.140 --> 00:00:13.560
As with any vehicle, there are some
basic rules you can follow.
00:00:13.560 --> 00:00:14.980
Let me explain.
00:00:14.980 --> 00:00:18.350
For starters, make sure to keep
your tires properly inflated,
00:00:18.350 --> 00:00:22.610
accelerate gradually from a stop,
brake smoothly, use heat and
00:00:22.610 --> 00:00:26.130
air conditioning moderately,
and maintain the speed limit.

00:00:07.520 --> 00:00:09.500

to turn on automatically?
00:00:10.530 --> 00:00:14.620

Your headlamps will automatically turn

when natural light decreases.

video_name: Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc
video_trans:
00:00:11.450 --> 00:00:13.100
Using the information display, and
00:00:13.100 --> 00:00:16.150
the five way control switch on
the left side of your steering wheel,
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:19.500
you can choose whether you want
your running lamps on or off.
00:00:19.500 --> 00:00:24.380
Just scroll to Settings, Vehicle,
Lighting, then Daytime Lights.
00:00:24.380 --> 00:00:26.750
If you have your daytime
running lamps set to on and
00:00:26.750 --> 00:00:30.430
want to use them, turn the lighting
control to the auto lamp position.
00:00:30.430 --> 00:00:34.110
When the lighting control is in auto lamp
position, and the head lamps are off,
00:00:34.110 --> 00:00:37.099
the daytime running lamps will turn
on automatically when you're driving.
00:00:38.530 --> 00:00:41.770
And will switch between daytime
running lamps and headlamps as needed.
00:00:41.770 --> 00:00:45.150
Based on how light or dark it is outside,
and whether or not the wipers are on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the 5-way control switch?

00:01:35.360 --> 00:01:38.370
and adjust the temperature for
the passenger side.

An amber light will illuminate
to let you know it's on.
00:01:40.340 --> 00:01:44.270
And you'll see the temperature displayed
in the upper right corner of the screen.
00:01:44.270 --> 00:01:46.560
But, the driver's
temperature will not change.

video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:45.570 --> 00:00:48.950
There are a few things that you may
need to know to prevent damaging them.
00:00:48.950 --> 00:00:51.430
Before you put a jack
underneath your vehicle,
00:00:51.430 --> 00:00:54.790
you'll need to ensure that the power
running boards are turned off.
00:00:54.790 --> 00:00:58.400
Also, when using a jack,
be sure to check your owner's manual for
00:00:58.400 --> 00:01:00.440
proper mounting locations.
00:01:00.440 --> 00:01:04.510
And when using a hoist lift be sure to
place the lift arms under the frame rails
00:01:04.510 --> 00:01:09.130
at all times to avoid damage to the under
body and running board components.
00:01:09.130 --> 00:01:10.250
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs_seg4.mp4
question: How to put a jack?

your keypad looks almost invisible.

Keep in mind with a touch sensitive pad
you want to press the keypad numbers

Lifting your finger off completely

pressing the right code.

00:00:55.110 --> 00:00:58.435

00:00:58.435 --> 00:00:59.320

00:01:09.320 --> 00:01:13.020

to reach your set temperature.

video_name: Easy Fuel Capless Fuel Filler _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Eh3snbTNR1k
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.456
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.456 --> 00:00:07.616
Your vehicle has a capless fuel filler
that saves time at the pump and
00:00:07.616 --> 00:00:09.680
keeps your hands cleaner.
00:00:09.680 --> 00:00:13.010
There's no cap to twist off and
it's simple to use.
00:00:13.010 --> 00:00:16.510
Just open your fuel door by either
putting a finger under the exposed tab
00:00:16.510 --> 00:00:17.530
on the door.
00:00:17.530 --> 00:00:19.800
Or by pushing it in a bit
until it releases and
00:00:19.800 --> 00:00:21.470
you can open it the rest of the way.
00:00:21.470 --> 00:00:25.440
Insert the nozzle all the way,
making sure it goes through both flaps.
00:00:25.440 --> 00:00:29.290
Fill up, then wait five seconds
before removing the nozzle and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:30.780
close the fuel door.
00:00:30.780 --> 00:00:32.840
If you're using a portable fuel container,
00:00:32.840 --> 00:00:36.160
you'll need to use the easy fuel funnel
provided with your vehicle to avoid
00:00:36.160 --> 00:00:38.470
damaging the seals on
the spring loaded flaps.
00:00:39.540 --> 00:00:43.720
And one more thing, to help protect
against fuel theft, splashing, or
00:00:43.720 --> 00:00:47.770
water getting in the tank, the capless
fuel filler is tamper resistant.
00:00:47.770 --> 00:00:51.440
And the self closing, spring loaded flaps
help keep fuel from sloshing out and
00:00:51.440 --> 00:00:54.550
water from leaking in when it rains or
when you wash your vehicle.
00:00:54.550 --> 00:00:55.650
Any questions?
00:00:55.650 --> 00:00:56.919
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:56.919 --> 00:01:06.919
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Easy Fuel Capless Fuel Filler _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Eh3snbTNR1k_seg1.mp4
question: How do I open the fuel door?

00:00:54.032 --> 00:00:56.484
If you want to change the factory
code to something that's easier for
00:00:56.484 --> 00:00:57.849
you to remember, you can do that too.
00:00:57.849 --> 00:00:58.848
[MUSIC]
00:00:58.848 --> 00:01:03.598
Just enter the factory code, press 1 2,
then enter your new code and
00:01:03.598 --> 00:01:07.478
your personal code will be
saved to position number one.
00:01:07.478 --> 00:01:10.699
If you're going to program
more than one code,
00:01:10.699 --> 00:01:14.725
press 1 2 after you entered
your first new code to save it,
00:01:14.725 --> 00:01:19.496
then enter a second personal code and
press3 4 to save it, and so on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q_seg4.mp4
question: How to change the factory code to something different?

video_name: Storage   Mustang _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oF8We3Di4Z0
video_trans:
00:00:09.970 --> 00:00:11.860
For starters,
there's a storage compartment for
00:00:11.860 --> 00:00:14.215
your sunglasses just to
the left of the steering wheel.
00:00:14.215 --> 00:00:17.339
To open it, just push in on the door,
then pull it open.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Storage   Mustang _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oF8We3Di4Z0_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the storage compartment for sunglasses located?

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:01:10.071 --> 00:01:13.546
To access the battery compartment
on Transit Wagon models,
00:01:13.546 --> 00:01:17.973
first remove the protective plastic
molding, by pulling up on the tabs, and
00:01:17.973 --> 00:01:19.420
sliding it towards you.
00:01:19.420 --> 00:01:23.326
Next, lift the fabric covered trim by
pulling up on the tabs, and tuck, or
00:01:23.326 --> 00:01:25.074
fold it to keep it out of your way.
00:01:25.074 --> 00:01:28.962
You'll need to remove the rear metal
battery cover by unscrewing two fastening
00:01:28.962 --> 00:01:30.130
bolts, here and here.
00:01:31.350 --> 00:01:34.113
Next, unfasten the two electrical cords,
00:01:34.113 --> 00:01:38.526
by unclipping them from the fasteners
like this, and remove the bar.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg4.mp4
question: What are the steps needed to access the battery compartment on transit wagon models?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:40.620 --> 00:01:44.480
When in reverse, you can change the camera
view you see by using the camera button on
00:01:44.480 --> 00:01:48.280
the dash above the screen and pushing
it until you get the view you want.
00:01:48.280 --> 00:01:51.390
Keep in mind, the change camera view
function only works when you're
00:01:51.390 --> 00:01:55.210
driving forward at six miles per hour or
below for safety purposes.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg9.mp4
question: how to change the camera view in reverse?

video_name: Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.168
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.168 --> 00:00:07.829
Your Mustang has a feature that measures
the rate at which your car decelerates for
00:00:07.829 --> 00:00:10.130
an improved track experience.
00:00:10.130 --> 00:00:14.310
It's called Brake Performance, which
measures your stopping time and distance.
00:00:14.310 --> 00:00:17.500
To get to it, go to Track Apps
in your information display,
00:00:17.500 --> 00:00:19.590
scroll to Brake Performance, and press OK.
00:00:20.590 --> 00:00:26.490
Then choose whether you want to record
60 to 0, or 100 to 0, and hit OK.
00:00:26.490 --> 00:00:30.520
You'll then be instructed on how to
acquire your car's braking performance.
00:00:30.520 --> 00:00:34.660
First, you'll be instructed to
accelerate to or above the set speed.
00:00:34.660 --> 00:00:38.620
Once the speed has been reached,
it'll instruct you to hit the brakes.
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:40.748
Once you've come to a complete stop,
00:00:40.748 --> 00:00:44.815
your braking performance results will
be posted in the message center.
00:00:44.815 --> 00:00:45.870
Any questions?
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.022
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.022 --> 00:00:58.022
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs_seg1.mp4
question: Where can I find the break performance option?

video_name: Center High Mounted Stop Lamp (CHMSL) Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Zbm44fDvSB0
video_trans:
00:00:47.945 --> 00:00:52.325
For added convenience, there's also a LED
cargo light to help illuminate the rear
00:00:52.325 --> 00:00:54.570
area when hitching a trailer at night.
00:00:54.570 --> 00:00:58.196
Just press the button located to
the left of the headlamp control, here,
00:00:58.196 --> 00:00:58.906
to turn it on.
00:00:58.906 --> 00:01:03.220
Or the light button located
in the rear box, here.

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:19.140
To turn it on, using the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:22.070
scroll down to Track Apps,
then Launch Control.
00:00:22.070 --> 00:00:24.232
[MUSIC]
00:00:24.232 --> 00:00:27.330
There, you'll see Launch Control and
RPM set.
00:00:27.330 --> 00:00:29.290
The RPM feature allows you to set and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:35.030
hold a preferred RPM to launch at,
anywhere between 3,000 and 4,500 RPMs.
00:00:35.030 --> 00:00:38.410
To select your RPM,
use the up and down arrows.
00:00:38.410 --> 00:00:41.490
This helps you control the amount of
torque distributed to the rear wheels
00:00:41.490 --> 00:00:44.570
based on engine speed,
tire temperature and
00:00:44.570 --> 00:00:46.645
surface condition to
help prevent wheel spin.
00:00:46.645 --> 00:00:47.540
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg2.mp4
question: How do I set my preferred RPM in the menu?

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:01:10.090 --> 00:01:10.830
When braking or
00:01:10.830 --> 00:01:14.970
coasting, you'll see power flow back from
the drive train to charge the battery.
00:01:14.970 --> 00:01:17.890
This represents active
regenerative braking.
00:01:17.890 --> 00:01:21.030
When more power is needed,
the gasoline engine will turn on.
00:01:21.030 --> 00:01:24.650
For instance, when driving on a highway,
under heavy acceleration,
00:01:24.650 --> 00:01:28.670
driving in low gear, or
while the battery is in charge mode
00:01:28.670 --> 00:01:32.180
you'll see a gray power flow cap
when it's switched to hybrid power.
00:01:32.180 --> 00:01:37.063
The flow begins at the fuel tank, and goes
to the engine, and then to the wheels.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg4.mp4
question: When can you notice the car switch the energy system?

video_name: Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI
video_trans:
00:00:44.679 --> 00:00:45.591
And one more thing.
00:00:45.591 --> 00:00:50.590
If for any reason it doesn't engage
reverse gear, press the clutch pedal down,
00:00:50.590 --> 00:00:55.532
take it out of gear, release the clutch
pedal, then repeat the process again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI_seg3.mp4

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:50.630 --> 00:01:53.520
Using the turn signal for
lane changes deactivates it.
00:01:53.520 --> 00:01:57.720
So it won't interfere in daily
driving with frequent turns and stops.
00:01:57.720 --> 00:02:01.630
Keep in mind, if you're driving and
don't have a firm grip on the wheel, or
00:02:01.630 --> 00:02:05.360
if you're on a straight part of the road
that doesn't require much steering input,
00:02:05.360 --> 00:02:09.290
the car may think you're not holding on,
and may alert you to do so.
00:02:09.290 --> 00:02:10.400
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg8.mp4

In fact, there are four different
gaps that you can choose from,

00:01:11.504 --> 00:01:14.031

To turn adaptive cruise control on,
press and
00:00:27.780 --> 00:00:30.690
release the on off switch
on your steering wheel.
00:00:30.690 --> 00:00:33.560
The information display will
show a gray indicator light
00:00:33.560 --> 00:00:35.470

00:00:35.470 --> 00:00:38.170

00:00:38.170 --> 00:00:40.720
press the set button on your wheel and
release.

Then take your foot off the accelerator.

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:48.160 --> 00:00:49.250
Keep in mind,
00:00:49.250 --> 00:00:53.440
there are some factors that affect the
amount of energy being used while driving.
00:00:53.440 --> 00:00:57.330
For instance, mild or
aggressive acceleration or braking,
00:00:57.330 --> 00:01:01.905
your vehicle's speed, how much you use
accessories, such as climate control.
00:01:01.905 --> 00:01:06.232
The ambient temperature and other weather
conditions, as well as whether you're
00:01:06.232 --> 00:01:09.335
driving in the city or
on the highway, and the road grades.
00:01:09.335 --> 00:01:10.463
Any questions?

video_name: Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.359 --> 00:00:03.800
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.800 --> 00:00:07.792
Your transit's fuel door is conveniently
located inside the driver's door for
00:00:07.792 --> 00:00:09.550
quick and easy fill ups.
00:00:09.550 --> 00:00:13.380
To open the fuel filler door,
the driver's door must be open.
00:00:13.380 --> 00:00:16.990
Once it is, place your finger under
the filler door tab and pull.
00:00:16.990 --> 00:00:19.770
You'll notice it has the Easy Fuel
capless fuel filler, so
00:00:19.770 --> 00:00:21.870
there's no cap to twist off.
00:00:21.870 --> 00:00:23.970
Just insert the fuel
pump nozzle all they way,
00:00:23.970 --> 00:00:28.040
making sure it passes through both
spring-loaded flaps, then fill up.
00:00:28.040 --> 00:00:31.550
Once it's stopped filling, wait about
ten seconds before removing the nozzle,
00:00:31.550 --> 00:00:34.020
to allow any residual to drain out.
00:00:34.020 --> 00:00:36.690
Remove the nozzle and close the fuel door.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0_seg1.mp4
question: How to open the fuel filler door ?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:01:13.290 --> 00:01:17.170
And to help give you control of how long
your car stays running, you can program
00:01:17.170 --> 00:01:21.910
your engine to run in five, ten, or
15 minute intervals using the five way
00:01:21.910 --> 00:01:26.300
steering wheel controls on the left side

00:01:26.300 --> 00:01:28.010
And if you want some extra run time,
00:01:28.010 --> 00:01:31.820
you can repeat the remote
start process to extend it.

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:00:30.900 --> 00:00:33.885
To set up and receive a vehicle
health report via your email,
00:00:33.885 --> 00:00:36.690
you'll first need to login
to your owner account.
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:39.990
If you've not logged in before,
you'll need to register.
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:43.550
Just your name, email address, ZIP code,
00:00:43.550 --> 00:00:48.480
your vehicle identification number or
VIN and your mobile phone number.
00:00:48.480 --> 00:00:52.230
Once you've logged in, click on
the Service and Maintenance tab to set up
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:57.560
reports, then Vehicle Health Report and
click Manage Notifications.
00:00:57.560 --> 00:01:01.810
Then you may need to scroll down the page
and select Email a detailed summary.
00:01:01.810 --> 00:01:03.510
Finally, click Save.
00:01:03.510 --> 00:01:05.660
Now, you're ready to
receive email updates.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg2.mp4
question: How can I receive a Vehicle Health Report via email?

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:00:12.100 --> 00:00:14.900
>> Your car has a few features
that automatically lock or
00:00:14.900 --> 00:00:16.770
unlock all of your doors.
00:00:16.770 --> 00:00:19.910
Autolock will lock all of your doors
when your vehicle is moving and
00:00:19.910 --> 00:00:23.270
reaches a preset speed, and
Auto Unlock will unlock all
00:00:23.270 --> 00:00:26.970
of the doors when the car is turned
off and the driver's door is opened.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg2.mp4
question: What does the auto-unlock feature do?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: What control do I use to get to the information on demand screen?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:27.410 --> 00:00:29.194
When a vehicle enters into your left or
00:00:29.194 --> 00:00:32.561
right adjacent lane radar sensors in
the rear of the vehicle detect it.
00:00:32.561 --> 00:00:35.482
And BLIS warns you with a solid
light on the corresponding side
00:00:35.482 --> 00:00:39.060
view mirror when the vehicle
is within blind spot zone.
00:00:39.060 --> 00:00:41.860
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:43.250 --> 00:00:44.615
When you activate your turn signal,
00:00:44.615 --> 00:00:48.070
BLIS will give you a secondary flashing
light warning on the corresponding
00:00:48.070 --> 00:00:50.590
side view mirror when a vehicle's
within the blind spot zone.
00:00:51.854 --> 00:00:55.264
And remember, the system only
warns you of motorized vehicles,
00:00:55.264 --> 00:00:58.497
it does not detect bicycles,
pedestrians or other objects.

00:00:43.575 --> 00:00:45.910
SelectShift will automatically
make some shifts for
00:00:45.910 --> 00:00:50.190
you, if your enter speed is to high,
or if your RPMs are too low.
00:00:50.190 --> 00:00:52.970
And once you've gone into Sport Mode,
00:00:52.970 --> 00:00:55.470
your car will stay there until
you shift back to Drive Mode.

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:01:31.820 --> 00:01:34.530
And here are some important
facts you should know.
00:01:34.530 --> 00:01:39.180
On certain vehicles, the system only
allows up to two remote starts an hour or
00:01:39.180 --> 00:01:41.020
between manual starts.
00:01:41.020 --> 00:01:43.730
On others, you can only run your car for
00:01:43.730 --> 00:01:48.030
35 minutes with remote start before
you need to manually start it.

video_name: USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c
video_trans:
00:00:25.360 --> 00:00:29.640
Unlike traditional USB charging ports
that provide 500 milliamps of power and
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:31.060
can only charge a smartphone or
00:00:31.060 --> 00:00:35.260
media player, smart USB chargers can
provide up to two amps, and know just
00:00:35.260 --> 00:00:38.080
the right amount of power to deliver
to whatever device you're charging.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.743
Meaning, if you have one device plugged
in that needs two amps to charge, and
00:00:42.743 --> 00:00:46.255
another plugged in at the same time
that only needs one amp to fully charge,
00:00:46.255 --> 00:00:49.029
your smart USB port will deliver
the right amount to both.
00:00:49.029 --> 00:00:52.292
And that can help save battery power for
your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c_seg3.mp4
question: how many amps are available?

video_trans:
00:01:50.650 --> 00:01:54.288
To heat your car up and defrost
the windshield and side windows quickly,
00:01:54.288 --> 00:01:58.296
adjust the temperature control to your
desired setting or select max defrost.
00:01:58.296 --> 00:02:01.446
This will automatically turn your
air distribution to defrost,
00:02:01.446 --> 00:02:06.180
set the temperature to the hottest level
and the air flow to the maximum setting.
00:02:06.180 --> 00:02:10.650
In mild or warm temperatures you may
notice that your A/C also turns on.
00:02:10.650 --> 00:02:13.320
It does this to help dehumidify
the air for defogging.

00:01:16.778 --> 00:01:21.304

00:01:21.304 --> 00:01:22.244

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.

video_name: Using Sport Mode - Ford Trucks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYZKTkmXyro
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.263
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.263 --> 00:00:07.204
You may be interested to know that
your vehicle may be equipped with
00:00:07.204 --> 00:00:11.430
a feature to enhance its performance when
driven on hilly and mountainous roads.
00:00:11.430 --> 00:00:12.750
Let me explain.
00:00:12.750 --> 00:00:15.200
It's called Sport Mode,
and when activated,
00:00:15.200 --> 00:00:19.140
the transmission extends the duration
between shifts of the lower gears.
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:23.170
So the engine stays in the sweet spot
of the engine's RPM power band for
00:00:23.170 --> 00:00:25.580
a more spirited throttle response.
00:00:25.580 --> 00:00:27.350
So instead of constant up and
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.420
down gear shifts, the transmission
holds a specific gear longer for
00:00:31.420 --> 00:00:35.720
peak performance when driving on twisty,
rolling roads with a steep grade.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Sport Mode - Ford Trucks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYZKTkmXyro_seg1.mp4
question: What is the sport mode feature?

back in to a parking perpendicular or

Just press the Active Park Assist

Signal to indicate which side you want to
park on, then simply follow the prompts
00:01:26.350 --> 00:01:30.560

shifting, and braking as needed.

press the dual-zone button or just turn
the knob to activate Dual-Zone control,
00:01:35.360 --> 00:01:38.370
and adjust the temperature for
the passenger side.
00:01:38.370 --> 00:01:40.340
An amber light will illuminate
to let you know it's on.
00:01:40.340 --> 00:01:44.270
And you'll see the temperature displayed
in the upper right corner of the screen.
00:01:44.270 --> 00:01:46.560
But, the driver's
temperature will not change.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg7.mp4
question: What light shows temp of passenger side.

video_trans:
00:00:37.440 --> 00:00:40.470
First, make sure your window
is closed all the way.
00:00:40.470 --> 00:00:43.300
Then, pull and hold the window
switch up for two seconds and
00:00:43.300 --> 00:00:44.510
repeat that two second hold.

Did you know you can open or
00:00:05.774 --> 00:00:09.400
close your window all the way without

00:00:09.400 --> 00:00:11.190

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg3.mp4
question: What happens if you don't react to a potential collision?

if you're trying to line up
00:01:42.830 --> 00:01:44.780
your vehicle with something,
like a trailer.

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:15.680 --> 00:00:19.000
The trailer brake controller
automatically applies the trailer brakes
00:00:19.000 --> 00:00:21.610
when the tow vehicles brakes are pressed.
00:00:21.610 --> 00:00:24.760
The TBC control is located
on your center console.
00:00:24.760 --> 00:00:29.360
It has a manual control lever that sends
independent power to the trailer's brakes,
00:00:29.360 --> 00:00:31.170
and a plus and minus button.
00:00:31.170 --> 00:00:33.490
Pressing either of them
adjusts how much or
00:00:33.490 --> 00:00:36.940
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:36.940 --> 00:00:38.990
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:38.990 --> 00:00:41.670
lower the gain setting continuously.
00:00:41.670 --> 00:00:42.760
Still with me?
00:00:42.760 --> 00:00:43.880
Okay, then let's move on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg2.mp4
question: What does the trailer brake system do?

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:51.980 --> 00:00:55.130
In addition to being able to personalize
your left side screen choices,
00:00:55.130 --> 00:00:58.734
there are also a few screens that
are only available in MyView.
00:00:58.734 --> 00:01:03.010
Like Accessory Power, which indicates the
electrical power demands being put on your
00:01:03.010 --> 00:01:04.650
vehicle from your climate system, and
00:01:04.650 --> 00:01:08.680
other accessories like your radio,
headlights, and windshield wipers.
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.700
Coolant temp, which indicates if your
engine temperature is normal, or high.
00:01:12.700 --> 00:01:16.550
Keep in mind, whichever two choices you
select, the far right side of the screen
00:01:16.550 --> 00:01:19.540
will always display your fuel gauge and
battery gauge.
00:01:19.540 --> 00:01:20.860
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM_seg3.mp4
question: What screens are only available in MyView?

video_trans:
00:00:30.999 --> 00:00:35.018
To close all of your windows and
your moon roof, press and
00:00:35.018 --> 00:00:38.295
hold the lock button for
at least two seconds.
00:00:38.295 --> 00:00:41.124
To stop your windows from closing,
00:00:41.124 --> 00:00:45.151
just press the lock or
unlock button on the fob.
00:00:45.151 --> 00:00:46.241
And just so you know,
00:00:46.241 --> 00:00:49.940
the bounce back function is also active

00:00:49.940 --> 00:00:53.655

Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:27.410 --> 00:00:29.194
When a vehicle enters into your left or
00:00:29.194 --> 00:00:32.561
right adjacent lane radar sensors in
the rear of the vehicle detect it.
00:00:32.561 --> 00:00:35.482
And BLIS warns you with a solid
light on the corresponding side
00:00:35.482 --> 00:00:39.060
view mirror when the vehicle
is within blind spot zone.
00:00:39.060 --> 00:00:41.860
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:43.250 --> 00:00:44.615
When you activate your turn signal,
00:00:44.615 --> 00:00:48.070
BLIS will give you a secondary flashing
light warning on the corresponding
00:00:48.070 --> 00:00:50.590
side view mirror when a vehicle's
within the blind spot zone.
00:00:51.854 --> 00:00:55.264
And remember, the system only
warns you of motorized vehicles,
00:00:55.264 --> 00:00:58.497
it does not detect bicycles,
pedestrians or other objects.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg3.mp4
question: Does the blind zone system detect bikes?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:00:49.240 --> 00:00:51.890
Remote start is especially nice
when you want to cool off your
00:00:51.890 --> 00:00:53.670
car before getting in on a hot day.
00:00:54.880 --> 00:00:58.590
In fact, if your car has automatic
climate control it will actually
00:00:58.590 --> 00:01:02.520
gauge the temperature inside the car and
adjust it to a more comfortable setting.
00:01:02.520 --> 00:01:06.340
This means that your heated seats,
steering wheel, and
00:01:06.340 --> 00:01:10.090
defrost will turn on on colder days and
your air conditioning and
00:01:10.090 --> 00:01:11.960
cooled seats will turn
on when it is warm out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg4.mp4
question: What the remote start of the vehicle is used for?

video_name: SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q
video_trans:
00:00:54.032 --> 00:00:56.484
If you want to change the factory
code to something that's easier for
00:00:56.484 --> 00:00:57.849
you to remember, you can do that too.
00:00:57.849 --> 00:00:58.848
[MUSIC]
00:00:58.848 --> 00:01:03.598
Just enter the factory code, press 1 2,
then enter your new code and
00:01:03.598 --> 00:01:07.478
your personal code will be
saved to position number one.
00:01:07.478 --> 00:01:10.699

more than one code,
00:01:10.699 --> 00:01:14.725
press 1 2 after you entered
your first new code to save it,
00:01:14.725 --> 00:01:19.496
then enter a second personal code and
press3 4 to save it, and so on.

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:11.045 --> 00:00:15.500
Lane-keeping system is made up
of two parts, Alert and Aid.
00:00:16.700 --> 00:00:18.860
The Alert mode lets you know if
you're drifting out of your lane.
00:00:19.928 --> 00:00:24.740
Using three short vibrations, it warns you
to steer your vehicle back into your lane.
00:00:24.740 --> 00:00:28.180
If you want to change the strength
of the vibration your car gives you,
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:31.245
you can adjust the intensity
setting in the message center.
00:00:31.245 --> 00:00:33.680
Lane-keeping will remember
the changes you make, so
00:00:33.680 --> 00:00:36.640
you won't have to reset it the next
time you turn on the system.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg2.mp4
question: How many parts are in the Lane-Keeping System?

video_trans:

You can change the camera view you see
using the camera button on the dash
00:01:03.930 --> 00:01:05.820
above the display screen.
00:01:05.820 --> 00:01:08.050
Push it once for a full rear view.

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:00:14.380 --> 00:00:16.190
It works a lot like
standard cruise control,
00:00:16.190 --> 00:00:19.196
in that it still maintains
your speed on flat roadways.
00:00:19.196 --> 00:00:21.470
But with ECO Cruise,
when you tap the brake, and
00:00:21.470 --> 00:00:25.410
then want to resume your previously set
speed, it accelerates gradually to get
00:00:25.410 --> 00:00:29.100
your vehicle back up to speed and
that can help save energy.
00:00:29.100 --> 00:00:33.160
Be aware that you may experience some
speed loss when first going up hill but
00:00:33.160 --> 00:00:37.110
after a short period of time,
it will catch up to your set speed.
00:00:37.110 --> 00:00:39.380
And if equipped with
adaptive cruise control,
00:00:39.380 --> 00:00:43.320
when your vehicle speed is slowed, it will
automatically accelerate again gradually
00:00:43.320 --> 00:00:47.890
once traffic is cleared. That gradual
acceleration may make it seem as if your
00:00:47.890 --> 00:00:50.930
vehicle isn't keeping up with
the speed you've set, it is.
00:00:50.930 --> 00:00:53.710
It's just that its more efficient
to gradually accelerate.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM_seg2.mp4
question: HOW TO DECREASE THE SPPED IN THE CURVE PEND ROADS

video_name: 180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc
video_trans:
00:00:28.040 --> 00:00:32.560
While you're in park, neutral, or drive,
press the camera button above the CD slot
00:00:32.560 --> 00:00:35.920
once to see either a front, normal view,
which gives you an image of
00:00:35.920 --> 00:00:39.620
what's directly in front of you,
or again, for a front split-view,
00:00:39.620 --> 00:00:42.720
which gives you a 180 degree extended
view of what's in front of you.
00:00:43.750 --> 00:00:46.900
That can be helpful, as it gives you added
visibility when you're pulling out of
00:00:46.900 --> 00:00:50.450
a driveway, street, parking spot,
or while maneuvering.

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:01:02.740 --> 00:01:04.950
Every time that you turn your vehicle off,
and
00:01:04.950 --> 00:01:07.280
you've used plug in
energy during your trip,
00:01:07.280 --> 00:01:10.870
the Next Full Charge screen will appear on
the right side of your instrument cluster.
00:01:10.870 --> 00:01:15.470
It will show your estimated miles per
full charge, just like on the left side,
00:01:15.470 --> 00:01:19.880
plus additional information about how your
energy usage has impacted your estimate
00:01:19.880 --> 00:01:22.590
as compared to the rated
the electric range for your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg6.mp4
question: Where is the next full charge screen located?

video_name: Twin-Panel Moonroof _ Ford How-To _ Ford-VVTFXgQAMeE
video_trans:
00:00:17.220 --> 00:00:21.055
You can open it without opening the glass
by firmly pressing the open sunshade
00:00:21.055 --> 00:00:23.075
control button here.
00:00:23.075 --> 00:00:26.481
You'll notice that the sunshade
only opens part of the way, so
00:00:26.481 --> 00:00:29.255
press the button again to
open the sunshade fully.
00:00:29.255 --> 00:00:32.285
To close it, firmly press
the close sunshade control button.
00:00:32.285 --> 00:00:35.359
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Twin-Panel Moonroof _ Ford How-To _ Ford-VVTFXgQAMeE_seg2.mp4
question: How do I close the sun shade on my vehicle?

video_name: One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk
video_trans:
00:00:56.930 --> 00:01:00.210
Keep in mind, if you continuously open and
close your windows in a short period of
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:04.370
time, it may cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:04.370 --> 00:01:08.270
Also, if you press the window switch
quickly from the first to second position,
00:01:08.270 --> 00:01:11.180
it can cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:11.180 --> 00:01:14.977
If this happens, release the switch,
wait a moment, then press it again.
00:01:14.977 --> 00:01:18.983
And remember, touching the switch at
all while the window is opening or
00:01:18.983 --> 00:01:20.270
closing will stop it.
00:01:21.640 --> 00:01:22.260
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk_seg6.mp4
question: If I push the window up and down too many times what happens?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:13.790 --> 00:00:16.520
Brake Coach works to help you
maximize the amount of energy
00:00:16.520 --> 00:00:19.350
captured through your
regenerative braking system.
00:00:19.350 --> 00:00:21.910
Regenerative braking works with
your standard brake system by
00:00:21.910 --> 00:00:25.170
recovering energy that is usually
lost through your friction brakes and
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:27.350
engine drag during braking or coasting.
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.810
And then storing that recovered energy
in your battery to help maximize efficiency.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg2.mp4
question: What feature help the drive maximise the amount of energy captured through the regenerative braking system?

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:12.168 --> 00:00:15.280
The customer placed trailer
camera prep kit can be mounted to
00:00:15.280 --> 00:00:16.530
the rear of a trailer.
00:00:16.530 --> 00:00:20.820
And provides added driver convenience
when backing up with an attached trailer.
00:00:20.820 --> 00:00:25.660
The kit includes a camera, wiring harness,
mounting bracket, and mounting parts.
00:00:25.660 --> 00:00:30.100
To use the camera requires the available
Sync 3 system, and either the available
00:00:30.100 --> 00:00:35.700
ultimate trailer tow camera system, or
rear center high mounted stop lamp camera.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs_seg2.mp4
question: What does the camera kit include?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.026 --> 00:00:04.444
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.444 --> 00:00:08.061
Your vehicle may be equipped with
a feature that enhances how your vehicle
00:00:08.061 --> 00:00:11.794
responds to steering wheel input by
reacting more smoothly at higher speeds
00:00:11.794 --> 00:00:16.010
and reducing steering wheel rotations
to maneuver at lower speeds.
00:00:16.010 --> 00:00:20.580
Plus, when activated, tow/haul mode delays
up shifts and provides engine braking when
00:00:20.580 --> 00:00:24.510
descending hilly roads while towing
a trailer or hauling heavy loads.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg1.mp4

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:00:11.300 --> 00:00:15.100
The power button located in the upper
left corner of the function control panel
00:00:15.100 --> 00:00:17.050
turns your climate system on.
00:00:17.050 --> 00:00:21.020
You also have fan speed controls,
a recirculated air button
00:00:21.020 --> 00:00:25.320
that let's you switch between outside air
and air circulated within the vehicle.
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:28.990
A distribution control that allows you to
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.005
come through the instrument panel vents,
floor vents or
00:00:32.005 --> 00:00:34.115
through the defrost vent at
the base of the wind shield.
00:00:35.205 --> 00:00:39.003
You'll also find an A/C button,
a rear defrost button and
00:00:39.003 --> 00:00:41.945
Max A/C and Max Defrost buttons.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the power button located?

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:01:56.568 --> 00:02:00.990
When changing lanes, lifts with Trailer Tow
can alert you if a vehicle is in your
00:02:00.990 --> 00:02:05.218
blind spot, from the side mirrors,
rear-ward to the back of the trailer.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg8.mp4

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:02:22.810 --> 00:02:27.370
Keep in mind you can also run a Vehicle
Health Report using voice commands.
00:02:27.370 --> 00:02:29.470
Just use the voice button
on your steering wheel and
00:02:29.470 --> 00:02:32.898
say Vehicle Health, it's that simple.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg7.mp4
