video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:45.570 --> 00:00:48.950
There are a few things that you may
need to know to prevent damaging them.
00:00:48.950 --> 00:00:51.430
Before you put a jack
underneath your vehicle,
00:00:51.430 --> 00:00:54.790
you'll need to ensure that the power
running boards are turned off.
00:00:54.790 --> 00:00:58.400
Also, when using a jack,
be sure to check your owner's manual for
00:00:58.400 --> 00:01:00.440
proper mounting locations.
00:01:00.440 --> 00:01:04.510
And when using a hoist lift be sure to
place the lift arms under the frame rails
00:01:04.510 --> 00:01:09.130
at all times to avoid damage to the under
body and running board components.
00:01:09.130 --> 00:01:10.250
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs_seg4.mp4
question: What are the things you need to know before putting a jack under a vehicle?

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:00:57.560 --> 00:01:01.980
To fold the seats flat, pull up on the
same handle you used to recline the seat,
00:01:01.980 --> 00:01:05.570
and push the seat back all
the way forward until it's flat.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM_seg5.mp4
question: Can the seats be folded?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:01:22.590 --> 00:01:26.600
A green bar indicates a positive
effect on your EV range,
00:01:26.600 --> 00:01:29.150
while an amber bar indicates
a negative effect.
00:01:29.150 --> 00:01:32.110
The longer the bar, the larger the impact.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg7.mp4
question: What does an amber bar indicate?

video_name: SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw
video_trans:
00:01:21.630 --> 00:01:24.440
To adjust the display screen brightness,
in other words,
00:01:24.440 --> 00:01:27.530
your touchscreen, touch the Display tile.
00:01:27.530 --> 00:01:32.120
From here, you can adjust the brightness,
change the mode to Auto,
00:01:32.120 --> 00:01:35.000
Day, Night or Off.
00:01:35.000 --> 00:01:39.500
If you've chosen Off, just touch your
screen anywhere to bring it back.
00:01:39.500 --> 00:01:41.680
You can also turn Auto Dim on,
00:01:41.680 --> 00:01:45.930
which allows the display screen to dim
when you adjust the interior lighting.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw_seg6.mp4
question: How it works to set the appropriate setting?

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:01:13.640 --> 00:01:16.560
Automatic start allows you to
test at your own pace, and
00:01:16.560 --> 00:01:18.280
begins once you hit the accelerator pedal.
00:01:20.080 --> 00:01:23.580
If you want to end the automatic start,
just hit okay on the five-way switch.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg5.mp4
question: When does automatic start begin?

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:01:34.090 --> 00:01:38.040
Of course, if you rather not use the
ECO Cruise feature it can be turned off
00:01:38.040 --> 00:01:41.265
using the five we controls on
the left side of the steering wheel.
00:01:41.265 --> 00:01:44.130
And scroll into settings in
your information display.
00:01:44.130 --> 00:01:47.490
Drivers Assist ECO Cruise then off.
00:01:47.490 --> 00:01:51.140
When ECO Cruise has been turned off
the next time you set a cruising speed,
00:01:51.140 --> 00:01:52.724
you will be using standard cruise control.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM_seg5.mp4
question: How to I turn off the ECO Cruise feature?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:01:31.820 --> 00:01:34.530
And here are some important
facts you should know.
00:01:34.530 --> 00:01:39.180
On certain vehicles, the system only
allows up to two remote starts an hour or
00:01:39.180 --> 00:01:41.020
between manual starts.
00:01:41.020 --> 00:01:43.730
On others, you can only run your car for
00:01:43.730 --> 00:01:48.030
35 minutes with remote start before
you need to manually start it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg6.mp4
question: What is the longest you can run your car on remote start before you can manually start it?

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:01:18.930 --> 00:01:22.610
Keep in mind, to help remind you when
power is flowing through the switch,
00:01:22.610 --> 00:01:24.700
it will remain illuminated
to let you know it's on.
00:01:25.880 --> 00:01:26.658
Any questions?
00:01:26.658 --> 00:01:28.720
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:01:28.720 --> 00:01:38.720
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg5.mp4
question: What will the switch do to show that power is flowing through it?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: How is the information on-demand screen activated?

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:00:38.005 --> 00:00:41.420
To adjust the auto lamp time delay,
or how long your head lamps
00:00:41.420 --> 00:00:46.290
stay on after you've turned off your car,
use the information display controls.
00:00:46.290 --> 00:00:51.210
Press the down arrow to find settings,
then press OK and the right arrow.
00:00:51.210 --> 00:00:55.520
And scroll down to vehicle, or
convenience depending on your vehicle.
00:00:55.520 --> 00:00:59.370
Next, press the right arrow and
scroll to auto lamp delay.
00:00:59.370 --> 00:01:03.880
Press the right arrow again,
select off or the time delay you wish.
00:01:03.880 --> 00:01:05.350
Then press OK to set it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I_seg3.mp4
question: How do you adjust the auto lamp time delay?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:02:09.570 --> 00:02:13.270
You may also notice that the charge
cord has multiple LED indicators
00:02:13.270 --> 00:02:17.580
to indicate that charging is in progress
or if any problems have occurred.
00:02:17.580 --> 00:02:21.340
When plugged into an AC outlet,
and you see a solid green light,
00:02:21.340 --> 00:02:24.080
power is available, but
vehicle charging has not begun.
00:02:25.470 --> 00:02:27.770
A flashing green light means
the vehicle is charging.
00:02:28.960 --> 00:02:32.270
If you see a flashing
solid red triangle LED,
00:02:32.270 --> 00:02:37.290
a ground fault circuit interrupter fault
or charge cord fault has been detected.
00:02:37.290 --> 00:02:41.610
However, if at any time you see a flashing
amber LED light in the shape of an outlet
00:02:41.610 --> 00:02:46.020
plug, that means high temperature
at the AC plug has been detected.
00:02:46.020 --> 00:02:48.610
Have the outlet checked by
a qualified electrician and
00:02:48.610 --> 00:02:50.839
make sure the AC plug fits
firmly into the outlet.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg7.mp4
question: What does a solid green light on the charge cord mean?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:29.400
Let me explain, adaptive steering with
tow/haul mode, changes the ratio between
00:00:29.400 --> 00:00:32.570
the driver's actions with the steering
wheel, meaning how much the driver
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:36.630
turns the steering wheel, and
how much the front wheels actually turn.
00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg2.mp4
question: What does adaptive steering with tow-haul mode provide?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:14.090 --> 00:01:18.120
When the system is on,
you'll see a car icon with lane markings.
00:01:18.120 --> 00:01:20.900
If the lines are gray,
you're either driving too slow for
00:01:20.900 --> 00:01:24.500
the system to work,
the road has poor lane markings, or
00:01:24.500 --> 00:01:27.020
the camera cannot see the markings
because of weather conditions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg5.mp4
question: What does it mean if you see gray lines?

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:01:10.071 --> 00:01:13.546
To access the battery compartment
on Transit Wagon models,
00:01:13.546 --> 00:01:17.973
first remove the protective plastic
molding, by pulling up on the tabs, and
00:01:17.973 --> 00:01:19.420
sliding it towards you.
00:01:19.420 --> 00:01:23.326
Next, lift the fabric covered trim by
pulling up on the tabs, and tuck, or
00:01:23.326 --> 00:01:25.074
fold it to keep it out of your way.
00:01:25.074 --> 00:01:28.962
You'll need to remove the rear metal
battery cover by unscrewing two fastening
00:01:28.962 --> 00:01:30.130
bolts, here and here.
00:01:31.350 --> 00:01:34.113
Next, unfasten the two electrical cords,
00:01:34.113 --> 00:01:38.526
by unclipping them from the fasteners
like this, and remove the bar.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg4.mp4
question: How do I access the battery on my transit wagon model?

video_name: Using Sport Mode - Ford Trucks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYZKTkmXyro
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.263
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.263 --> 00:00:07.204
You may be interested to know that
your vehicle may be equipped with
00:00:07.204 --> 00:00:11.430
a feature to enhance its performance when
driven on hilly and mountainous roads.
00:00:11.430 --> 00:00:12.750
Let me explain.
00:00:12.750 --> 00:00:15.200
It's called Sport Mode,
and when activated,
00:00:15.200 --> 00:00:19.140
the transmission extends the duration
between shifts of the lower gears.
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:23.170
So the engine stays in the sweet spot
of the engine's RPM power band for
00:00:23.170 --> 00:00:25.580
a more spirited throttle response.
00:00:25.580 --> 00:00:27.350
So instead of constant up and
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.420
down gear shifts, the transmission
holds a specific gear longer for
00:00:31.420 --> 00:00:35.720
peak performance when driving on twisty,
rolling roads with a steep grade.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Sport Mode - Ford Trucks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYZKTkmXyro_seg1.mp4
question: What feature can help me during hills and mountain drives?

video_name: EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI
video_trans:
00:00:52.974 --> 00:00:58.273
To engage EcoCruise, just turn EcoSelect
on, then set a cruise control speed.
00:00:58.273 --> 00:01:00.526
It's that simple.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI_seg4.mp4
question: What to start eco cruise?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.436
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.436 --> 00:00:08.110
Your vehicle may have a feature that
gives you a complete view all around it.
00:00:08.110 --> 00:00:11.970
Let me explain. The 360 degree
Camera with Split-view Display
00:00:11.970 --> 00:00:15.440
uses cameras mounted in the front grill,
tailgate handle, and
00:00:15.440 --> 00:00:18.590
side view mirrors to give you a continuous
view of everything around you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg1.mp4

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:02:11.050 --> 00:02:15.020
And one more thing, If you wish to
change to the conventional cruise mode,
00:02:15.020 --> 00:02:19.220
go to the menu settings on your instrument
cluster and select Cruise Control and
00:02:19.220 --> 00:02:20.110
then choose Normal.

video_trans:
00:00:44.220 --> 00:00:46.456
Okay, now let's talk about SelectShift.
00:00:46.456 --> 00:00:47.911
[MUSIC]
00:00:47.911 --> 00:00:52.109
To use it,
move your gear shift to the S position.
00:00:52.109 --> 00:00:55.615
And press the plus-minus buttons on
the the side of the gear shift to
00:00:55.615 --> 00:00:56.425
select gears.
00:00:56.425 --> 00:01:00.255
Press plus to upshift and
minus to downshift.
00:01:00.255 --> 00:01:03.488
Keep in mind your engine will rev
at various speeds depending on
00:01:03.488 --> 00:01:05.080
what gear you've shifted to.
00:01:05.080 --> 00:01:07.638
If your engine RPM is too high or too low,
00:01:07.638 --> 00:01:11.408
your vehicle will automatically
make some shifts for you.

video_name: SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.405 --> 00:00:03.973
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.980 --> 00:00:07.180
Did you know that your vehicle may be
equipped with a feature
00:00:07.180 --> 00:00:11.520
that allows you to stay connected and control certain
features remotely, like unlock and
00:00:11.540 --> 00:00:14.900
lock your doors as well as
remote start your vehicle?
00:00:14.920 --> 00:00:19.208
All you need is the available
Sync Connect, a compatible smartphone, and
00:00:19.208 --> 00:00:20.170
Ford Pass.
00:00:20.170 --> 00:00:21.520
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:21.520 --> 00:00:25.340
The first thing you'll need to do is
download FordPass from the App Store or
00:00:25.340 --> 00:00:28.500
Google Play and
accept the terms and conditions.
00:00:28.500 --> 00:00:33.491
If you already have a Ford owner account,
you can log in using your username and
00:00:33.491 --> 00:00:34.350
password.
00:00:34.350 --> 00:00:38.920
If not, you can create an account via the
FordPass app with some basic information
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:40.400
and a four digit PIN.
00:00:40.400 --> 00:00:43.820
You'll then need to add your
sync connect equipped vehicle.
00:00:43.820 --> 00:00:45.710
Go to the My Vehicles card.
00:00:45.710 --> 00:00:47.600
Click on Add Vehicle.
00:00:47.600 --> 00:00:50.610
To add a second vehicle hit the + button.
00:00:50.610 --> 00:00:55.500
Next, scan the VIN bar code by selecting
the Use Camera tab and point your
00:00:55.500 --> 00:00:59.920
phone's camera to the VIN label located
on your vehicle's driver door sill.
00:00:59.920 --> 00:01:02.530
You'll get a scanned successfully screen.
00:01:02.530 --> 00:01:05.570
Next, assign a vehicle nickname,
then, hit Finish.
00:01:06.590 --> 00:01:10.360
Next, you'll see this screen directing
you to activate SYNC Connect by
00:01:10.360 --> 00:01:13.200
touching the Activate SYNC Connect button.
00:01:13.200 --> 00:01:16.170
After a few minutes,
go to your vehicle and start it.
00:01:16.170 --> 00:01:19.630
You will then see this pop up
on the SYNC 3 touchscreen.
00:01:19.630 --> 00:01:20.800
Touch Allow to continue.
00:01:21.880 --> 00:01:25.843
Keep in mind, if you do not touch Allow
in the pop-up within 10 start-ups,
00:01:25.843 --> 00:01:28.306
you will not gain access
to remote features, and
00:01:28.306 --> 00:01:30.608
will need to reactivate
from the beginning.
00:01:30.608 --> 00:01:31.873
[MUSIC]
00:01:31.873 --> 00:01:36.091
Once you do, after a short period of time,
all remote features can be
00:01:36.091 --> 00:01:40.188
accessed from your smartphones
FordPass Vehicle Controls card.
00:01:40.188 --> 00:01:41.265
Any questions?
00:01:41.265 --> 00:01:44.705
Go to owner.ford.com or FordPass.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s_seg1.mp4
question: What happens if you forget to click "allow" within the required limit?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:01:56.180 --> 00:01:58.840
And here are a few other tips
you might be interested in.
00:01:58.840 --> 00:02:02.180
To cool down your vehicle quickly,
press the Auto button, and
00:02:02.180 --> 00:02:05.850
turn the nob toward the cool
setting to reduce the temperature.
00:02:05.850 --> 00:02:08.476
To warm your vehicle up quickly,
press the Auto button, and
00:02:08.480 --> 00:02:11.160
turn your nob toward the warm
setting to increase it.
00:02:11.740 --> 00:02:16.036
To quickly defrost the windshield and side
windows, press the Max defrost button.
00:02:16.036 --> 00:02:17.348
Both the temperature and
00:02:17.348 --> 00:02:21.070
fan speed will automatically
adjust to the highest settings.
00:02:21.070 --> 00:02:21.710
In mild or
00:02:21.710 --> 00:02:25.910
warm temperatures, you may notice
that your A/C automatically turns on.
00:02:25.910 --> 00:02:29.300
It does this to help dehumidify
the air for defogging.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg9.mp4
question: Why does my A/C turn on when defrosting the windows?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: Can I turn off the auto start stop if I am towing a trailer?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:00:35.570 --> 00:00:39.810
Trip view mode gives you a four quadrant
look that displays trip one and two.
00:00:39.810 --> 00:00:43.870
Both of which allow you to see your timer,
instantaneous fuel economy,
00:00:43.870 --> 00:00:46.620
miles traveled, and
average miles per gallon.
00:00:46.620 --> 00:00:50.340
Under the same mode, you also have a fuel
economy screen that displays your average
00:00:50.340 --> 00:00:55.430
miles per gallon, an instantaneous fuel
economy graph, miles to empty, and
00:00:55.430 --> 00:01:00.210
a fuel history which shows a bar graph of
your fuel history over a period of time,
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:03.670
a compass as well as your
Auto StartStop status.

00:01:03.545 --> 00:01:08.390

video_name: Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog
video_trans:
00:00:11.850 --> 00:00:15.020
To use the step, first lower the tailgate,
00:00:15.020 --> 00:00:18.950
then press the black release button in
the center of the step molding, here.
00:00:18.950 --> 00:00:20.470
The step will pop out a little, so
00:00:20.470 --> 00:00:23.360
just pull it all the way until it
gently falls into a lower position.
00:00:24.710 --> 00:00:27.860
Next, grab the yellow bar
top to the left of the step.
00:00:27.860 --> 00:00:30.410
Pull until the black bar
is fully extended and
00:00:30.410 --> 00:00:32.920
lift it up until it's locked into place.
00:00:32.920 --> 00:00:35.280
Then, pull the chrome interior
bar all of the way up.
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:39.410
You'll know the bar is fully
extended when you hear a click.
00:00:39.410 --> 00:00:42.930
The bar can be used as a grab handle to
help pull yourself up into the truck bed.

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:01:41.440 --> 00:01:46.261
For more convenience, you can also set
it up to send you automatic reminders to
00:01:46.261 --> 00:01:50.935
prompt you to run a report by pressing on,
and then choose whether you want to
00:01:50.935 --> 00:01:55.338
be reminded every 5,000,
7,500, or 10,000 miles.
00:01:55.338 --> 00:01:59.490
You can opt out at any time by
turning automatic reminders off.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg5.mp4
question: How many interval options are there for health reminders?

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
00:01:20.190 --> 00:01:23.630
Keep in mind, if your transmitter stops
working which you're programming,
00:01:23.630 --> 00:01:25.890
you'll have to hold the function
button while you press and
00:01:25.890 --> 00:01:28.380
release the transmitter every two seconds.
00:01:28.380 --> 00:01:30.950
You'll see the indicator
light flash slowly at first
00:01:30.950 --> 00:01:34.590
then faster once the signal has
been sent and accepted again.
00:01:34.590 --> 00:01:35.175
Still with me?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g_seg4.mp4

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:01:32.170 --> 00:01:34.792
Once the data of cruise is on,
it uses radar and
00:01:34.792 --> 00:01:39.048
camera technology to constantly scan for
slower vehicles in front of you.
00:01:39.048 --> 00:01:42.403
And automatically adjusts your
speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:42.403 --> 00:01:46.639
You may notice that on occasion, you go
slower than you initially set your cruise for.
00:01:46.639 --> 00:01:49.018
That's the system adjusting the speed.
00:01:49.018 --> 00:01:52.902
Once traffic speeds up,
you'll return to the speed you set.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg7.mp4
question: How does adaptive cruise scan for surrounding vehicles?

video_name: SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek
video_trans:
00:00:17.540 --> 00:00:21.110
An easy to read colorful homescreen
conveniently displays the phone and
00:00:21.110 --> 00:00:22.330
audio features.
00:00:22.330 --> 00:00:26.810
As well as new available navigation
screen, with a convientant swipe and
00:00:26.810 --> 00:00:29.808
pinch to zoom feature,
similar to your smart phone.
00:00:29.808 --> 00:00:33.160
And a redesigned feature bar is now
present along the bottom of the touch
00:00:33.160 --> 00:00:36.540
screen for a simple,
straightforward user experience.
00:00:36.540 --> 00:00:40.670
Keep in mind, if the feature menu bar
retracts below the display screen,
00:00:40.670 --> 00:00:44.270
you can simply touch the controls button
on the bottom left of the screen, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek_seg2.mp4
question: What features does the home screen display?

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:00:18.830 --> 00:00:19.730
To access it,
00:00:19.730 --> 00:00:24.040
from the home screen touch Apps on your
SYNC 3 touch screen, then Power Flow.
00:00:25.080 --> 00:00:26.710
The power flow screen will appear and
00:00:26.710 --> 00:00:29.240
you'll see your vehicles
current operating status.
00:00:29.240 --> 00:00:36.020
Either idle, hybrid drive, electric
drive or charging high voltage battery.
00:00:36.020 --> 00:00:38.620
Now depending on which status
you're currently running in
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:41.320
such as electric drive mode
when the engine is off
00:00:41.320 --> 00:00:45.730
you'll see a blue power flow path
indicating which components are in use.
00:00:45.730 --> 00:00:49.360
In this case power from the battery
is being used for accessories like
00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:54.060
the climate control, high voltage electric
heater or air conditioning compressor and
00:00:54.060 --> 00:00:58.500
other low voltage accessories such
as the radio, fans or heated seats.
00:00:58.500 --> 00:01:01.090
You'll also notice power
flowing to the electric motor
00:01:01.090 --> 00:01:02.720
which is driving the wheels.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg2.mp4
question: What is the power flow for electric drive mode when engine is off?

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:43.090 --> 00:00:45.920
Gasoline range is the estimated
distance to empty
00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.160
based on the fuel remaining in the tank.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg3.mp4

To activate Sport Mode, press the button
on the end of the gear shift lever twice
00:00:40.140 --> 00:00:44.680
here, or
here if you have a center council shifter.
00:00:44.680 --> 00:00:47.770
The sport indicator light will
illuminate in the instrument display
00:00:47.770 --> 00:00:49.830
letting you know it's activated.

You'll also appreciate these available
convenience lighting features, such as

integrated mirror mounted clearance

00:00:38.530 --> 00:00:42.290
spotlights, that are helpful for setting

Another feature you may

which when available notifies

00:02:59.700 --> 00:03:03.490
song you previously selected,

You'll first need to enable alerts.

video_trans:
00:01:21.630 --> 00:01:24.440
To adjust the display screen brightness,
in other words,
00:01:24.440 --> 00:01:27.530
your touchscreen, touch the Display tile.
00:01:27.530 --> 00:01:32.120
From here, you can adjust the brightness,
change the mode to Auto,
00:01:32.120 --> 00:01:35.000
Day, Night or Off.
00:01:35.000 --> 00:01:39.500
If you've chosen Off, just touch your
screen anywhere to bring it back.
00:01:39.500 --> 00:01:41.680
You can also turn Auto Dim on,
00:01:41.680 --> 00:01:45.930
which allows the display screen to dim
when you adjust the interior lighting.

video_trans:

If you'd rather control
your temperature manually,

just press the distribution

Or any of the fans feed buttons.

video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:19.430 --> 00:00:23.030
To activate them, using the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.219
go to the Settings tab on your
8-inch productivity screen.
00:00:26.219 --> 00:00:30.320
Scroll to Advanced Settings >
Vehicle > Power Running Boards.

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:17.846 --> 00:00:22.105
Using the five-way controls on your
steering wheel, scroll to the main menu,
00:00:22.105 --> 00:00:25.400
Display/Trip, then scroll to MyView and
00:00:25.400 --> 00:00:27.740
press the right arrow on
the five-way controls.
00:00:27.740 --> 00:00:31.030
It takes you to the Options menu
where you can select Change MyView.
00:00:31.030 --> 00:00:35.100
From here, simply use the up or
down arrows to view the available content,
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:39.280
like Vehicle Range, Trip 1 and
2, Fuel History, Coach, etc,
00:00:39.280 --> 00:00:43.030
and the right and left arrows to move
between the left and right columns.
00:00:44.360 --> 00:00:46.710
Each time you select a screen
that you want to display,
00:00:46.710 --> 00:00:49.650
press the OK button on your
five-way control to save it.
00:00:49.650 --> 00:00:51.980
This will now be your MyView screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM_seg2.mp4
question: What option should be tapped on the main menu to reach the my view option?

video_name: Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI
video_trans:
00:00:44.679 --> 00:00:45.591
And one more thing.
00:00:45.591 --> 00:00:50.590
If for any reason it doesn't engage
reverse gear, press the clutch pedal down,
00:00:50.590 --> 00:00:55.532
take it out of gear, release the clutch
pedal, then repeat the process again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI_seg3.mp4
question: What if it doesn't engage reverse gear should you release the clutch?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:00:16.950 --> 00:00:20.190
Before you begin you'll need a few
things to help with the set up.
00:00:20.190 --> 00:00:24.425
Your supplied quick start set up guide
with measurement card, a tape measure,
00:00:24.425 --> 00:00:27.408
a pen or pencil, and
an assistant to help out if needed.
00:00:27.408 --> 00:00:30.308
As well as the checkered stickers
that comes with your guide
00:00:30.308 --> 00:00:32.915
which I'll tell you about later.
00:00:32.915 --> 00:00:36.985
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.985 --> 00:00:41.105
For best results, it's recommended to use
a drawbar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:41.105 --> 00:00:43.025
drop to position your
trailer level to the ground.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:47.030
Then, line up the vehicle and
trailer by pulling forward so
00:00:47.030 --> 00:00:48.270
they're in line with one another.
00:00:49.800 --> 00:00:54.330
Second, from inside the vehicle, use
the five-way steering wheel controls and
00:00:54.330 --> 00:00:59.200
go to the Towing menu, and select Trailer
Setup, then Add Trailer, and hit OK.
00:01:00.780 --> 00:01:04.940
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:09.030
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:09.030 --> 00:01:11.020
Press OK to confirm.
00:01:11.020 --> 00:01:13.842
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:13.842 --> 00:01:17.260
Electric/Surge is the default,
then press OK.
00:01:18.470 --> 00:01:21.850
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer: Low,
00:01:21.850 --> 00:01:26.190
which is the recommended setting for
most trailers, Medium, or High.
00:01:26.190 --> 00:01:29.770
If your trailer requires more aggressive
braking, like if you have a larger,
00:01:29.770 --> 00:01:34.815
heavier trailer for instance, you will
then need to select a trailer type.
00:01:34.815 --> 00:01:38.346
And since automatic features are only
available with conventional trailers
00:01:38.346 --> 00:01:41.288
within trailer reverse guidance,
trailer setup is required.
00:01:41.288 --> 00:01:44.288
If you choose not to set up
your conventional trailer, or
00:01:44.288 --> 00:01:46.787
if you have a Fifth wheel or
Gooseneck trailer,
00:01:46.787 --> 00:01:49.985
you can still use the trailer
reverse guidance views.
00:01:49.985 --> 00:01:53.105
But, some of the automatic
features will not available.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg2.mp4
question: When do you select the trailer brake effort as high?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:28.460 --> 00:01:32.470
Once conditions are favorable for the
system to work, the lines will turn green.
00:01:32.470 --> 00:01:34.270
This means it's ready to go.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg6.mp4
question: What will happen when conditions are favorable for system to work?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:34.270 --> 00:01:36.670
When you see yellow,
the Aid mode is active.
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.550
Then you'll feel the steering wheel move
a little to help direct you to steer
00:01:39.550 --> 00:01:40.350
back into you lane.
00:01:41.510 --> 00:01:43.660
If you see red, the Alert mode is active,
00:01:43.660 --> 00:01:46.030
and you'll feel
the steering wheel vibrate.
00:01:46.030 --> 00:01:48.490
And if you don't see any lines,
the system is off.
00:01:49.660 --> 00:01:50.630
And don't worry.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg7.mp4
question: What does the red line indicate that the steering wheel will do?

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
00:00:42.860 --> 00:00:46.486
However, if your light flashes rapidly and
then turns to a constant light,
00:00:46.486 --> 00:00:49.273
you're not done yet and
will have to take few extra steps.
00:00:49.273 --> 00:00:50.899
[MUSIC]
00:00:50.899 --> 00:00:52.750
Don't worry, I'll walk you through them.
00:00:52.750 --> 00:00:55.032
You'll need to complete the next
few steps in 30 seconds, so
00:00:55.032 --> 00:00:57.542
you might want to have someone help
you if you think it would be easier.
00:00:57.542 --> 00:00:59.260
[MUSIC]
00:00:59.260 --> 00:01:03.500
First, press and hold the learn button
on your garage door opener motor, here.
00:01:04.900 --> 00:01:07.170
Next, get back in your car and press and
00:01:07.170 --> 00:01:11.360
hold the selected function button on your
HomeLink for two seconds then release it.
00:01:11.360 --> 00:01:14.500
Then press and hold it for
two seconds again and release it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g_seg2.mp4
question: How long do I have to complete the steps following the flashing-to-constant light?

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
00:00:57.840 --> 00:01:01.330
Okay, now let's take
a look at the rear wipers.
00:01:01.330 --> 00:01:05.880
The switch at the end of the stock allows
you to turn them on and select your speed.
00:01:05.880 --> 00:01:08.010
The first position is for
intermittent wiping.
00:01:10.050 --> 00:01:11.860
The second is for a continuous wipe.
00:01:13.570 --> 00:01:16.120
And O is off for the wiper.

When changing lanes, lifts with Trailer Tow

blind spot, from the side mirrors,

To stow it, push the step in on either
side of the button until it fully latches
00:00:32.063 --> 00:00:33.116
into position.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:30.320 --> 00:01:34.050
In fact, there are four different
gaps that you can choose from.
00:01:34.050 --> 00:01:38.140
One bar, or the sportiest setting,
gets you the smallest gap.
00:01:38.140 --> 00:01:40.720
Two bars, which is the default gap.
00:01:40.720 --> 00:01:45.680
Three bars, or four, which is the comfort
setting and gives you the biggest gap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg7.mp4
question: How many gaps or the bars we find in the car while shifting the gears?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:00:54.680 --> 00:00:57.700
The green area of the gauge
represents miles per charge
00:00:57.700 --> 00:01:00.590
that is greater than the rated value for
your vehicle.
00:01:00.590 --> 00:01:01.640
Still with me?
00:01:01.640 --> 00:01:02.740
Great.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg5.mp4
question: What does the green area represent?

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:29.510 --> 00:00:32.320
Electric range is the estimated
distance you can travel
00:00:32.320 --> 00:00:35.280
while in plug-in power
mode with the engine off.
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:38.180
This range is based on
calculations determined by
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:43.090
the amount of energy stored in the battery
and the energy being used while driving.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg2.mp4
question: How does the electric range of the car is estimated?

video_name: Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.364
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.364 --> 00:00:09.020
Did you know that you can fold
the back seat down in your vehicle?
00:00:09.020 --> 00:00:10.590
Here's how to do it.
00:00:10.590 --> 00:00:13.670
First, fold the outside
head restraints down and
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:16.160
lower the center head restraint like this.
00:00:16.160 --> 00:00:20.830
Next, find the lever located on
the side of the seat base, here, and
00:00:20.830 --> 00:00:22.920
pull the level up to
fold the seat back down.
00:00:24.180 --> 00:00:28.250
To unfold your seats, just pull the seat
back up into the lock position.
00:00:28.250 --> 00:00:28.920
You'll hear a click.
00:00:30.160 --> 00:00:31.300
And on some vehicles,
00:00:31.300 --> 00:00:34.870
you may see a red indicator on
the lever to let you know it's locked.
00:00:34.870 --> 00:00:36.584
Just give it a slight pull to make sure.
00:00:36.584 --> 00:00:40.486
Any questions?
00:00:40.486 --> 00:00:40.986

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:00:11.610 --> 00:00:14.840
First, you'll notice all the normal
climate features you would typically find
00:00:14.840 --> 00:00:16.150
on most cars.
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:20.250
A climate system power button, which turns
the climate control system off and on.
00:00:20.250 --> 00:00:24.370
A fan speed control or a circulating air
button that let's you switch between
00:00:24.370 --> 00:00:27.450
outside air and
air circulating within the car.
00:00:27.450 --> 00:00:30.395
A distribution control that lets you
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:30.395 --> 00:00:34.505
come through the dashboard vents,
the floor vents, the defrost
00:00:34.505 --> 00:00:39.085
vent at the base of the windshield,
or a combination of multiple vents.
00:00:39.085 --> 00:00:41.552
An air conditioning or AC, button.
00:00:41.552 --> 00:00:44.288
Max defrost and rear defrost buttons.
00:00:44.288 --> 00:00:45.850
And a max A/C button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg2.mp4

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:00:41.765 --> 00:00:45.610
Okay, now let's talk about how
to replace the 12-volt battery.
00:00:45.610 --> 00:00:48.657
It's located inside the cabin,
under the driver's seat.
00:00:48.657 --> 00:00:52.470
First, you'll need to move
the driver's seat all the way back.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:56.351
Next, open the two plastic screw covers
on each side of the front of the seat,
00:00:56.351 --> 00:01:00.729
by inserting your finger into the tabs and
pulling them open, they'll swing inward.
00:01:00.729 --> 00:01:06.481
Now remove the two rail stop bolts
using a T-40 type Torx bit, here.
00:01:06.481 --> 00:01:10.071
With the arm rests folded up,
slide the seat all the way forward.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg3.mp4
question: Where is the 12-vold battery located?

your keypad looks almost invisible.
00:00:19.337 --> 00:00:21.717

00:00:21.717 --> 00:00:25.708

you want to press the keypad numbers
00:00:25.708 --> 00:00:26.433
precisely.
00:00:26.433 --> 00:00:29.708
Lifting your finger off completely
between each number to make sure you're
00:00:29.708 --> 00:00:30.841
pressing the right code.
00:00:30.841 --> 00:00:32.214
[MUSIC]

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:02:29.841 --> 00:02:34.098
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:34.098 --> 00:02:35.889
the hitch ball and write it down.
00:02:35.889 --> 00:02:40.242
Next, measure the horizontal distance from
the center of the hitch ball to the center
00:02:40.242 --> 00:02:41.148
of the sticker and
00:02:41.148 --> 00:02:44.731
the distance from the rear-view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:02:44.731 --> 00:02:49.037
Keep in mind, the location is not
dependent on a straight or A frame type,
00:02:49.037 --> 00:02:53.211
but based on where a surface is
available that meets the requirements.
00:02:53.211 --> 00:02:57.236
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:02:57.236 --> 00:02:59.000
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:00.080 --> 00:03:01.280
If the trailer has two or
00:03:01.280 --> 00:03:05.000
more axles, measure to the center
point between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg5.mp4
question: What are the measurements to be taken to position the tailer correctly?

 To toggle through the different gauge

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg3.mp4
question: If a collision risk is detected, how is the driver notified?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:54.590 --> 00:00:59.120
Once adaptive cruise is on, it uses radar
to constantly scan for slower vehicles in
00:00:59.120 --> 00:01:03.100
front of you and automatically adjust
your speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:03.100 --> 00:01:04.630
You may notice that on occasion,
00:01:04.630 --> 00:01:07.600
you go slower than you
initially set your cruise for.
00:01:07.600 --> 00:01:10.540
But don't worry,
the system is still working.
00:01:10.540 --> 00:01:13.850
Once traffic is cleared,
you'll return to the speed you set.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg5.mp4
question: Do I have to re-set my cruise after traffic is cleared?

Keep in mind, if the feature menu bar

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:
00:00:09.330 --> 00:00:13.670
Let me explain. Selectable Driving Mode
instantly modifies the electronic
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:17.230
stability control system and traction
control, which help maintain your vehicle's
00:00:17.230 --> 00:00:20.170
command of the road in poor conditions,
or high performance driving.
00:00:21.280 --> 00:00:24.220
It also enhances throttle response for
quick acceleration,
00:00:24.220 --> 00:00:29.170
crisper transmission shift points,
and finally steering effort and feel.
00:00:29.170 --> 00:00:32.270
Together the selectable driving
mounts automatically tailor your
00:00:32.270 --> 00:00:35.290
vehicles performance to
the mode you've selected.

video_name: Adjustable Tilt_Telescoping Steering Column _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TlWXbGtYrTQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.321 --> 00:00:04.941
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.941 --> 00:00:09.051
Your steering wheel can be adjusted to
make driving even more comfortable,
00:00:09.051 --> 00:00:10.370
let me show you how.
00:00:10.370 --> 00:00:12.990
First, make sure you're
comfortable in your seat.
00:00:12.990 --> 00:00:15.550
This will ensure that you're moving
your wheel to the correct position.
00:00:16.730 --> 00:00:20.680
Now, unlock the steering column by
pulling the release lever either down and
00:00:20.680 --> 00:00:24.000
away or down and toward you.
00:00:24.000 --> 00:00:28.730
Move the steering wheel to a good spot for
you by tilting it up or down, or
00:00:28.730 --> 00:00:32.140
by either pulling it toward you or
pushing it away from you.
00:00:33.230 --> 00:00:35.750
Once you have it in the right position,
lock it by
00:00:35.750 --> 00:00:40.410
pushing the same lever you used to unlock
it, only in the opposite direction.
00:00:40.410 --> 00:00:41.590
Any questions?
00:00:41.590 --> 00:00:42.115
Go to
00:00:42.115 --> 00:00:52.115
FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjustable Tilt_Telescoping Steering Column _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TlWXbGtYrTQ_seg1.mp4
question: How do you tilt the steering wheel?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:03:07.000 --> 00:03:09.700
Now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the system's
00:03:09.700 --> 00:03:10.640
information display.
00:03:11.720 --> 00:03:15.190
To input the measurements you recorded
outside the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:15.190 --> 00:03:18.540
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:18.540 --> 00:03:21.130
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed.
00:03:21.130 --> 00:03:24.444
Like this,
then OK to confirm each measurement and
00:03:24.444 --> 00:03:26.769
to move on to the next measurement.
00:03:26.769 --> 00:03:28.618
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:03:28.618 --> 00:03:31.761
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:03:31.761 --> 00:03:35.591
If correct, select Confirm and hit OK.
00:03:35.591 --> 00:03:39.573
Once you've confirmed the measurements,
the system will automatically search for
00:03:39.573 --> 00:03:42.172
the sticker target and
highlight it with a red circle and
00:03:42.172 --> 00:03:44.391
the message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:03:44.391 --> 00:03:47.495
If it is, select yes to confirm.
00:03:47.495 --> 00:03:50.762
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know setup is complete and
00:03:50.762 --> 00:03:51.927
measurements are saved.
00:03:51.927 --> 00:03:54.753
If you don't see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:03:54.753 --> 00:03:57.201
Make sure the measurements are correct and
that the trailer and
00:03:57.201 --> 00:03:59.115
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:03:59.115 --> 00:04:03.779
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straightforward between 4 and 25 miles per
00:04:03.779 --> 00:04:07.844
hour as directed until you get a message
confirming calibration is complete.
00:04:07.844 --> 00:04:08.911
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg6.mp4
question: What have to be done to calibrate the saved measurements

video_trans:
00:00:43.120 --> 00:00:46.710
The information displayed will
now show a green indicator light,
00:00:46.710 --> 00:00:50.400
the current gap setting,
and your desired set speed.
00:00:50.400 --> 00:00:53.040
And a vehicle graphic will
illuminate if the system detects
00:00:53.040 --> 00:00:54.590
a vehicle in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg4.mp4
question: Does the vehicle graphic illuminate if the system detects a vehicle in front?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:02:36.670 --> 00:02:39.370
Keep in mind,
anytime a trailer is connected and
00:02:39.370 --> 00:02:43.160
information is input, cross-traffic
alert automatically turns off.
00:02:44.260 --> 00:02:48.160
And finally, extreme weather
conditions could block the sensors, but
00:02:48.160 --> 00:02:52.450
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:02:52.450 --> 00:02:54.460
As with most radar, infrared and
00:02:54.460 --> 00:02:58.660
ultrasonic type sensing systems,
there is a possibility of false alerts.

video_name: Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.090 --> 00:00:06.099
[MUSIC]
00:00:06.099 --> 00:00:10.110
Your vehicle may be equipped with
inflatable rear outboard safety belts.
00:00:10.110 --> 00:00:13.222
They work similarly to standard
belts in everyday use.
00:00:13.222 --> 00:00:16.254
But in the event of an accident
they work a little differently.
00:00:16.254 --> 00:00:17.647
Let me explain.
00:00:17.647 --> 00:00:22.222
Unlike a standard safety belt the
inflatable outboard rear safety belt uses
00:00:22.222 --> 00:00:23.303
two retractors.
00:00:23.303 --> 00:00:25.981
One for your torso and one for your lap.
00:00:25.981 --> 00:00:30.081
To fasten it, just grab the tongue, that's
the part that connects the torso and
00:00:30.081 --> 00:00:30.820
lap portion.
00:00:30.820 --> 00:00:36.081
Pull the entire belt over your body at the
same time, then latch it into the buckle.
00:00:36.081 --> 00:00:39.196
Make sure to insert the tongue in
a straight-in motion to the buckle.
00:00:39.196 --> 00:00:42.434
This will help ensure
the inflation mechanism lines up.
00:00:42.434 --> 00:00:44.869
And that it inflates properly if needed.
00:00:44.869 --> 00:00:49.316
If you're in an accident, the crash system
in your vehicle will determine when, and
00:00:49.316 --> 00:00:52.176
if, the inflatable rear
safety belts should deploy.
00:00:52.176 --> 00:00:56.496
If they're needed, the air bags will
inflate with cold, compressed gas and
00:00:56.496 --> 00:01:01.149
expand across the passengers' bodies to
distribute the forces from the crash over
00:01:01.149 --> 00:01:03.551
a larger area to reduce
the risk of injury.
00:01:03.551 --> 00:01:04.604
Any questions?
00:01:04.604 --> 00:01:06.484
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:06.484 --> 00:01:16.484
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc_seg1.mp4
question: When do inflatable belts work differently than normal seat belts?

video_name: SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q
video_trans:
00:01:19.496 --> 00:01:24.257
On select vehicles, you may even be able
to link your driver memory setting to your
00:01:24.257 --> 00:01:25.984
personal code on the keypad.
00:01:25.984 --> 00:01:29.393
Whatever five-digit code you
programmed as code number one,
00:01:29.393 --> 00:01:31.397
remember, the one set to one, two?
00:01:31.397 --> 00:01:35.251
Will be linked to the memory settings
that are stored in the memory one button.
00:01:35.251 --> 00:01:40.401
So, when you enter that five digit code,
the memory one position will be recalled.
00:01:40.401 --> 00:01:44.677
Whatever five-digit code you programmed
as code number two, the one set on 3 4,
00:01:44.677 --> 00:01:48.666
will be linked to the memory setting that
are stored in the memory two button.
00:01:48.666 --> 00:01:51.916
And if you have a third,
you can store it on 5-6.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q_seg5.mp4
question: What is stored in the memory buttons?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:13.870 --> 00:00:17.290
To maintain the appearance of
the bright chrome exterior finishes,
00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:19.620
regular cleaning is highly recommended.
00:00:19.620 --> 00:00:24.440
To clean, use water and a mild liquid
automotive soap from an auto supply store.
00:00:24.440 --> 00:00:28.590
Or a 50/50 solution of water and
white vinegar also works well.
00:00:28.590 --> 00:00:33.411
And remove all excess water as hard water
spots can deposit iron which can lead
00:00:33.411 --> 00:00:34.013
to rust.
00:00:34.013 --> 00:00:35.947
To remove tar and bugs from the grill,
00:00:35.947 --> 00:00:39.720
it's recommended to use
an oil-based bug and tar remover.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.220
In extreme winter climates, be sure
to rinse away salt residue as soon as
00:00:43.220 --> 00:00:47.070
possible as salt contains chlorides
that can damage the surface finish.
00:00:48.570 --> 00:00:51.750
Avoid all cleaning products that
contain ammonia, bleach, and
00:00:51.750 --> 00:00:54.600
alcohol as they may
also damage the finish.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg2.mp4
question: Can I use window cleaner to clean the exterior of my vehicle?

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:00:22.760 --> 00:00:25.970
Summer tires are ideal for
performance vehicles and
00:00:25.970 --> 00:00:29.366
do not have the same traction
characteristics of all-season tires.
00:00:29.366 --> 00:00:32.902
As they are designed for
superior traction, cornering, and
00:00:32.902 --> 00:00:37.010
braking performance for
both wet and dry road conditions.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:41.240
This is attributed to specialized tread
patterns, like less grooving, to provide
00:00:41.240 --> 00:00:46.159
more tire contact with the road, shallower
tread depth, and softer rubber compounds.
00:00:47.330 --> 00:00:51.550
Keep in mind, since summer tires
are composed of softer materials,
00:00:51.550 --> 00:00:53.360
they tend to lose flexibility.
00:00:53.360 --> 00:00:55.766
and are less suitable in colder temps and
00:00:55.766 --> 00:00:58.755
generally wear faster
than an all-season tire.
00:00:58.755 --> 00:01:02.646
And unlike all-season tires,
summer tires do not have a mud and
00:01:02.646 --> 00:01:05.601
snow traction rating and
are not recommended for
00:01:05.601 --> 00:01:09.870
cold weather below 45 degrees or
snowy and icy driving conditions.
00:01:11.220 --> 00:01:12.540
As a matter of fact,
00:01:12.540 --> 00:01:17.230
driving on summer tires in below
freezing conditions can damage them.
00:01:17.230 --> 00:01:21.590
If you must drive in these conditions,
Ford recommends using all-season or
00:01:21.590 --> 00:01:23.240
winter snow tires.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg2.mp4
question: Do summer tires last as long as all-season tires?

you just have to press the on/off switch

when you start your vehicle and
you're good to go.

Any questions?

video_trans:

Keep in mind, the estimated range is
based on three impact categories.
00:01:36.530 --> 00:01:40.440
The first being driving style and
route, which is the energy used to
00:01:40.440 --> 00:01:45.160

00:01:45.160 --> 00:01:47.630
whether you're doing city or
highway driving.

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4_seg1.mp4
question: Can the rear seat backs be folded down in this vehicle?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:01:53.105 --> 00:01:57.020
If your vehicle includes the blind
spot information system BLIS,
00:01:57.020 --> 00:01:59.970
the system first prompts you to
set up your trailer BLIS feature.
00:02:00.980 --> 00:02:03.920
Next, a message appears in
the information display,
00:02:03.920 --> 00:02:06.570
asking if you want to
Add Trailer Reverse Guidance.
00:02:06.570 --> 00:02:07.350
Select Yes.
00:02:08.360 --> 00:02:12.620
A prompt will direct you to straighten the
trailer if necessary, to continue set up.
00:02:12.620 --> 00:02:15.790
You'll then get another message directing
you to use the quick start guide
00:02:15.790 --> 00:02:16.359
to proceed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg3.mp4
question: What feature watches over your trailer's blind spot?

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:01:39.921 --> 00:01:44.632
Adaptive steering helps reduce under steer
at higher speeds, while allowing the front
00:01:44.660 --> 00:01:48.720
wheels to turn fully with fewer turns
of the steering wheel at lower speeds.
00:01:48.720 --> 00:01:51.640
And when used with tow haul
the vehicle delays upshifts and
00:01:51.646 --> 00:01:55.359
provides engine breaking when descending
hilly roads with heavy loads.

[MUSIC]

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:01:02.570 --> 00:01:05.090
You can change the sensitivity
of the warning system
00:01:05.090 --> 00:01:09.630
to one of three settings by using the
five-way control on your steering wheel.
00:01:09.630 --> 00:01:14.240
Scroll to Driver Assist,
Pre-Collision, Alert Sensitivity, and
00:01:14.240 --> 00:01:17.290
then select High, Normal or Low.
00:01:17.290 --> 00:01:21.350
A lower setting can send fewer warnings,
while a higher setting will give earlier,
00:01:21.350 --> 00:01:22.890
more frequent warnings.
00:01:22.890 --> 00:01:26.820
Keep in mind, for the system to
function properly, the radar sensor and
00:01:26.820 --> 00:01:29.130
camera must be clear of obstruction.
00:01:29.130 --> 00:01:33.660
If any obstruction is detected, a message
will appear in the information display.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg4.mp4
question: How many settings does the warning system have?

video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:19.430 --> 00:00:23.030
To activate them, using the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.219
go to the Settings tab on your
8-inch productivity screen.
00:00:26.219 --> 00:00:30.320
Scroll to Advanced Settings >
Vehicle > Power Running Boards.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the switch used for accessing and using the activity screen menu located?

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.282
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.282 --> 00:00:08.780
Why do I see my gears sometimes but
not others?
00:00:08.780 --> 00:00:11.710
Did you know that your automatic
transmission may let you manually
00:00:11.710 --> 00:00:13.350
switch gears too?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:17.240
In fact, with SelectShift,
not only can you easily shift gears,
00:00:17.240 --> 00:00:19.780
you don't have to worry
about using a clutch either.
00:00:19.780 --> 00:00:20.990
Here's how it works.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg1.mp4
question: Should I be using a clutch when shifting gears manually?

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:40.590 --> 00:00:43.575
Keep in mind, even though you
are manually changing gears,
00:00:43.575 --> 00:00:45.910
SelectShift will automatically
make some shifts for
00:00:45.910 --> 00:00:50.190
you, if your enter speed is to high,
or if your RPMs are too low.
00:00:50.190 --> 00:00:52.970
And once you've gone into Sport Mode,
00:00:52.970 --> 00:00:55.470
your car will stay there until
you shift back to Drive Mode.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc_seg4.mp4
question: When will select shift make shifts for you?

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:01:29.790 --> 00:01:32.390
To fold your third row manual seats flat,
or
00:01:32.390 --> 00:01:36.190
tumble them to stow them in the floor,
then fold your head restraints down by
00:01:36.190 --> 00:01:39.970
pulling the strap in the middle of the
seat back, just below the head restraint.
00:01:39.970 --> 00:01:42.570
Next, fold the seat back
down by pulling and
00:01:42.570 --> 00:01:45.969
holding the number 1 strap, while
you're pushing the seat back forward.
00:01:47.330 --> 00:01:49.870
Once it starts to fold,
let go of the strap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM_seg8.mp4
question: What does the number one strap do?

video_name: LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk
video_trans:
00:01:00.588 --> 00:01:05.024
High visibility LED box lights in the box
interior make it easy to find and
00:01:05.024 --> 00:01:07.350
load items in the dark.
00:01:07.350 --> 00:01:11.020
There are two lights located in
the rear corners that shine forward.
00:01:11.020 --> 00:01:14.770
There is also one in the high mounted
stop lamp on the rear of the cab.
00:01:14.770 --> 00:01:19.780
To turn them on and off from inside the
cab, just press the box lighting button, here.
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:22.760
After ten minutes they
will turn off gradually.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk_seg4.mp4
question: Where is the button to locate the cabin lights?

video_trans:
00:01:41.440 --> 00:01:46.261
For more convenience, you can also set
it up to send you automatic reminders to
00:01:46.261 --> 00:01:50.935
prompt you to run a report by pressing on,
and then choose whether you want to
00:01:50.935 --> 00:01:55.338
be reminded every 5,000,
7,500, or 10,000 miles.
00:01:55.338 --> 00:01:59.490
You can opt out at any time by
turning automatic reminders off.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg5.mp4

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:29.510 --> 00:00:32.320
Electric range is the estimated
distance you can travel
00:00:32.320 --> 00:00:35.280
while in plug-in power
mode with the engine off.
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:38.180
This range is based on
calculations determined by
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:43.090
the amount of energy stored in the battery
and the energy being used while driving.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg2.mp4
question: What does the term electric range mean to the driver?

00:00:19.780 --> 00:00:23.600

video_name: Rear Decklid Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fjh0-VKzUEk
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.036
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.036 --> 00:00:08.658
There are a few convenient ways to gain
access to the rear luggage compartment in
00:00:08.658 --> 00:00:09.600
your vehicle.
00:00:09.600 --> 00:00:11.210
Let me explain.
00:00:11.210 --> 00:00:14.360
From the driver's seat, simply push
the trunk release button on the lower left
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.520
side of the instrument panel next to the
steering column to unlatch the rear deck lid.
00:00:18.520 --> 00:00:20.230
With the standard Intelligent Access,
00:00:20.230 --> 00:00:24.120
you can get into your vehicle remotely
without reaching for your key fob.
00:00:24.120 --> 00:00:25.320
With your key fob on you,
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:29.350
just press the trunk release button
located above the license plate here.
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:32.071
It's that simple.
00:00:32.071 --> 00:00:33.095
Any questions?
00:00:33.095 --> 00:00:34.727
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:34.727 --> 00:00:44.727
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Rear Decklid Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fjh0-VKzUEk_seg1.mp4
question: In what ways can I gain access to the rear luggage compartment in my vehicle?

video_trans:

Once installed, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:38.331 --> 00:00:42.858
pressing the auxiliary button on your
Sync 3 touchscreen turns the camera on.
00:00:42.858 --> 00:00:45.430
A rear view image will then appear
on your center console display.
00:00:45.430 --> 00:00:48.532
The camera will turn off when
shifted out of reverse, or
00:00:48.532 --> 00:00:51.910
when another camera view is
selected from the touch screen.

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.139 --> 00:00:04.420
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.420 --> 00:00:08.054
Programming your HomeLink system
is simple, let me show you how.
00:00:08.054 --> 00:00:10.470
First, turn on your car.
00:00:10.470 --> 00:00:13.491
Hold your old transmitter a couple of
inches away from the HomeLink button
00:00:13.491 --> 00:00:15.880
you want to control your garage door with.
00:00:15.880 --> 00:00:19.880
Now press and hold both the transmitter
button and the home link button
00:00:19.880 --> 00:00:24.560
until the indicator light changes from
a slow blink to a fast one, like this.
00:00:24.560 --> 00:00:27.520
Now, press and hold the button on your
HomeLink that you want to control
00:00:27.520 --> 00:00:30.950
your garage door for
five seconds and release it.
00:00:30.950 --> 00:00:35.120
Your garage door should, move but if it
doesn't, repeat the five second hold.
00:00:35.120 --> 00:00:39.230
If your indicator light is still on
your programming is complete and you can
00:00:39.230 --> 00:00:42.860
just press and release your HomeLink
button to activate your garage door.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g_seg1.mp4
question: How do I set up my Homelink System?

For your convenience,

00:00:07.796 --> 00:00:12.030
hybrid vehicle allows you to
customize the information display.
00:00:12.030 --> 00:00:15.990
With MyView, you can choose which
combination of two informational screens or
00:00:15.990 --> 00:00:17.846

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:00:12.040 --> 00:00:14.290
First, let's talk about the accelerometer.
00:00:14.290 --> 00:00:16.080
It's part of the Track Apps feature.
00:00:16.080 --> 00:00:19.410
Using the five-way switch on the left
side of your steering wheel,
00:00:19.410 --> 00:00:21.410
select Track Apps in the Main Menu.
00:00:21.410 --> 00:00:23.822
Accelerometer, and press OK.
00:00:23.822 --> 00:00:27.630
The accelerometer displays
the vehicle's rate of acceleration, or
00:00:27.630 --> 00:00:30.672
deceleration on a virtual
gauge in the cluster, here.
00:00:30.672 --> 00:00:34.035
A red indicator dot in the center of
the gauge indicates the vehicle's
00:00:34.035 --> 00:00:37.630
longitudinal, and
latitudinal acceleration in real time.
00:00:37.630 --> 00:00:39.720
And updates it constantly.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.110
The numbers on the outside of the ring
represent the maximum accelerations
00:00:43.110 --> 00:00:44.580
since the last reset values.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg2.mp4
question: How to gain access to the Accelerometer feature?

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.183 --> 00:00:07.223
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.223 --> 00:00:10.453
The second row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded up or
00:00:10.453 --> 00:00:12.770
even removed for extra cargo space.
00:00:12.770 --> 00:00:14.480
Let me show you how to do it.
00:00:14.480 --> 00:00:16.400
To fold the second row seats forward,
00:00:16.400 --> 00:00:18.450
first push down the head
restraints like this.
00:00:19.530 --> 00:00:23.830
Now, find the strap located on the side
of the seat back closest to the door,
00:00:23.830 --> 00:00:26.260
here, and
pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:27.670 --> 00:00:32.380
Next, find the longer strap located in the
center of the backside of the seat back.
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:35.610
Pull up to unlock it,
then lift the entire seat up to tumble it.
00:00:36.980 --> 00:00:39.820
Now, secure the seat by
locating the prop rod
00:00:39.820 --> 00:00:42.470
directly below the seat inside the floor.
00:00:42.470 --> 00:00:45.530
Lift it out and snap it onto
the prop rod latch, like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg1.mp4
question: Where is the strap located on the back of the seat that lifts the entire seat up on pulling?

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:00:35.750 --> 00:00:37.500
With your gear shift lever in D,
00:00:37.500 --> 00:00:41.000
press the minus button to activate
progressive range selection.
00:00:41.000 --> 00:00:43.490
When you do,
you'll see the available gears
00:00:43.490 --> 00:00:47.150
as well as the current gear
indicated on the instrument cluster.
00:00:47.150 --> 00:00:51.350
So, if you press the minus button once,
it will lock out sixth gear.
00:00:51.350 --> 00:00:54.230
And press it again to lock out fifth,
and so on.
00:00:54.230 --> 00:00:57.640
Once you lock out gears,
only the available gears will be shown and
00:00:57.640 --> 00:00:59.960
your transmission will
automatically shift between them.
00:01:01.000 --> 00:01:03.950
The unlocked gears will automatically
reappear in the display
00:01:03.950 --> 00:01:05.070
when you restart your vehicle.
00:01:06.580 --> 00:01:09.170
To unlock a gear,
just press the plus button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg3.mp4
question: How do you get the unlocked gears to reappear on the gear display?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.720
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.720 --> 00:00:08.109
Your vehicle may be equipped with
a feature that monitors key components of
00:00:08.109 --> 00:00:10.120
a trailer that you are towing.
00:00:10.120 --> 00:00:11.580
Let me explain.
00:00:11.580 --> 00:00:15.590
The smart trailer tow connector informs
you if something regarding your trailer
00:00:15.590 --> 00:00:19.820
needs your attention via your productivity
screen under the Towing menu.
00:00:19.820 --> 00:00:23.888
Such as burned out or unlit trailer
turn signal lamps, brake lights, and
00:00:23.888 --> 00:00:25.474
trailer battery problems.
00:00:25.474 --> 00:00:28.884
Any questions, go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:28.884 --> 00:00:38.884
[MUSIC]

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:48.160 --> 00:00:49.250
Keep in mind,
00:00:49.250 --> 00:00:53.440
there are some factors that affect the
amount of energy being used while driving.
00:00:53.440 --> 00:00:57.330
For instance, mild or
aggressive acceleration or braking,
00:00:57.330 --> 00:01:01.905
your vehicle's speed, how much you use
accessories, such as climate control.
00:01:01.905 --> 00:01:06.232
The ambient temperature and other weather
conditions, as well as whether you're
00:01:06.232 --> 00:01:09.335
driving in the city or
on the highway, and the road grades.
00:01:09.335 --> 00:01:10.463
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg4.mp4
question: What are the factors that suggests quantity of energy being used while driving?

If you'd rather control

just press the distribution

Or any of the fans feed buttons.

plug in hybrid vehicle?

basic rules you can follow.

00:00:22.610 --> 00:00:26.130

and maintain the speed limit.

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:00:41.765 --> 00:00:45.610
Okay, now let's talk about how
to replace the 12-volt battery.
00:00:45.610 --> 00:00:48.657
It's located inside the cabin,
under the driver's seat.
00:00:48.657 --> 00:00:52.470
First, you'll need to move
the driver's seat all the way back.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:56.351
Next, open the two plastic screw covers
on each side of the front of the seat,
00:00:56.351 --> 00:01:00.729
by inserting your finger into the tabs and
pulling them open, they'll swing inward.
00:01:00.729 --> 00:01:06.481
Now remove the two rail stop bolts
using a T-40 type Torx bit, here.
00:01:06.481 --> 00:01:10.071
With the arm rests folded up,
slide the seat all the way forward.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg3.mp4
question: How can I replace the 12-volt battery?
