video_name: Easy Fuel Capless Fuel Filler _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Eh3snbTNR1k
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.456
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.456 --> 00:00:07.616
Your vehicle has a capless fuel filler
that saves time at the pump and
00:00:07.616 --> 00:00:09.680
keeps your hands cleaner.
00:00:09.680 --> 00:00:13.010
There's no cap to twist off and
it's simple to use.
00:00:13.010 --> 00:00:16.510
Just open your fuel door by either
putting a finger under the exposed tab
00:00:16.510 --> 00:00:17.530
on the door.
00:00:17.530 --> 00:00:19.800
Or by pushing it in a bit
until it releases and
00:00:19.800 --> 00:00:21.470
you can open it the rest of the way.
00:00:21.470 --> 00:00:25.440
Insert the nozzle all the way,
making sure it goes through both flaps.
00:00:25.440 --> 00:00:29.290
Fill up, then wait five seconds
before removing the nozzle and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:30.780
close the fuel door.
00:00:30.780 --> 00:00:32.840
If you're using a portable fuel container,
00:00:32.840 --> 00:00:36.160
you'll need to use the easy fuel funnel
provided with your vehicle to avoid
00:00:36.160 --> 00:00:38.470
damaging the seals on
the spring loaded flaps.
00:00:39.540 --> 00:00:43.720
And one more thing, to help protect
against fuel theft, splashing, or
00:00:43.720 --> 00:00:47.770
water getting in the tank, the capless
fuel filler is tamper resistant.
00:00:47.770 --> 00:00:51.440
And the self closing, spring loaded flaps
help keep fuel from sloshing out and
00:00:51.440 --> 00:00:54.550
water from leaking in when it rains or
when you wash your vehicle.
00:00:54.550 --> 00:00:55.650
Any questions?
00:00:55.650 --> 00:00:56.919
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:56.919 --> 00:01:06.919
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Easy Fuel Capless Fuel Filler _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Eh3snbTNR1k_seg1.mp4
question: How does the capless fuel filler work?

video_name: Proper Clutch Pedal Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GW_gOBEPCYE
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.603
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.603 --> 00:00:06.620
To help avoid damaging
your transmission and
00:00:06.620 --> 00:00:08.691
to help provide a better
driving experience,
00:00:08.691 --> 00:00:12.640
there are a few things you should know
about proper clutch pedal operation.
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.215
Let me explain.
00:00:14.215 --> 00:00:18.445
The manual transmission in your vehicle
has six gears along with a reverse gear.
00:00:18.445 --> 00:00:22.265
When starting your vehicle, make sure that
your clutch pedal is fully depressed.
00:00:22.265 --> 00:00:25.575
In order for your transmission and
clutch to function at it's best,
00:00:25.575 --> 00:00:29.520
you need to press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor before every shift.
00:00:29.520 --> 00:00:32.440
Then slowly release it while
pressing the accelerator.
00:00:32.440 --> 00:00:35.280
Not pressing the clutch pedal fully
between shifts can damage your
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:40.780
transmission, and you may experience
a grinding sound, rapid jerking motion,
00:00:40.780 --> 00:00:44.400
or the car may stall if the clutch
is not properly engaged.
00:00:44.400 --> 00:00:46.080
And here's another thing you should know.
00:00:46.080 --> 00:00:48.920
Don't drive with your foot
resting on the clutch pedal, or
00:00:48.920 --> 00:00:52.230
use it to hold your vehicle at
a standstill while waiting on a hill.
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:55.670
Doing so may overheat the clutch and
prematurely wear it out.
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:58.548
This could nullify
a clutch warranty claim.
00:00:58.548 --> 00:00:59.583
Any questions?
00:00:59.583 --> 00:01:02.556
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:02.556 --> 00:01:12.556
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Proper Clutch Pedal Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GW_gOBEPCYE_seg1.mp4
question: How far down should the clutch be pressed while shifting gears?

00:01:20.350 --> 00:01:24.990

the display always shows you a small top
00:01:24.990 --> 00:01:27.910

different colored lines.
00:01:30.570 --> 00:01:34.766

based on your current
steering wheel position.

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:44.190 --> 00:00:46.160
Now, let me show you how it works.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:50.420
The LATCH system consists of three
anchor points to secure your child seat.
00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.850
The two lower anchors in the seat bite,
where the back and the seat cushion meet.
00:00:54.850 --> 00:00:58.860
And the top tether anchor on the back
of or behind the vehicle seat, here.
00:01:00.520 --> 00:01:04.110
Attach the metal connectors on
the bottom of your child seat, remember,
00:01:04.110 --> 00:01:08.320
the ones that are either rigid or
on a strap, to the anchors,
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:11.350
which may be marked with
a child seat symbol, here.
00:01:11.350 --> 00:01:12.870
If your seat has straps,
00:01:12.870 --> 00:01:16.060
tighten them by pulling up until
the seat is secure and doesn't move.
00:01:16.060 --> 00:01:19.780
If your clips are on a rigid attachment,
push your seat back and
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:23.270
forth after you've attached it,
to make sure it doesn't move.
00:01:23.270 --> 00:01:27.190
Once you've installed your child seat with
the lower anchors of the latch system,
00:01:27.190 --> 00:01:31.910
attach the top tether strap under the head
rest, or over the top of the head
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:36.010
restraint, if it's not adjustable or
removable, and tighten the strap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA_seg4.mp4
question: What does the latch system in the car consist of?

00:00:41.220 --> 00:00:43.560
You'll actually feel
the wheel move a little.
00:00:43.560 --> 00:00:46.124
The modes can work together, or alone, and
00:00:46.124 --> 00:00:49.465
both use a forward-facing
camera to detect lane drift.
00:00:49.465 --> 00:00:50.623
Still with me?

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:01:10.090 --> 00:01:10.830
When braking or
00:01:10.830 --> 00:01:14.970
coasting, you'll see power flow back from
the drive train to charge the battery.
00:01:14.970 --> 00:01:17.890
This represents active
regenerative braking.
00:01:17.890 --> 00:01:21.030
When more power is needed,
the gasoline engine will turn on.
00:01:21.030 --> 00:01:24.650
For instance, when driving on a highway,
under heavy acceleration,
00:01:24.650 --> 00:01:28.670
driving in low gear, or
while the battery is in charge mode
00:01:28.670 --> 00:01:32.180
you'll see a gray power flow cap
when it's switched to hybrid power.
00:01:32.180 --> 00:01:37.063
The flow begins at the fuel tank, and goes
to the engine, and then to the wheels.

video_name: Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.364
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.364 --> 00:00:09.020
Did you know that you can fold
the back seat down in your vehicle?
00:00:09.020 --> 00:00:10.590
Here's how to do it.
00:00:10.590 --> 00:00:13.670
First, fold the outside
head restraints down and
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:16.160
lower the center head restraint like this.
00:00:16.160 --> 00:00:20.830
Next, find the lever located on
the side of the seat base, here, and
00:00:20.830 --> 00:00:22.920
pull the level up to
fold the seat back down.
00:00:24.180 --> 00:00:28.250
To unfold your seats, just pull the seat
back up into the lock position.
00:00:28.250 --> 00:00:28.920
You'll hear a click.
00:00:30.160 --> 00:00:31.300
And on some vehicles,
00:00:31.300 --> 00:00:34.870
you may see a red indicator on
the lever to let you know it's locked.
00:00:34.870 --> 00:00:36.584
Just give it a slight pull to make sure.
00:00:36.584 --> 00:00:40.486
Any questions?
00:00:40.486 --> 00:00:40.986
Go to www.FordOwner.com.
00:00:40.986 --> 00:00:50.942
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA_seg1.mp4
question: How to fold the rear seats in the car?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:25.340 --> 00:00:27.780
To turn adaptive cruise control on,
press and
00:00:27.780 --> 00:00:30.690
release the on off switch
on your steering wheel.
00:00:30.690 --> 00:00:33.560
The information display will
show a gray indicator light
00:00:33.560 --> 00:00:35.470
as well as the current gap setting.
00:00:35.470 --> 00:00:38.170
Now, accelerate to the speed you want,
00:00:38.170 --> 00:00:40.720
press the set button on your wheel and
release.
00:00:40.720 --> 00:00:43.120
Then take your foot off the accelerator.

question: How do I turn on adaptive cruise control?

video_name: Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI
video_trans:
00:00:16.330 --> 00:00:18.660
If your vehicle is equipped
with a manual transmission,
00:00:18.660 --> 00:00:22.950
be sure your vehicle is at a complete stop
before attempting to shift into reverse.
00:00:22.950 --> 00:00:26.670
Now, press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor to disengage it.
00:00:26.670 --> 00:00:31.110
Then use your fingers to pull up on the
collar located below the gear shift knob,
00:00:31.110 --> 00:00:35.105
and move the gear shift lever all
the way to the left, then forward.
00:00:35.105 --> 00:00:39.315
Remember, the gear shift can only be moved
to reverse by raising the lock-out ring.
00:00:39.315 --> 00:00:42.525
It protects the transmission from
accidentally engaging reverse when you're
00:00:42.525 --> 00:00:44.679
intending to shift into first.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI_seg2.mp4
question: How to disengage the clutch pedal?

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:01:13.142 --> 00:01:18.280
To turn Auto Unlock on or off, follow
the steps to enter the programming mode.
00:01:18.280 --> 00:01:21.570
Then press the door lock button and
then the door unlock button.
00:01:21.570 --> 00:01:25.338
The horn will chirp once,
if Auto Unlock was turned off.
00:01:25.338 --> 00:01:31.646
Or twice [NOISE], one short chirp and one
long chirp, if Auto Unlock was turned on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg5.mp4
question: How to turn Auto Unlock on or off?

video_name: SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.405 --> 00:00:03.973
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.980 --> 00:00:07.180
Did you know that your vehicle may be
equipped with a feature
00:00:07.180 --> 00:00:11.520
that allows you to stay connected and control certain
features remotely, like unlock and
00:00:11.540 --> 00:00:14.900
lock your doors as well as
remote start your vehicle?
00:00:14.920 --> 00:00:19.208
All you need is the available
Sync Connect, a compatible smartphone, and
00:00:19.208 --> 00:00:20.170
Ford Pass.
00:00:20.170 --> 00:00:21.520
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:21.520 --> 00:00:25.340
The first thing you'll need to do is
download FordPass from the App Store or
00:00:25.340 --> 00:00:28.500
Google Play and
accept the terms and conditions.
00:00:28.500 --> 00:00:33.491
If you already have a Ford owner account,
you can log in using your username and
00:00:33.491 --> 00:00:34.350
password.
00:00:34.350 --> 00:00:38.920
If not, you can create an account via the
FordPass app with some basic information
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:40.400
and a four digit PIN.
00:00:40.400 --> 00:00:43.820
You'll then need to add your
sync connect equipped vehicle.
00:00:43.820 --> 00:00:45.710
Go to the My Vehicles card.
00:00:45.710 --> 00:00:47.600
Click on Add Vehicle.
00:00:47.600 --> 00:00:50.610
To add a second vehicle hit the + button.
00:00:50.610 --> 00:00:55.500
Next, scan the VIN bar code by selecting
the Use Camera tab and point your
00:00:55.500 --> 00:00:59.920
phone's camera to the VIN label located
on your vehicle's driver door sill.
00:00:59.920 --> 00:01:02.530
You'll get a scanned successfully screen.
00:01:02.530 --> 00:01:05.570
Next, assign a vehicle nickname,
then, hit Finish.
00:01:06.590 --> 00:01:10.360
Next, you'll see this screen directing
you to activate SYNC Connect by
00:01:10.360 --> 00:01:13.200
touching the Activate SYNC Connect button.
00:01:13.200 --> 00:01:16.170
After a few minutes,
go to your vehicle and start it.
00:01:16.170 --> 00:01:19.630
You will then see this pop up
on the SYNC 3 touchscreen.
00:01:19.630 --> 00:01:20.800
Touch Allow to continue.
00:01:21.880 --> 00:01:25.843
Keep in mind, if you do not touch Allow
in the pop-up within 10 start-ups,
00:01:25.843 --> 00:01:28.306
you will not gain access
to remote features, and
00:01:28.306 --> 00:01:30.608
will need to reactivate
from the beginning.
00:01:30.608 --> 00:01:31.873
[MUSIC]
00:01:31.873 --> 00:01:36.091
Once you do, after a short period of time,
all remote features can be
00:01:36.091 --> 00:01:40.188
accessed from your smartphones
FordPass Vehicle Controls card.
00:01:40.188 --> 00:01:41.265
Any questions?
00:01:41.265 --> 00:01:44.705
Go to owner.ford.com or FordPass.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s_seg1.mp4
question: can i sync my device io my phone

00:00:04.070 --> 00:00:07.360
Did you know that you can open your
tailgate without using your hands?
00:00:07.360 --> 00:00:08.700
Let me explain.
00:00:08.700 --> 00:00:11.340
Push the tailgate release button
on your remote two times.
00:00:12.500 --> 00:00:16.220
The tailgate is dampened, which reduces
the speed that the tailgate lowers.
00:00:16.220 --> 00:00:20.280
So don't worry, it'll gradually come down
to a flat position without slamming.
00:00:20.280 --> 00:00:22.620

push it up with both hands.
00:00:23.640 --> 00:00:24.610
You can also lock and
00:00:24.610 --> 00:00:27.740
unlock the tailgate using the lock or
unlock buttons on your remote.

Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4_seg1.mp4

video_name: Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek
video_trans:
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:31.890
Here, you can change the mode to alert
00:00:31.890 --> 00:00:34.440
which will vibrate your steering
wheel if you start to drift.
00:00:36.040 --> 00:00:39.990
Aid, which uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer the car back
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:40.886
into the target lane.
00:00:40.886 --> 00:00:44.480
Or Alert + Aid which gives
you both sets of cues.
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.870
Unlike when you're in the alert mode,
in the combined mode,
00:00:48.870 --> 00:00:52.520
you won't feel the alert vibration
until you're further out of your lane.

simply press either the left or right or
00:00:46.262 --> 00:00:48.405

00:00:48.405 --> 00:00:52.102
Plus, driver and passenger security

00:00:52.102 --> 00:00:54.350

And come on automatically when you

00:02:05.170 --> 00:02:09.670
depending on how the vehicle is set up,

00:02:09.670 --> 00:02:13.120

00:00:28.610 --> 00:00:33.220

00:00:33.220 --> 00:00:37.200

video_trans:
00:00:09.330 --> 00:00:13.670
Let me explain. Selectable Driving Mode
instantly modifies the electronic
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:17.230
stability control system and traction
control, which help maintain your vehicle's
00:00:17.230 --> 00:00:20.170
command of the road in poor conditions,
or high performance driving.
00:00:21.280 --> 00:00:24.220
It also enhances throttle response for
quick acceleration,
00:00:24.220 --> 00:00:29.170
crisper transmission shift points,
and finally steering effort and feel.
00:00:29.170 --> 00:00:32.270
Together the selectable driving
mounts automatically tailor your
00:00:32.270 --> 00:00:35.290
vehicles performance to
the mode you've selected.

question: What does traction control do?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:03:34.680 --> 00:03:38.160
Okay, now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the systems
00:03:38.165 --> 00:03:42.200
information display using
the five-way steering wheel controls.
00:03:42.200 --> 00:03:46.380
To input the measurements you recorded
outside of the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:46.380 --> 00:03:49.900
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:49.900 --> 00:03:53.960
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed, like this.
00:03:53.960 --> 00:03:58.510
Then OK to confirm each measurement and
to and to move onto the next measurement.
00:03:58.510 --> 00:04:00.310
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:04:00.310 --> 00:04:03.740
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:04:03.740 --> 00:04:06.255
If correct select confirm and hit OK.
00:04:07.400 --> 00:04:10.570
Once you confirm the measurements
the system will automatically search for
00:04:10.570 --> 00:04:13.720
the sticker target and
highlight it with the red circle.
00:04:13.720 --> 00:04:15.990
A message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:04:15.990 --> 00:04:18.590
If it is, select Yes to confirm.
00:04:18.590 --> 00:04:21.730
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know set-up is complete and
00:04:21.730 --> 00:04:22.640
measurements are saved.
00:04:23.870 --> 00:04:26.850
If you do not see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:04:26.850 --> 00:04:29.210
Make sure the measurements are correct,
and that the trailer and
00:04:29.210 --> 00:04:31.530
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:04:31.530 --> 00:04:35.710
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straight forward between four and
00:04:35.710 --> 00:04:37.340
25 miles per hour as directed,
00:04:37.340 --> 00:04:41.100
until you get a message confirming
calibration is complete.
00:04:41.100 --> 00:04:44.100
Keep in mind,
once you input your trailer's information
00:04:44.100 --> 00:04:47.360
into the information display,
it is stored for easy recall.
00:04:47.360 --> 00:04:49.960
So, you'll only need to do this one time.
00:04:49.960 --> 00:04:52.868
Every additional trailer will
require repeating the process.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg5.mp4
question: how to input the measurement into the information display?

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:00:26.460 --> 00:00:29.570
To lock your doors, simply press
the sensor on the door handle for
00:00:29.570 --> 00:00:30.890
about a half a second.
00:00:30.890 --> 00:00:33.470
It'll have ridges or
a square sensor like this.
00:00:34.530 --> 00:00:36.300
When you hear them click,
you'll know they're locked.
00:00:37.450 --> 00:00:41.090
Or you can press the lock/unlock
button on the inside door panel
00:00:41.090 --> 00:00:44.280
before closing the door and
it will automatically lock.

It appears when you're in drive or

00:00:56.680 --> 00:00:59.200

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:50.630 --> 00:01:53.520
Using the turn signal for
lane changes deactivates it.
00:01:53.520 --> 00:01:57.720
So it won't interfere in daily
driving with frequent turns and stops.
00:01:57.720 --> 00:02:01.630
Keep in mind, if you're driving and
don't have a firm grip on the wheel, or
00:02:01.630 --> 00:02:05.360
if you're on a straight part of the road
that doesn't require much steering input,
00:02:05.360 --> 00:02:09.290
the car may think you're not holding on,
and may alert you to do so.

Any questions?

video_trans:
00:01:00.980 --> 00:01:04.100
Okay, now I'll quickly discuss
the short strap mentioned earlier.
00:01:04.100 --> 00:01:07.460
To fold the second row seats from
the third row, pull the short strap, and
00:01:07.460 --> 00:01:09.980
the seat back will fold down forward.
00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780
Next, pull the longer
strap to unlock the seat.
00:01:12.780 --> 00:01:15.490
Now, push the seat forward and down.
00:01:15.490 --> 00:01:18.690
Your vehicle also has folding floor
support panels that makes stowing
00:01:18.690 --> 00:01:20.150
cargo easier.
00:01:20.150 --> 00:01:20.910
With the second and
00:01:20.910 --> 00:01:25.670
third row seats folded down, grab hold of
the panels and pull to disconnect them.
00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:28.740
You may need to give them a little tug
to disengage them from their magnetic
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:29.850
fasteners.
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:31.910
Then unfold like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg3.mp4

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
00:00:46.760 --> 00:00:49.690
To put the seats back into their
original upright position,
00:00:49.690 --> 00:00:53.640
unfasten the prop rod and
stow it back into the slot in the floor.
00:00:53.640 --> 00:00:57.700
Then pull the entire seat down and
press it into its locked position.
00:00:57.700 --> 00:00:59.410
You'll hear it click into place.
00:00:59.410 --> 00:01:03.220
Finally, pull up on the shorter strap
closest to the seat back side, and
00:01:03.220 --> 00:01:04.600
flip the seat back up.

video_name: Trailer Sway Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-jBHFDhd7638
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.784
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.784 --> 00:00:08.220
Is there any way to keep
my trailer from swaying?
00:00:10.150 --> 00:00:12.310
>> Is there any way to reduce
the sway from my trailer?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:16.510
>> For those of you who like to tow,
Ford has something that can help reduce
00:00:16.510 --> 00:00:19.330
how much your trailer sways
while you are driving.
00:00:19.330 --> 00:00:20.180
Here's how it works.
00:00:20.180 --> 00:00:25.060
If your trailer starts to sway, you'll see
the stability control light flash, and
00:00:25.060 --> 00:00:29.150
a trailer sway reduce speed message
in your information display.
00:00:29.150 --> 00:00:32.380
The trailer sway controller feature
will begin to apply the brakes to
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:36.210
individual wheels, and
reduce your engine power if needed.
00:00:36.210 --> 00:00:39.800
If this happens, it's likely that
your trailer is improperly loaded, or
00:00:39.800 --> 00:00:42.620
the speed of your vehicle and
trailer are too high.
00:00:42.620 --> 00:00:45.960
Slow down, pull your vehicle off the road,
and make sure that
00:00:45.960 --> 00:00:50.270
your trailer is connected correctly and
your load is distributed properly.
00:00:50.270 --> 00:00:53.250
Then drive at a slower speed than
you were before the sway occurred.
00:00:54.390 --> 00:00:56.300
And here's something
else you need to know.
00:00:56.300 --> 00:01:00.173
Trailer sway control will not affect how
your vehicle handles in normal driving
00:01:00.173 --> 00:01:02.725
conditions, or
when you're not towing a trailer.
00:01:02.725 --> 00:01:03.518
Any questions?
00:01:03.518 --> 00:01:04.904
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:04.904 --> 00:01:14.904
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Sway Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-jBHFDhd7638_seg1.mp4
question: what is trailer sway control?

video_name: Rear Decklid Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fjh0-VKzUEk
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.036
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.036 --> 00:00:08.658
There are a few convenient ways to gain
access to the rear luggage compartment in
00:00:08.658 --> 00:00:09.600
your vehicle.
00:00:09.600 --> 00:00:11.210
Let me explain.
00:00:11.210 --> 00:00:14.360
From the driver's seat, simply push
the trunk release button on the lower left
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.520
side of the instrument panel next to the
steering column to unlatch the rear deck lid.
00:00:18.520 --> 00:00:20.230
With the standard Intelligent Access,
00:00:20.230 --> 00:00:24.120
you can get into your vehicle remotely
without reaching for your key fob.
00:00:24.120 --> 00:00:25.320
With your key fob on you,
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:29.350
just press the trunk release button
located above the license plate here.
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:32.071
It's that simple.
00:00:32.071 --> 00:00:33.095
Any questions?
00:00:33.095 --> 00:00:34.727
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:34.727 --> 00:00:44.727
[MUSIC]

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:26.290 --> 00:00:28.460
When a vehicle enters into
a lane to the right or
00:00:28.460 --> 00:00:33.215
left, BLIS warns you with a solid light
on the corresponding side view mirror.
00:00:33.215 --> 00:00:36.115
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:37.155 --> 00:00:39.805
Also, whenever you
activate your turn signal,
00:00:39.805 --> 00:00:42.995
if a vehicle is within the blind
spot zone, BLIS will give you
00:00:42.995 --> 00:00:46.465
a flashing light warning on
the corresponding side view mirror.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg3.mp4
question: When will BLIS warn you with a solid light on the side view mirror?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:01:32.170 --> 00:01:34.792
Once the data of cruise is on,
it uses radar and
00:01:34.792 --> 00:01:39.048
camera technology to constantly scan for
slower vehicles in front of you.
00:01:39.048 --> 00:01:42.403
And automatically adjusts your
speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:42.403 --> 00:01:46.639
You may notice that on occasion, you go
slower than you initially set your cruise for.
00:01:46.639 --> 00:01:49.018
That's the system adjusting the speed.
00:01:49.018 --> 00:01:52.902
Once traffic speeds up,
you'll return to the speed you set.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg7.mp4

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg3.mp4
question: What color is the warning color?

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:45.300 --> 00:00:48.655
In order to convert the 40 amp
relays to key off battery use,
00:00:48.655 --> 00:00:50.565
there are a few steps you'll need to take.
00:00:50.565 --> 00:00:53.995
First, you'll need to locate
the relay box under the engine hood,
00:00:53.995 --> 00:00:56.015
next to the driver side fender, here.
00:00:57.115 --> 00:01:00.950
Then remove the relay cover by
pressing the tab and lifting it off.
00:01:00.950 --> 00:01:03.060
Next, locate the five amp fuse.
00:01:04.180 --> 00:01:07.900
You'll then need to pull it out,
slide the spacer over, and place it so
00:01:07.900 --> 00:01:12.740
the left prong is in the far left slot and
the right prong is in the middle slot.
00:01:12.740 --> 00:01:16.900
Replace the cover and your 40 amp circuits
are now set to run on battery power
00:01:16.900 --> 00:01:18.930
even with the key out of the truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg4.mp4
question: Where would you find the relay box on this vehicle?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:13.790 --> 00:00:16.520
Brake Coach works to help you
maximize the amount of energy
00:00:16.520 --> 00:00:19.350
captured through your
regenerative braking system.
00:00:19.350 --> 00:00:21.910
Regenerative braking works with
your standard brake system by
00:00:21.910 --> 00:00:25.170
recovering energy that is usually
lost through your friction brakes and
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:27.350
engine drag during braking or coasting.
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.810
And then storing that recovered energy
in your battery to help maximize efficiency.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg2.mp4
question: What feature maximizes the amount of energy captured through your braking system?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.373 --> 00:00:04.620
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.620 --> 00:00:08.358
Your vehicle has an available feature
that's designed to help reduce fuel
00:00:08.358 --> 00:00:12.640
consumption and the amount of emissions,
it's called Auto Start Stop.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg1.mp4
question: What is auto start/stop used for?

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:45.230 --> 00:00:47.680
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:47.680 --> 00:00:52.470
you'll want to have the trailer screen up
on your LCD productivity screen, here.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:54.840
To get there, go to Truck Apps,
00:00:54.840 --> 00:00:57.930
then push the right arrow twice
until you see the trailer display.
00:00:58.940 --> 00:01:03.460
Unless a trailer is connected, the display
will read, Trailer Disconnected.
00:01:03.460 --> 00:01:06.740
As soon as a trailer is connected,
you'll see this message.
00:01:06.740 --> 00:01:08.100
Press OK.
00:01:08.100 --> 00:01:12.680
Once the trailer connected message
goes away, you'll see gain setting.
00:01:12.680 --> 00:01:16.370
This is what we talked about earlier, and
a bar graph that lights up to show you
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:19.390
the amount of power going
to the trailer brakes.
00:01:19.390 --> 00:01:23.960
From the trailer display, press OK, and
choose the Connection Checklist option.
00:01:25.110 --> 00:01:27.640
It corresponds to
different trailer types and
00:01:27.640 --> 00:01:32.160
walks you through the connection process
to remind you of the necessary steps.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg3.mp4
question: How to check if trailer is connected or not on LCD productivity screen of your vehicle?

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:00:23.630 --> 00:00:26.800
Here are few simple steps you'll
need to know when using them.
00:00:26.800 --> 00:00:31.170
If you want to use auto lamp, turn the
control knob to the auto lamp position.
00:00:31.170 --> 00:00:35.355
Your head lamps will come on automatically
as needed and will stay on for
00:00:35.355 --> 00:00:38.005
a while even after you
switch the ignition off.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I_seg2.mp4
question: how long the Auto Lamp stay ON?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:02:03.200 --> 00:02:07.270
Replay allows you to listen to up to 44
minutes of previously cast contents from
00:02:07.270 --> 00:02:08.000
the current channel.
00:02:09.280 --> 00:02:13.060
The system will begin storing
content once a channel is selected.
00:02:13.060 --> 00:02:16.570
To replay a song,
just tape the seek back button once and
00:02:16.570 --> 00:02:18.700
it will jump back to the prior song.
00:02:18.700 --> 00:02:20.290
To jump multiple songs or
00:02:20.290 --> 00:02:24.960
listen to content farther back,
tap the seek back button multiple times.
00:02:24.960 --> 00:02:28.640
To return to real time content,
touch the Replay button again and
00:02:28.640 --> 00:02:31.040
it will bring you back to live audio.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg7.mp4
question: How can I go back to live audio?

video_name: SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q
video_trans:
00:00:32.214 --> 00:00:35.677
Speaking of codes, your keypad comes
with one that's preprogrammed.
00:00:35.677 --> 00:00:39.395
Just enter that five digit code
to unlock the driver's door.
00:00:39.395 --> 00:00:42.880
Then press 3 4 to unlock all the doors.
00:00:42.880 --> 00:00:46.016
To pop your trunk or
your manual lift gate, enter the code.
00:00:46.016 --> 00:00:48.168
Then press 5-6.
00:00:48.168 --> 00:00:53.185
To lock all of your doors,
press 7-8 and 9-0 at the same time.
00:00:53.185 --> 00:00:54.032
[MUSIC]

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:01:24.640 --> 00:01:28.230
Countdown provides a racing
Christmas tree style start timer.
00:01:28.230 --> 00:01:31.480
To use it, scroll to accelerator
timer in the track apps menu,
00:01:31.480 --> 00:01:33.670
and follow the prompts.
00:01:33.670 --> 00:01:36.800
Colors will flash in half
second intervals: yellow,
00:01:36.800 --> 00:01:38.080
green, red.
00:01:38.080 --> 00:01:42.550
If the driver accelerates early the light
will turn red indicating a false start,
00:01:42.550 --> 00:01:43.730
and no data will be recorded.

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:00:11.300 --> 00:00:15.100
The power button located in the upper
left corner of the function control panel
00:00:15.100 --> 00:00:17.050
turns your climate system on.
00:00:17.050 --> 00:00:21.020
You also have fan speed controls,
a recirculated air button
00:00:21.020 --> 00:00:25.320
that let's you switch between outside air
and air circulated within the vehicle.
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:28.990
A distribution control that allows you to
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.005
come through the instrument panel vents,
floor vents or
00:00:32.005 --> 00:00:34.115
through the defrost vent at
the base of the wind shield.
00:00:35.205 --> 00:00:39.003
You'll also find an A/C button,
a rear defrost button and
00:00:39.003 --> 00:00:41.945
Max A/C and Max Defrost buttons.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg2.mp4
question: Does it have fan speed controls?

video_trans:
00:00:38.950 --> 00:00:43.280
Miles per charge is an estimate of your
EV range with a fully charged battery.
00:00:43.280 --> 00:00:45.940
This estimate is based on your
energy usage while driving.
00:00:47.180 --> 00:00:49.740
Energy usage is affected
by your driving style and
00:00:49.740 --> 00:00:54.680
route, climate control use,
outside temperature and other factors.

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:00:41.960 --> 00:00:43.760
If you turn the trailer to the right,
00:00:43.760 --> 00:00:47.240
you'll see the right side of your
vehicle and trailer and vice versa.
00:00:47.240 --> 00:00:51.480
You can switch views manually at
any time by using the arrow keys.
00:00:51.480 --> 00:00:57.820
Either full driver, partial driver, 50-50,
partial passenger or full passenger.
00:00:58.990 --> 00:01:01.740
Pressing the Camera icon takes
you to Normal Rear View,
00:01:01.740 --> 00:01:05.160
which allows you to see your trailer hitch
or what is directly behind your truck.
00:01:06.850 --> 00:01:10.340
Pressing the Plus button zooms in,
pressing the Return or
00:01:10.340 --> 00:01:14.610
Back button takes you back to
the 360 degree camera system.
00:01:14.610 --> 00:01:16.650
And Auto returns you to
Automatic View Mode.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg3.mp4
question: What do you see if you turn the trailer to the right?

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
00:00:57.840 --> 00:01:01.330
Okay, now let's take
a look at the rear wipers.
00:01:01.330 --> 00:01:05.880
The switch at the end of the stock allows
you to turn them on and select your speed.
00:01:05.880 --> 00:01:08.010
The first position is for
intermittent wiping.
00:01:10.050 --> 00:01:11.860
The second is for a continuous wipe.
00:01:13.570 --> 00:01:16.120
And O is off for the wiper.

video_name: Adjustable Tilt_Telescoping Steering Column _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TlWXbGtYrTQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.321 --> 00:00:04.941
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.941 --> 00:00:09.051
Your steering wheel can be adjusted to
make driving even more comfortable,
00:00:09.051 --> 00:00:10.370
let me show you how.
00:00:10.370 --> 00:00:12.990
First, make sure you're
comfortable in your seat.
00:00:12.990 --> 00:00:15.550
This will ensure that you're moving
your wheel to the correct position.
00:00:16.730 --> 00:00:20.680
Now, unlock the steering column by
pulling the release lever either down and
00:00:20.680 --> 00:00:24.000
away or down and toward you.
00:00:24.000 --> 00:00:28.730
Move the steering wheel to a good spot for
you by tilting it up or down, or
00:00:28.730 --> 00:00:32.140
by either pulling it toward you or
pushing it away from you.
00:00:33.230 --> 00:00:35.750
Once you have it in the right position,
lock it by
00:00:35.750 --> 00:00:40.410
pushing the same lever you used to unlock
it, only in the opposite direction.
00:00:40.410 --> 00:00:41.590
Any questions?
00:00:41.590 --> 00:00:42.115
Go to
00:00:42.115 --> 00:00:52.115
FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjustable Tilt_Telescoping Steering Column _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TlWXbGtYrTQ_seg1.mp4
question: how do you lock the steering wheel?

video_name: One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk
video_trans:
00:00:56.930 --> 00:01:00.210
Keep in mind, if you continuously open and
close your windows in a short period of
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:04.370
time, it may cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:04.370 --> 00:01:08.270
Also, if you press the window switch
quickly from the first to second position,
00:01:08.270 --> 00:01:11.180
it can cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:11.180 --> 00:01:14.977
If this happens, release the switch,
wait a moment, then press it again.
00:01:14.977 --> 00:01:18.983
And remember, touching the switch at
all while the window is opening or
00:01:18.983 --> 00:01:20.270
closing will stop it.
00:01:21.640 --> 00:01:22.260
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk_seg6.mp4
question: What will happen if you touch the switch switch at all while the window is opening or closing?

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:01:41.440 --> 00:01:46.261
For more convenience, you can also set
it up to send you automatic reminders to
00:01:46.261 --> 00:01:50.935
prompt you to run a report by pressing on,
and then choose whether you want to
00:01:50.935 --> 00:01:55.338
be reminded every 5,000,
7,500, or 10,000 miles.
00:01:55.338 --> 00:01:59.490
You can opt out at any time by
turning automatic reminders off.

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:00.980 --> 00:01:04.100
Okay, now I'll quickly discuss
the short strap mentioned earlier.
00:01:04.100 --> 00:01:07.460
To fold the second row seats from
the third row, pull the short strap, and
00:01:07.460 --> 00:01:09.980
the seat back will fold down forward.
00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780
Next, pull the longer
strap to unlock the seat.
00:01:12.780 --> 00:01:15.490
Now, push the seat forward and down.
00:01:15.490 --> 00:01:18.690
Your vehicle also has folding floor
support panels that makes stowing
00:01:18.690 --> 00:01:20.150
cargo easier.
00:01:20.150 --> 00:01:20.910
With the second and
00:01:20.910 --> 00:01:25.670
third row seats folded down, grab hold of
the panels and pull to disconnect them.
00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:28.740
You may need to give them a little tug
to disengage them from their magnetic
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:29.850
fasteners.
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:31.910
Then unfold like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg3.mp4
question: What must you give a little tug to in order to disengage from their magnetic fasteners?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.243 --> 00:00:05.369
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.369 --> 00:00:08.637
Your vehicle has a few features that are
designed to help alert you when a car is
00:00:08.637 --> 00:00:12.550
in your blind spot or approaching from
either side when you're backing up slowly.

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.360
Here's how it works.
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.500
Auto Start Stop automatically turns on
at startup unless you decided to turn it
00:00:18.500 --> 00:00:22.840
off using the on off button located
on the center console, here.
00:00:22.840 --> 00:00:25.570
You'll know it's activated when
you see the start-stop icon
00:00:25.570 --> 00:00:28.180
illuminated in your instrument cluster.
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:29.590
When you put your foot on the brake and
00:00:29.590 --> 00:00:33.690
come to a full stop, like at a red light,
your engine shuts off.
00:00:33.690 --> 00:00:35.580
You might not even notice it, but
00:00:35.580 --> 00:00:38.800
a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know the engine is off.
00:00:38.800 --> 00:00:39.580
But don't worry.
00:00:39.580 --> 00:00:44.100
Your climate control settings, radio,
and head lamps will function normally.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.870
And when you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.710
your car automatically restarts,
without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg2.mp4
question: When does auto start stop automatically turn on?

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:01:16.650 --> 00:01:20.350
Here are a few more things you'll
need to know when using the feature.
00:01:20.350 --> 00:01:24.990
After setting up and selecting a trailer,
the display always shows you a small top
00:01:24.990 --> 00:01:27.910
view representation of your truck and
trailer.
00:01:27.910 --> 00:01:30.570
You'll also see two
different colored lines.
00:01:30.570 --> 00:01:34.766
A black line shows you where your
trailer is in relation to your vehicle.
00:01:34.766 --> 00:01:37.800
And a white line gives you a projection
of where your trailer will go
00:01:37.800 --> 00:01:40.420
based on your current
steering wheel position.

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:59.300 --> 00:01:02.040
To set the blind spot
detection on a trailer,
00:01:02.040 --> 00:01:06.000
use the five way switch on your steering
wheel and select type of trailer.
00:01:06.000 --> 00:01:09.920
Keep in mind, BLIS only supports
conventional-type trailers.
00:01:09.920 --> 00:01:12.764
Other types selected with
automatically turn off the BLIS and
00:01:12.764 --> 00:01:14.700
cross-traffic alert feature.
00:01:14.700 --> 00:01:17.980
Next, you'll be asked if you want
to set up BLIS with a trailer.
00:01:17.980 --> 00:01:20.010
If no, BLIS turns off.
00:01:20.010 --> 00:01:24.960
If yes, you'll be asked if the trailer is
less than nine feet wide and 33 feet long.
00:01:24.960 --> 00:01:26.720
Now, enter length of trailer,
00:01:26.720 --> 00:01:29.890
which is the length of the hitch
bulb to the end of the trailer.
00:01:29.890 --> 00:01:34.230
You do so by toggling up or down,
using the menu buttons to increase or
00:01:34.230 --> 00:01:36.560
decrease the measurement by three feet.
00:01:36.560 --> 00:01:38.790
You'll need to select
the length that is equal to or
00:01:38.790 --> 00:01:43.070
greater than three feet of the actual
trailer to allow for full coverage.
00:01:43.070 --> 00:01:49.240
For example, if the actual measured length
is 25 feet, input the length to 27 feet.
00:01:49.240 --> 00:01:52.290
Once the length has been entered,
the setup is saved.
00:01:52.290 --> 00:01:54.570
If the trailer has been connected but
no information for
00:01:54.570 --> 00:01:58.890
that trailer has been entered, the system
will ask for trailer information.
00:01:58.890 --> 00:02:03.250
If no trailer information is entered, BLIS
and cross-traffic alert will be disabled.
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:07.620
It's important to remember that if you
select a trailer in the display screen
00:02:07.620 --> 00:02:11.790
prior to connecting the trailer, the
system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be
stored under towing information for
00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695
BLIS with trailer blind spot
coverage to be active while towing.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg5.mp4
question: How can I set the BLIS blind spot detector with the type of trailer that I have attached to my vehicle?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:17.518 --> 00:01:21.390
While in tow/haul mode, the truck
will react slower to driver input
00:01:21.390 --> 00:01:26.130
at higher speeds, which allow both truck
and trailer to follow your intended path,
00:01:26.130 --> 00:01:30.580
while also maintaining the ease of parking
and performing low speed maneuvers.
00:01:30.580 --> 00:01:34.490
When starting or turning off your vehicle,
you might hear a faint click sound,
00:01:34.490 --> 00:01:36.670
this is just part of
the system's initialization and
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.270
shutdown process,
don't worry, this is normal.

question: Will I have a problem accelerating when I'm tow haul mode?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:54.590 --> 00:00:59.120
Once adaptive cruise is on, it uses radar
to constantly scan for slower vehicles in
00:00:59.120 --> 00:01:03.100
front of you and automatically adjust
your speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:03.100 --> 00:01:04.630
You may notice that on occasion,
00:01:04.630 --> 00:01:07.600
you go slower than you
initially set your cruise for.
00:01:07.600 --> 00:01:10.540
But don't worry,
the system is still working.
00:01:10.540 --> 00:01:13.850
Once traffic is cleared,
you'll return to the speed you set.

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:03:07.000 --> 00:03:09.700
Now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the system's
00:03:09.700 --> 00:03:10.640
information display.
00:03:11.720 --> 00:03:15.190
To input the measurements you recorded
outside the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:15.190 --> 00:03:18.540
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:18.540 --> 00:03:21.130
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed.
00:03:21.130 --> 00:03:24.444
Like this,
then OK to confirm each measurement and
00:03:24.444 --> 00:03:26.769
to move on to the next measurement.
00:03:26.769 --> 00:03:28.618
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:03:28.618 --> 00:03:31.761
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:03:31.761 --> 00:03:35.591
If correct, select Confirm and hit OK.
00:03:35.591 --> 00:03:39.573
Once you've confirmed the measurements,
the system will automatically search for
00:03:39.573 --> 00:03:42.172
the sticker target and
highlight it with a red circle and
00:03:42.172 --> 00:03:44.391
the message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:03:44.391 --> 00:03:47.495
If it is, select yes to confirm.
00:03:47.495 --> 00:03:50.762
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know setup is complete and
00:03:50.762 --> 00:03:51.927
measurements are saved.
00:03:51.927 --> 00:03:54.753
If you don't see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:03:54.753 --> 00:03:57.201
Make sure the measurements are correct and
that the trailer and
00:03:57.201 --> 00:03:59.115
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:03:59.115 --> 00:04:03.779
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straightforward between 4 and 25 miles per
00:04:03.779 --> 00:04:07.844
hour as directed until you get a message
confirming calibration is complete.
00:04:07.844 --> 00:04:08.911
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg6.mp4
question: How do you input the measurements of a trailer using the information display?

video_name: How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo
video_trans:

Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.081 --> 00:00:03.902
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.902 --> 00:00:06.147
Your vehicle may be equipped
with power outlets,
00:00:06.147 --> 00:00:09.900
where you can charge devices like laptops,
rechargeable power tools, and more.
00:00:09.900 --> 00:00:12.030
Let me explain.
00:00:12.030 --> 00:00:14.190
There are two outlets in your vehicle.
00:00:14.190 --> 00:00:18.710
One in the instrument panel, here, and
one in the rear of the center console
00:00:18.710 --> 00:00:21.650
that is easily accessible for
someone in the back seat.
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:25.510
The outlets can charge when your truck is
running ,and can deliver up to 400 watts
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:29.650
when you're parked or idling, and
up to 300 watts when you're driving.
00:00:29.650 --> 00:00:33.970
Keep in mind, when using power tools,
the power outlets are only to be used for
00:00:33.970 --> 00:00:37.600
recharging and
should not be used as a main power source.
00:00:37.600 --> 00:00:38.303
Any questions?
00:00:38.303 --> 00:00:40.149
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:40.149 --> 00:00:50.149
[MUSIC]

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:00:49.240 --> 00:00:51.890
Remote start is especially nice
when you want to cool off your
00:00:51.890 --> 00:00:53.670
car before getting in on a hot day.
00:00:54.880 --> 00:00:58.590
In fact, if your car has automatic
climate control it will actually
00:00:58.590 --> 00:01:02.520
gauge the temperature inside the car and
adjust it to a more comfortable setting.
00:01:02.520 --> 00:01:06.340
This means that your heated seats,
steering wheel, and
00:01:06.340 --> 00:01:10.090
defrost will turn on on colder days and
your air conditioning and
00:01:10.090 --> 00:01:11.960
cooled seats will turn
on when it is warm out.

question: What determines automatic climate control inside the car using auto-start?

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:45.300 --> 00:00:48.655
In order to convert the 40 amp
relays to key off battery use,
00:00:48.655 --> 00:00:50.565
there are a few steps you'll need to take.
00:00:50.565 --> 00:00:53.995
First, you'll need to locate
the relay box under the engine hood,
00:00:53.995 --> 00:00:56.015
next to the driver side fender, here.
00:00:57.115 --> 00:01:00.950
Then remove the relay cover by
pressing the tab and lifting it off.
00:01:00.950 --> 00:01:03.060
Next, locate the five amp fuse.
00:01:04.180 --> 00:01:07.900
You'll then need to pull it out,
slide the spacer over, and place it so
00:01:07.900 --> 00:01:12.740
the left prong is in the far left slot and
the right prong is in the middle slot.
00:01:12.740 --> 00:01:16.900
Replace the cover and your 40 amp circuits
are now set to run on battery power
00:01:16.900 --> 00:01:18.930
even with the key out of the truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg4.mp4
question: How dangerous is it to move the fuse myself?

spirited driving situations.

If you're not sure what type of
lights you have, look for the VOL or
00:00:53.530 --> 00:00:54.730
VOR mark on your lamps.
00:00:55.900 --> 00:00:59.960
If you have HID lamps, you'll want
the top of the beam to be about two
00:00:59.960 --> 00:01:01.800
inches below the tape mark you made.
00:01:01.800 --> 00:01:07.080
If you have halogen lamps, the top of the
beam should be right on your tape mark.
00:01:07.080 --> 00:01:08.320
Still with me?

video_trans:
00:00:44.400 --> 00:00:48.970
Just push up on the stalk to the single
triangle for a normal, continuous wipe, or
00:00:48.970 --> 00:00:50.840
to the double triangle for faster wiping.
00:00:52.090 --> 00:00:54.560
To wash the windshield,
just pull the stock towards you.
00:00:55.630 --> 00:00:57.840
So far, so good, right?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:29.400
Let me explain, adaptive steering with
tow/haul mode, changes the ratio between
00:00:29.400 --> 00:00:32.570
the driver's actions with the steering
wheel, meaning how much the driver
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:36.630
turns the steering wheel, and
how much the front wheels actually turn.
00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg2.mp4
question: How does this feature work in the vehicle?

00:01:46.030 --> 00:01:48.130

00:01:48.130 --> 00:01:51.420
Without letting go of the button,
turn the ignition on in you car and
00:01:51.420 --> 00:01:52.890
your programming should be complete.

Any questions?

00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.454

00:00:27.872 --> 00:00:30.510

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: Does auto stop shut off my engine at every stop?

video_trans:
00:00:57.840 --> 00:01:01.330
Okay, now let's take
a look at the rear wipers.
00:01:01.330 --> 00:01:05.880
The switch at the end of the stock allows
you to turn them on and select your speed.
00:01:05.880 --> 00:01:08.010
The first position is for
intermittent wiping.
00:01:10.050 --> 00:01:11.860
The second is for a continuous wipe.
00:01:13.570 --> 00:01:16.120
And O is off for the wiper.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc_seg4.mp4

One more thing: vehicles equipped with
EcoSelect will also get the benefits of
00:00:45.715 --> 00:00:49.360
EcoCruise, which helps maximize economy
while driving on hilly roadways,
00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:52.974
where the vehicle may temporarily lose a
small amount of speed while going uphill.

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:01:06.450 --> 00:01:10.310
If at any time the battery in your remote
dies or the signal is interrupted,
00:01:10.310 --> 00:01:14.320
you can use the removable key
inside to unlock the driver's door.
00:01:14.320 --> 00:01:16.110
Just press the button and
slide the key out.
00:01:17.180 --> 00:01:19.920
Next, insert the key into the slot located
00:01:19.920 --> 00:01:22.440
underneath the rear of
the driver's door handle and
00:01:22.440 --> 00:01:26.320
push up until you feel the internal
tab flex and unlock the plastic bezel.
00:01:27.520 --> 00:01:30.560
Slide the bezel back to
completely remove it.
00:01:30.560 --> 00:01:35.220
When you do, you'll be able to access
the key cylinder and unlock your door.
00:01:35.220 --> 00:01:36.350
To replace the bezel,
00:01:36.350 --> 00:01:39.410
slide it forward until you feel
it snap into the locked position.
00:01:40.650 --> 00:01:44.537
Once you're in, there's a pocket in the
center console made just for the key fob.
00:01:44.537 --> 00:01:46.680
It'll allow you to start your car.
00:01:46.680 --> 00:01:49.860
Place the key fob in the slot
with the button's facing up and
00:01:49.860 --> 00:01:52.810
the unlock button towards
the front of the vehicle.
00:01:52.810 --> 00:01:56.695
Keep in mind, because the key is
programmed to your car, if you lose it,
00:01:56.695 --> 00:01:59.050
you'll need to contact your dealer for
a replacement.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c_seg6.mp4
question: how to use the removable key to to open the doors of the vehicle?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
00:00:40.240 --> 00:00:43.325
Here are a few important things you
should know when using Auto Start-Stop.
00:00:44.590 --> 00:00:48.468
Your electric power assisted steering
is inactive when your engine is off.
00:00:48.468 --> 00:00:52.270
And Auto Start-Stop may not shut the
engine off if your battery is charging,
00:00:52.270 --> 00:00:56.770
the engine is still warming up, or if
you're using the heat or air conditioner.
00:00:56.770 --> 00:01:00.930
So, if you AC is on because it's warm
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:02.170 --> 00:01:03.260
One more thing.
00:01:03.260 --> 00:01:07.120
Your vehicle is equipped with a heavy duty
starter and battery to help compensate for
00:01:07.120 --> 00:01:08.930
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w_seg3.mp4
question: What exactly is auto stop start?

00:00:08.061 --> 00:00:11.794

reacting more smoothly at higher speeds
00:00:11.794 --> 00:00:16.010

to maneuver at lower speeds.

Plus, when activated, tow/haul mode delays
up shifts and provides engine braking when
00:00:20.580 --> 00:00:24.510

a trailer or hauling heavy loads.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:13.850 --> 00:01:18.030
You can adjust your follow distance using
the gap control on your steering wheel.
00:01:18.030 --> 00:01:20.950
Pressing it up decreases your
follow distance setting and
00:01:20.950 --> 00:01:23.910
allows your car to follow
at a closer distance.
00:01:23.910 --> 00:01:26.589
And pressing it down increases
your follow distance and
00:01:26.589 --> 00:01:30.320
expands the distance between you and
a car in front of you.

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:00:11.610 --> 00:00:14.840
First, you'll notice all the normal
climate features you would typically find
00:00:14.840 --> 00:00:16.150
on most cars.
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:20.250
A climate system power button, which turns
the climate control system off and on.
00:00:20.250 --> 00:00:24.370
A fan speed control or a circulating air
button that let's you switch between
00:00:24.370 --> 00:00:27.450
outside air and
air circulating within the car.
00:00:27.450 --> 00:00:30.395
A distribution control that lets you
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:30.395 --> 00:00:34.505
come through the dashboard vents,
the floor vents, the defrost
00:00:34.505 --> 00:00:39.085
vent at the base of the windshield,
or a combination of multiple vents.
00:00:39.085 --> 00:00:41.552
An air conditioning or AC, button.
00:00:41.552 --> 00:00:44.288
Max defrost and rear defrost buttons.
00:00:44.288 --> 00:00:45.850
And a max A/C button.

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:00:30.900 --> 00:00:33.885
To set up and receive a vehicle
health report via your email,
00:00:33.885 --> 00:00:36.690
you'll first need to login
to your owner account.
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:39.990
If you've not logged in before,
you'll need to register.
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:43.550
Just your name, email address, ZIP code,
00:00:43.550 --> 00:00:48.480
your vehicle identification number or
VIN and your mobile phone number.
00:00:48.480 --> 00:00:52.230
Once you've logged in, click on
the Service and Maintenance tab to set up
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:57.560
reports, then Vehicle Health Report and
click Manage Notifications.
00:00:57.560 --> 00:01:01.810
Then you may need to scroll down the page
and select Email a detailed summary.
00:01:01.810 --> 00:01:03.510
Finally, click Save.
00:01:03.510 --> 00:01:05.660
Now, you're ready to
receive email updates.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg2.mp4
question: How to set up and receive a vehicle health report via email address?

video_name: Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.168
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.168 --> 00:00:07.829
Your Mustang has a feature that measures
the rate at which your car decelerates for
00:00:07.829 --> 00:00:10.130
an improved track experience.
00:00:10.130 --> 00:00:14.310
It's called Brake Performance, which
measures your stopping time and distance.
00:00:14.310 --> 00:00:17.500
To get to it, go to Track Apps
in your information display,
00:00:17.500 --> 00:00:19.590
scroll to Brake Performance, and press OK.
00:00:20.590 --> 00:00:26.490
Then choose whether you want to record
60 to 0, or 100 to 0, and hit OK.
00:00:26.490 --> 00:00:30.520
You'll then be instructed on how to
acquire your car's braking performance.
00:00:30.520 --> 00:00:34.660
First, you'll be instructed to
accelerate to or above the set speed.
00:00:34.660 --> 00:00:38.620
Once the speed has been reached,
it'll instruct you to hit the brakes.
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:40.748
Once you've come to a complete stop,
00:00:40.748 --> 00:00:44.815
your braking performance results will
be posted in the message center.
00:00:44.815 --> 00:00:45.870
Any questions?
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.022
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.022 --> 00:00:58.022
[MUSIC]

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:

If your vehicle includes the blind
spot information system BLIS,
00:01:57.020 --> 00:01:59.970
the system first prompts you to
set up your trailer BLIS feature.
00:02:00.980 --> 00:02:03.920
Next, a message appears in
the information display,
00:02:03.920 --> 00:02:06.570
asking if you want to
Add Trailer Reverse Guidance.
00:02:06.570 --> 00:02:07.350
Select Yes.
00:02:08.360 --> 00:02:12.620
A prompt will direct you to straighten the
trailer if necessary, to continue set up.
00:02:12.620 --> 00:02:15.790
You'll then get another message directing
you to use the quick start guide
00:02:15.790 --> 00:02:16.359
to proceed.

video_trans:

Kind: captions
Language: en

00:00:04.720 --> 00:00:08.109
Your vehicle may be equipped with
a feature that monitors key components of
00:00:08.109 --> 00:00:10.120
a trailer that you are towing.
00:00:10.120 --> 00:00:11.580

you if something regarding your trailer

screen under the Towing menu.
00:00:19.820 --> 00:00:23.888
Such as burned out or unlit trailer
turn signal lamps, brake lights, and
00:00:23.888 --> 00:00:25.474
trailer battery problems.
00:00:25.474 --> 00:00:28.884
Any questions, go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:28.884 --> 00:00:38.884

00:00:42.410 --> 00:00:45.399

video_name: SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q
video_trans:
00:01:19.496 --> 00:01:24.257
On select vehicles, you may even be able
to link your driver memory setting to your
00:01:24.257 --> 00:01:25.984
personal code on the keypad.
00:01:25.984 --> 00:01:29.393
Whatever five-digit code you
programmed as code number one,
00:01:29.393 --> 00:01:31.397
remember, the one set to one, two?
00:01:31.397 --> 00:01:35.251
Will be linked to the memory settings
that are stored in the memory one button.
00:01:35.251 --> 00:01:40.401
So, when you enter that five digit code,
the memory one position will be recalled.
00:01:40.401 --> 00:01:44.677
Whatever five-digit code you programmed
as code number two, the one set on 3 4,
00:01:44.677 --> 00:01:48.666
will be linked to the memory setting that
are stored in the memory two button.
00:01:48.666 --> 00:01:51.916
And if you have a third,
you can store it on 5-6.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q_seg5.mp4
question: How many number code is required for driver's memory setting?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:59.300 --> 00:01:02.040
To set the blind spot
detection on a trailer,
00:01:02.040 --> 00:01:06.000
use the five way switch on your steering
wheel and select type of trailer.
00:01:06.000 --> 00:01:09.920
Keep in mind, BLIS only supports
conventional-type trailers.
00:01:09.920 --> 00:01:12.764
Other types selected with
automatically turn off the BLIS and
00:01:12.764 --> 00:01:14.700
cross-traffic alert feature.
00:01:14.700 --> 00:01:17.980
Next, you'll be asked if you want
to set up BLIS with a trailer.
00:01:17.980 --> 00:01:20.010
If no, BLIS turns off.
00:01:20.010 --> 00:01:24.960
If yes, you'll be asked if the trailer is
less than nine feet wide and 33 feet long.
00:01:24.960 --> 00:01:26.720
Now, enter length of trailer,
00:01:26.720 --> 00:01:29.890
which is the length of the hitch
bulb to the end of the trailer.
00:01:29.890 --> 00:01:34.230
You do so by toggling up or down,
using the menu buttons to increase or
00:01:34.230 --> 00:01:36.560
decrease the measurement by three feet.
00:01:36.560 --> 00:01:38.790
You'll need to select
the length that is equal to or
00:01:38.790 --> 00:01:43.070
greater than three feet of the actual
trailer to allow for full coverage.
00:01:43.070 --> 00:01:49.240
For example, if the actual measured length
is 25 feet, input the length to 27 feet.
00:01:49.240 --> 00:01:52.290
Once the length has been entered,
the setup is saved.
00:01:52.290 --> 00:01:54.570
If the trailer has been connected but
no information for
00:01:54.570 --> 00:01:58.890
that trailer has been entered, the system
will ask for trailer information.
00:01:58.890 --> 00:02:03.250
If no trailer information is entered, BLIS
and cross-traffic alert will be disabled.
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:07.620
It's important to remember that if you
select a trailer in the display screen
00:02:07.620 --> 00:02:11.790
prior to connecting the trailer, the
system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be
stored under towing information for
00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695
BLIS with trailer blind spot
coverage to be active while towing.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg5.mp4
question: Does BLIS automatically turn off if the trailer is not compatable?

00:01:23.410 --> 00:01:25.960

when towing a heavy load.

To switch between adaptive cruise control
or normal cruise use the 5-way switch on
00:02:23.348 --> 00:02:26.134

the information displays.
00:02:26.134 --> 00:02:30.544

then select Adaptive to enable,
00:02:30.544 --> 00:02:33.847

00:02:36.399 --> 00:02:38.782
based on the speed of
the vehicle in front of you.

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:01:40.420 --> 00:01:44.360
As you turn the wheel,
you'll see two zones, yellow and red.
00:01:44.360 --> 00:01:48.630
Yellow being a caution alert that warns
you of a potential jackknife position.
00:01:48.630 --> 00:01:52.160
And red signaling that you need to stop,
pull forward, and
00:01:52.160 --> 00:01:55.610
put the truck and
trailer back into an inline position.
00:01:55.610 --> 00:01:59.550
One more thing, when using the Straight
Backup mode, a steering wheel graphic
00:01:59.550 --> 00:02:02.920
shows you which way to turn your steering
wheel to keep your trailer straight.
00:02:03.990 --> 00:02:05.060
Any questions?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:46.465 --> 00:00:50.790
When a trailer is properly connected and
driving over five miles per hour, BLIS
00:00:50.790 --> 00:00:55.270
with trailer coverage uses sensors in the
vehicle's tail end to extend the detection
00:00:55.270 --> 00:00:59.300
area rearward from the vehicle's side
mirrors to the end of the trailer.

Your brakes also have something
called a Drive Away Release.
00:00:32.229 --> 00:00:36.990
Once you've closed the door, buckled in,
turned on the ignition, shifted into
00:00:36.990 --> 00:00:41.971
gear and pressed the accelerator, your

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:45.300 --> 00:00:48.655
In order to convert the 40 amp
relays to key off battery use,
00:00:48.655 --> 00:00:50.565
there are a few steps you'll need to take.
00:00:50.565 --> 00:00:53.995
First, you'll need to locate
the relay box under the engine hood,
00:00:53.995 --> 00:00:56.015
next to the driver side fender, here.
00:00:57.115 --> 00:01:00.950
Then remove the relay cover by
pressing the tab and lifting it off.
00:01:00.950 --> 00:01:03.060
Next, locate the five amp fuse.
00:01:04.180 --> 00:01:07.900
You'll then need to pull it out,
slide the spacer over, and place it so
00:01:07.900 --> 00:01:12.740
the left prong is in the far left slot and
the right prong is in the middle slot.
00:01:12.740 --> 00:01:16.900
Replace the cover and your 40 amp circuits
are now set to run on battery power
00:01:16.900 --> 00:01:18.930
even with the key out of the truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg4.mp4
question: Where is the relay box located ?

00:00:15.090 --> 00:00:18.154
Your vehicle's rear view
mirror has two pivot points,
00:00:18.154 --> 00:00:21.621
one at the rear of the mirror housing and
one at the windshield.
00:00:21.621 --> 00:00:25.173
To adjust the mirror stem,
grab a hold of the mirror housing, and
00:00:25.173 --> 00:00:29.380
with a little pressure,
pull down to lower and push up to raise.
00:00:29.380 --> 00:00:31.430
It can also be pivoted side to side.
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:35.620
The mirror housing can also
be adjusted left or right and
00:00:35.620 --> 00:00:37.692
tilted up or down with a little pressure.
00:00:37.692 --> 00:00:39.436
It's that simple.

00:03:19.210 --> 00:03:20.989

00:03:26.470 --> 00:03:30.210

00:03:30.210 --> 00:03:35.150

video_name: Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw
video_trans:
00:00:30.999 --> 00:00:35.018
To close all of your windows and
your moon roof, press and
00:00:35.018 --> 00:00:38.295
hold the lock button for
at least two seconds.
00:00:38.295 --> 00:00:41.124
To stop your windows from closing,
00:00:41.124 --> 00:00:45.151
just press the lock or
unlock button on the fob.
00:00:45.151 --> 00:00:46.241
And just so you know,
00:00:46.241 --> 00:00:49.940
the bounce back function is also active
while the windows are closing and
00:00:49.940 --> 00:00:53.655
that helps reduce the worry of something
getting caught in the process.
00:00:53.655 --> 00:00:56.450
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.

video_trans:
00:00:50.623 --> 00:00:54.582
Great, let's take a closer look at
what you'll see from the driver seat.
00:00:54.582 --> 00:00:56.689
If you want to use this system press,
00:00:56.689 --> 00:01:00.600
the on/off switch at the end
of the left hand star.
00:01:00.600 --> 00:01:01.850
Depending on your model,
00:01:01.850 --> 00:01:04.640
you may have to turn it on every
time you turn on your car.
00:01:04.640 --> 00:01:07.359
In other models, the system will
recall the last remembered settings.
00:01:08.420 --> 00:01:10.490
If you started the vehicle using MyKey,
00:01:10.490 --> 00:01:14.090
the system will turn on automatically
with the alert mode selected.

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: where is the five way switch located?

00:00:04.444 --> 00:00:08.061
Your vehicle may be equipped with
a feature that enhances how your vehicle
00:00:08.061 --> 00:00:11.794
responds to steering wheel input by
reacting more smoothly at higher speeds
00:00:11.794 --> 00:00:16.010
and reducing steering wheel rotations
to maneuver at lower speeds.
00:00:16.010 --> 00:00:20.580
Plus, when activated, tow/haul mode delays
up shifts and provides engine braking when
00:00:20.580 --> 00:00:24.510
descending hilly roads while towing
a trailer or hauling heavy loads.
