video_name: Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc
video_trans:
00:00:11.450 --> 00:00:13.100
Using the information display, and
00:00:13.100 --> 00:00:16.150
the five way control switch on
the left side of your steering wheel,
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:19.500
you can choose whether you want
your running lamps on or off.
00:00:19.500 --> 00:00:24.380
Just scroll to Settings, Vehicle,
Lighting, then Daytime Lights.
00:00:24.380 --> 00:00:26.750
If you have your daytime
running lamps set to on and
00:00:26.750 --> 00:00:30.430
want to use them, turn the lighting
control to the auto lamp position.
00:00:30.430 --> 00:00:34.110
When the lighting control is in auto lamp
position, and the head lamps are off,
00:00:34.110 --> 00:00:37.099
the daytime running lamps will turn
on automatically when you're driving.
00:00:38.530 --> 00:00:41.770
And will switch between daytime
running lamps and headlamps as needed.
00:00:41.770 --> 00:00:45.150
Based on how light or dark it is outside,
and whether or not the wipers are on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc_seg2.mp4
question: how to make the day time running lamps on automatically ?

video_trans:
00:02:03.200 --> 00:02:07.270
Replay allows you to listen to up to 44
minutes of previously cast contents from
00:02:07.270 --> 00:02:08.000
the current channel.
00:02:09.280 --> 00:02:13.060
The system will begin storing
content once a channel is selected.
00:02:13.060 --> 00:02:16.570
To replay a song,
just tape the seek back button once and
00:02:16.570 --> 00:02:18.700
it will jump back to the prior song.
00:02:18.700 --> 00:02:20.290
To jump multiple songs or
00:02:20.290 --> 00:02:24.960
listen to content farther back,
tap the seek back button multiple times.
00:02:24.960 --> 00:02:28.640
To return to real time content,
touch the Replay button again and
00:02:28.640 --> 00:02:31.040
it will bring you back to live audio.

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:52.540 --> 00:00:56.902
To access the charge port light
preferences, using the touchscreen,
00:00:56.902 --> 00:01:00.113
touch settings, vehicle,
and charge port light.
00:01:00.113 --> 00:01:01.307
[MUSIC]
00:01:01.307 --> 00:01:03.600
The default setting is on.
00:01:03.600 --> 00:01:07.480
This means the port lights will illuminate
when you plug in, when the vehicle is
00:01:07.480 --> 00:01:13.080
charging, and anytime you press the unlock
button on your key fob or open the doors.
00:01:13.080 --> 00:01:16.370
Selecting Limited will prevent the port
lights from coming on while the vehicle
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:17.860
is charging.
00:01:17.860 --> 00:01:20.410
And Off will disable
all lighting features.

scroll to the right to the Towing tab.
00:00:58.180 --> 00:01:00.890
Select Towing Status, and hit OK.
00:01:00.890 --> 00:01:02.810
Then, you'll see the gain setting screen.
00:01:02.810 --> 00:01:04.940
This is what we talked about earlier.
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:08.170
And the progress bar that lights up to
show you the amount of power going to
00:01:08.170 --> 00:01:11.000
the trailer brakes when you're
foot is on the brake pedal.
00:01:11.000 --> 00:01:15.390
Unless a trailer is connected,
the display will read no trailer detected.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg4.mp4
question: What is displayed on the screen unless a trailer is connected?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:00:41.850 --> 00:00:43.340
To fold the third row seats,
00:00:43.340 --> 00:00:47.460
find the strap on the seat cushion
located in the seat-bite, here.
00:00:47.460 --> 00:00:50.298
Pull it and flip the cushions so
that the seat bottom is face down.
00:00:51.500 --> 00:00:54.090
Next, locate the red
strap in the seat back.
00:00:54.090 --> 00:00:57.641
It looks like it's tucked into a small
pocket in the lower corner of the seat
00:00:57.641 --> 00:00:58.220
back.
00:00:58.220 --> 00:01:00.980
Pull it, and fold the seat back down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the red strap located?

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:00:59.665 --> 00:01:03.545
To access it use the five-way switch on
the left side of your steering wheel.
00:01:03.545 --> 00:01:06.595
Scroll to acceleration timer and
press okay.
00:01:06.595 --> 00:01:10.685
The acceleration timer also has
the ability to begin automatically, or
00:01:10.685 --> 00:01:12.305
use the built-in countdown start.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg4.mp4
question: What must you press after you selected acceleration?

video_name: Double Pivot Mirror _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pdsBuJu7fnQ
video_trans:
00:00:15.090 --> 00:00:18.154
Your vehicle's rear view
mirror has two pivot points,
00:00:18.154 --> 00:00:21.621
one at the rear of the mirror housing and
one at the windshield.
00:00:21.621 --> 00:00:25.173
To adjust the mirror stem,
grab a hold of the mirror housing, and
00:00:25.173 --> 00:00:29.380
with a little pressure,
pull down to lower and push up to raise.
00:00:29.380 --> 00:00:31.430
It can also be pivoted side to side.
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:35.620
The mirror housing can also
be adjusted left or right and
00:00:35.620 --> 00:00:37.692
tilted up or down with a little pressure.
00:00:37.692 --> 00:00:39.436
It's that simple.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Double Pivot Mirror _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pdsBuJu7fnQ_seg2.mp4
question: How to adjust the vehicle rear view mirror stem?

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:00:12.100 --> 00:00:14.900
>> Your car has a few features
that automatically lock or
00:00:14.900 --> 00:00:16.770
unlock all of your doors.
00:00:16.770 --> 00:00:19.910
Autolock will lock all of your doors
when your vehicle is moving and
00:00:19.910 --> 00:00:23.270
reaches a preset speed, and
Auto Unlock will unlock all
00:00:23.270 --> 00:00:26.970
of the doors when the car is turned
off and the driver's door is opened.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg2.mp4
question: When will auto lock lock your doors?

video_trans:
WEBVTT

[MUSIC]

Your vehicle may have a new
feature that gives you more views,
00:00:07.701 --> 00:00:11.090
more information and

00:00:11.090 --> 00:00:11.878
Let me tell you about it.

The new 8 inch productivity
screen on your truck,

is located between the speedometer and

00:00:17.320 --> 00:00:19.970
And gives you an enhanced

video_trans:

The lug wrench is located further back
inside the storage compartment, so
00:01:09.531 --> 00:01:11.689
you may need to turn it
a bit to get it out.

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:00.980 --> 00:01:04.100
Okay, now I'll quickly discuss
the short strap mentioned earlier.
00:01:04.100 --> 00:01:07.460
To fold the second row seats from
the third row, pull the short strap, and
00:01:07.460 --> 00:01:09.980
the seat back will fold down forward.
00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780
Next, pull the longer
strap to unlock the seat.
00:01:12.780 --> 00:01:15.490
Now, push the seat forward and down.
00:01:15.490 --> 00:01:18.690
Your vehicle also has folding floor
support panels that makes stowing
00:01:18.690 --> 00:01:20.150
cargo easier.
00:01:20.150 --> 00:01:20.910
With the second and
00:01:20.910 --> 00:01:25.670
third row seats folded down, grab hold of
the panels and pull to disconnect them.
00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:28.740
You may need to give them a little tug
to disengage them from their magnetic
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:29.850
fasteners.
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:31.910
Then unfold like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg3.mp4
question: Which strap needs to be pulled first when trying to fold down the second row seats from the third row?

video_name: SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek
video_trans:
00:00:17.540 --> 00:00:21.110
An easy to read colorful homescreen
conveniently displays the phone and
00:00:21.110 --> 00:00:22.330
audio features.
00:00:22.330 --> 00:00:26.810
As well as new available navigation
screen, with a convientant swipe and
00:00:26.810 --> 00:00:29.808
pinch to zoom feature,
similar to your smart phone.
00:00:29.808 --> 00:00:33.160
And a redesigned feature bar is now
present along the bottom of the touch
00:00:33.160 --> 00:00:36.540
screen for a simple,
straightforward user experience.
00:00:36.540 --> 00:00:40.670
Keep in mind, if the feature menu bar
retracts below the display screen,
00:00:40.670 --> 00:00:44.270
you can simply touch the controls button
on the bottom left of the screen, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek_seg2.mp4
question: what is featured on the bottom left of the screen?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:18.866 --> 00:02:23.348
To switch between adaptive cruise control
or normal cruise use the 5-way switch on
00:02:23.348 --> 00:02:26.134
your steering wheel and
the information displays.
00:02:26.134 --> 00:02:30.544
Select Driver Assist, Cruise Control,
then select Adaptive to enable,
00:02:30.544 --> 00:02:33.847
or in Normal for
a conventional cruise control system.
00:02:33.847 --> 00:02:36.399
Meaning, it will not
automatically adjust speed,
00:02:36.399 --> 00:02:38.782
based on the speed of
the vehicle in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg9.mp4
question: How do I switch between cruise control modes?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:00:41.945 --> 00:00:44.800
The system also comes
with an Auto function.
00:00:44.800 --> 00:00:48.820
It automatically controls the temperature,
air distribution, and air flow
00:00:48.820 --> 00:00:52.590
to reach and maintain a comfort level
based on the temperature you've selected.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg3.mp4
question: What kind of function does the climate control offer?

video_name: Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek
video_trans:
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:31.890
Here, you can change the mode to alert
00:00:31.890 --> 00:00:34.440
which will vibrate your steering
wheel if you start to drift.
00:00:36.040 --> 00:00:39.990
Aid, which uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer the car back
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:40.886
into the target lane.
00:00:40.886 --> 00:00:44.480
Or Alert + Aid which gives
you both sets of cues.
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.870
Unlike when you're in the alert mode,
in the combined mode,
00:00:48.870 --> 00:00:52.520
you won't feel the alert vibration
until you're further out of your lane.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek_seg3.mp4
question: What does the Aid mode do?

video_trans:
WEBVTT

[MUSIC]
00:00:04.137 --> 00:00:07.961
The parking brake in your vehicle is
not only easier to use then a lever or
00:00:07.961 --> 00:00:11.110
a foot pedal,
it also saves you valuable interior space.
00:00:11.110 --> 00:00:12.535
Here's how it works.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Parking Brake Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Qrl3w8RBP6Q_seg1.mp4

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:31.810 --> 00:00:36.120
When you come to a stop, the Brake Coach
screen appears in your display.
00:00:36.120 --> 00:00:38.830
And shows you your
braking efficiency score.
00:00:38.830 --> 00:00:41.820
You'll get higher percentages by
coming to gradual stops and
00:00:41.820 --> 00:00:46.220
100% means that you maximize
your braking efficiency.
00:00:46.230 --> 00:00:49.060
If at any time you want a quick
refresher on what this feature is,
00:00:49.076 --> 00:00:52.260
use the five way control on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:00:52.260 --> 00:00:56.420
Go to the Main Menu,
scroll to Information, Tutorial,
00:00:56.420 --> 00:00:59.320
then select Brake Coach and
a brief description will appear.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg3.mp4
question: How can the breaking efficiency be known?

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:15.680 --> 00:00:19.000
The trailer brake controller
automatically applies the trailer brakes
00:00:19.000 --> 00:00:21.610
when the tow vehicles brakes are pressed.
00:00:21.610 --> 00:00:24.760
The TBC control is located
on your center console.
00:00:24.760 --> 00:00:29.360
It has a manual control lever that sends
independent power to the trailer's brakes,
00:00:29.360 --> 00:00:31.170
and a plus and minus button.
00:00:31.170 --> 00:00:33.490
Pressing either of them
adjusts how much or
00:00:33.490 --> 00:00:36.940
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:36.940 --> 00:00:38.990
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:38.990 --> 00:00:41.670
lower the gain setting continuously.
00:00:41.670 --> 00:00:42.760
Still with me?
00:00:42.760 --> 00:00:43.880
Okay, then let's move on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg2.mp4
question: How does one adjust the power sent to the trailer's brakes?

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:01:11.689 --> 00:01:15.386
When replacing the front tires,
position the head of the jack
00:01:15.386 --> 00:01:19.241
under the protrusions at the rear
of the front subframe, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg5.mp4
question: What else can it do?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:35.030
Here are a few helpful tips for
unfolding the third row seats.
00:01:35.030 --> 00:01:38.130
You may need to do the next two
steps from the rear of the vehicle.
00:01:38.130 --> 00:01:42.500
First, retract the floor panels by
pulling up on the attached strap.
00:01:42.500 --> 00:01:46.620
Next, grab the third row seat back strap
located behind the head restraint and
00:01:46.620 --> 00:01:47.830
lift it to its locked position.
00:01:49.130 --> 00:01:52.725
Now, go back to the rear side of the door
and use the strap on the front of
00:01:52.725 --> 00:01:55.070
the seat cushion to flip it
back to its original position.
00:01:56.380 --> 00:01:57.950
And here's something you'll appreciate.
00:01:57.950 --> 00:02:02.210
You can also move the third row seats
forward and back and recline them.
00:02:02.210 --> 00:02:04.250
Just lift the metal bar
under the seat cushion and
00:02:04.250 --> 00:02:06.140
slide the seat forward or back.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:09.530
And pull the same strap you used to
fold the seat back down to recline them.
00:02:09.530 --> 00:02:12.160
Only now, just lean back to recline.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg4.mp4
question: Can you recline the third row seats?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:02:12.160 --> 00:02:16.400
To unfold the second row seats,
pull the longer strap on the seat back up.
00:02:16.400 --> 00:02:20.020
When you feel it unlock from the floor,
move the entire seat back and
00:02:20.020 --> 00:02:22.690
push down until you feel it
lock into position again.
00:02:22.690 --> 00:02:24.622
And until you hear it click.
00:02:24.622 --> 00:02:27.481
Finally, pull up on the short strap and
flip the seat back up.
00:02:27.481 --> 00:02:30.019
[MUSIC]
00:02:30.019 --> 00:02:31.043
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg5.mp4
question: how to unfold the 2nd row seat?

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
00:00:23.920 --> 00:00:28.690
If you have rain-sensing front wipers,
move the stalk up to the first position.
00:00:28.690 --> 00:00:32.790
You can change their speed or sensitivity
by turning the inner-ring up or down.
00:00:33.920 --> 00:00:35.900
If you don't have
the rain-sensing feature,
00:00:35.900 --> 00:00:38.860
the ring controls the delay between wipes.
00:00:38.860 --> 00:00:40.830
And if you just don't
want to use the feature,
00:00:40.830 --> 00:00:44.400
you can always choose between normal and
fast wipes.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc_seg2.mp4
question: How to change the sensitivity of the rain-sensing front wipers?

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:25.550 --> 00:00:28.610
You'll know if your child's seat can
be used with the LATCH system if it has
00:00:28.610 --> 00:00:33.220
either two rigid attachments with metal
connectors, or two flexible straps
00:00:33.220 --> 00:00:37.200
with metal hooks that can be connected
to the lower anchors in your seat.
00:00:37.200 --> 00:00:40.490
And if it has a belt strap with a metal
clip that's attached to the top back
00:00:40.490 --> 00:00:42.030
portion of the seat.
00:00:42.030 --> 00:00:43.180
Still with me?
00:00:43.180 --> 00:00:44.190
Great.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA_seg3.mp4
question: what can be ordered through the child seat manufacturer?

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:29.510 --> 00:00:32.320
Electric range is the estimated
distance you can travel
00:00:32.320 --> 00:00:35.280
while in plug-in power
mode with the engine off.
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:38.180
This range is based on
calculations determined by
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:43.090
the amount of energy stored in the battery
and the energy being used while driving.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg2.mp4
question: What calculations are the range based off of?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:00:16.900 --> 00:00:21.180
Adaptive cruise control with stop and go
keeps a constant speed without having to
00:00:21.180 --> 00:00:25.510
use the accelerator and brake pedal but it
also automatically maintains a comfortable
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:28.330
preset distance from
the vehicle in front of you and
00:00:28.330 --> 00:00:31.350
can bring the vehicle to a complete
stop if needed in heavy traffic.

video_trans:
00:00:17.860 --> 00:00:22.440
BLIS, or Blind Spot Information System,
is active anytime you put your vehicle in
00:00:22.440 --> 00:00:25.160

above five miles per hour.

Here are a few places you'll find them.
00:00:14.710 --> 00:00:19.020
The front of the center console, under
the armrests, on the rear of the console,

from the back seats, and

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:01:04.710 --> 00:01:07.320
Now, let me tell you about some of
the other trailering technology.
00:01:08.380 --> 00:01:12.240
A factory installed integrated trailer
brake controller synchronizes your truck
00:01:12.240 --> 00:01:14.820
brakes with the electric brakes
on your trailer for smoother and
00:01:14.820 --> 00:01:15.840
more effective braking.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg5.mp4
question: How does trailer brake controls function?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.279 --> 00:00:04.070
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.070 --> 00:00:07.650
Your vehicle may be equipped with the
feature that is designed to help alert you
00:00:07.650 --> 00:00:11.825
when a vehicle is in your blind spot while
travelling with or without a trailer.
00:00:11.825 --> 00:00:14.510
It can also alert you of
vehicles approaching when backing
00:00:14.510 --> 00:00:16.280
out of a parking space.
00:00:16.280 --> 00:00:17.860
Let me explain.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg1.mp4
question: What are things my vehicle can alert me to?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:27.410 --> 00:00:29.194
When a vehicle enters into your left or
00:00:29.194 --> 00:00:32.561
right adjacent lane radar sensors in
the rear of the vehicle detect it.
00:00:32.561 --> 00:00:35.482
And BLIS warns you with a solid
light on the corresponding side
00:00:35.482 --> 00:00:39.060
view mirror when the vehicle
is within blind spot zone.
00:00:39.060 --> 00:00:41.860
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:43.250 --> 00:00:44.615
When you activate your turn signal,
00:00:44.615 --> 00:00:48.070
BLIS will give you a secondary flashing
light warning on the corresponding
00:00:48.070 --> 00:00:50.590
side view mirror when a vehicle's
within the blind spot zone.
00:00:51.854 --> 00:00:55.264
And remember, the system only
warns you of motorized vehicles,
00:00:55.264 --> 00:00:58.497
it does not detect bicycles,
pedestrians or other objects.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg3.mp4
question: Can the sensor detect all objects like pedestrians, bicycles etc?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:02:36.670 --> 00:02:39.370
Keep in mind,
anytime a trailer is connected and
00:02:39.370 --> 00:02:43.160
information is input, cross-traffic
alert automatically turns off.
00:02:44.260 --> 00:02:48.160
And finally, extreme weather
conditions could block the sensors, but
00:02:48.160 --> 00:02:52.450
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:02:52.450 --> 00:02:54.460
As with most radar, infrared and
00:02:54.460 --> 00:02:58.660
ultrasonic type sensing systems,
there is a possibility of false alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg7.mp4
question: When does Cross Traffic Automatically turn on?

video_name: Using Sport Mode - Ford Trucks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYZKTkmXyro
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.263
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.263 --> 00:00:07.204
You may be interested to know that
your vehicle may be equipped with
00:00:07.204 --> 00:00:11.430
a feature to enhance its performance when
driven on hilly and mountainous roads.
00:00:11.430 --> 00:00:12.750
Let me explain.
00:00:12.750 --> 00:00:15.200
It's called Sport Mode,
and when activated,
00:00:15.200 --> 00:00:19.140
the transmission extends the duration
between shifts of the lower gears.
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:23.170
So the engine stays in the sweet spot
of the engine's RPM power band for
00:00:23.170 --> 00:00:25.580
a more spirited throttle response.
00:00:25.580 --> 00:00:27.350
So instead of constant up and
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.420
down gear shifts, the transmission
holds a specific gear longer for
00:00:31.420 --> 00:00:35.720
peak performance when driving on twisty,
rolling roads with a steep grade.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Sport Mode - Ford Trucks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYZKTkmXyro_seg1.mp4
question: What is the feature for driving in hilly areas called?

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg3.mp4
question: What kind of alerts will I get if there is a possible collision danger?

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:01:18.930 --> 00:01:22.610
Keep in mind, to help remind you when
power is flowing through the switch,
00:01:22.610 --> 00:01:24.700
it will remain illuminated
to let you know it's on.
00:01:25.880 --> 00:01:26.658
Any questions?
00:01:26.658 --> 00:01:28.720
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:01:28.720 --> 00:01:38.720
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg5.mp4
question: What if I've more questions?

video_name: Powerpoints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DRkQOe83jAY
video_trans:
00:00:12.980 --> 00:00:14.710
Here are a few places you'll find them.
00:00:14.710 --> 00:00:19.020
The front of the center console, under
the armrests, on the rear of the console,
00:00:19.020 --> 00:00:21.640
where they're easily accessible
from the back seats, and
00:00:21.640 --> 00:00:23.260
maybe even in the cargo area.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Powerpoints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DRkQOe83jAY_seg2.mp4
question: What are the positions of power jack?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:14.090 --> 00:01:18.120
When the system is on,
you'll see a car icon with lane markings.
00:01:18.120 --> 00:01:20.900
If the lines are gray,
you're either driving too slow for
00:01:20.900 --> 00:01:24.500
the system to work,
the road has poor lane markings, or
00:01:24.500 --> 00:01:27.020
the camera cannot see the markings
because of weather conditions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg5.mp4
question: How can you tell when the system is on?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:06.052

00:00:06.052 --> 00:00:09.786
Your vehicle is equipped with an available
wiper stalk that controls the front and
00:00:09.786 --> 00:00:10.770

Your front wipers are controlled

And the rear wiper controls

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:00:41.850 --> 00:00:43.340
To fold the third row seats,
00:00:43.340 --> 00:00:47.460
find the strap on the seat cushion
located in the seat-bite, here.
00:00:47.460 --> 00:00:50.298
Pull it and flip the cushions so
that the seat bottom is face down.
00:00:51.500 --> 00:00:54.090
Next, locate the red
strap in the seat back.
00:00:54.090 --> 00:00:57.641
It looks like it's tucked into a small
pocket in the lower corner of the seat
00:00:57.641 --> 00:00:58.220
back.
00:00:58.220 --> 00:01:00.980
Pull it, and fold the seat back down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the red strap needed for folding the 3rd row seats located at?

video_name: Hands Free Liftgate _ Ford How-to _ Ford-nmWSzJn1Dfk
video_trans:
00:00:14.430 --> 00:00:17.520
To open your lift gate,
simply kick your leg forward and
00:00:17.520 --> 00:00:21.310
back under the center of the rear
bumper below the license plate.
00:00:21.310 --> 00:00:23.850
Then step back to give
the gate space to open.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Hands Free Liftgate _ Ford How-to _ Ford-nmWSzJn1Dfk_seg2.mp4
question: How do you move your legs to open the vehicle's rear gate?

video_trans:
WEBVTT

Language: en

00:00:08.733 --> 00:00:12.533
>> Did you know that your automatic
transmission lets you manually switch
00:00:12.533 --> 00:00:13.173
gears too?

In fact, you can choose from Sport Mode or
SelectShift,
00:00:16.583 --> 00:00:18.653
depending on your driving style.

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:01:35.971 --> 00:01:39.270
And here are a few other tips
you might be interested in.
00:01:39.270 --> 00:01:41.689
To cool down your car
quickly while in auto mode,
00:01:41.689 --> 00:01:44.525
adjust the temperature control
to the desired setting.
00:01:44.525 --> 00:01:45.986
Or press the MAX A/C button,
00:01:45.986 --> 00:01:49.500
which will automatically adjust
the fan speed to the highest setting.

video_name: LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.512
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.512 --> 00:00:08.350
Your vehicle may be equipped with some or
all of these LED lighting features,
00:00:08.350 --> 00:00:12.610
that are both convenient and offer
a little extra security when traveling.
00:00:12.610 --> 00:00:13.270
Let me explain.
00:00:14.320 --> 00:00:17.450
Our quad beam LED head lamps
generate a brighter light,
00:00:17.450 --> 00:00:21.160
that resembles natural daylight,
which in turn can help reduce eye strain.
00:00:21.160 --> 00:00:24.425
Plus, they typically
last longer than halogen.
00:00:24.425 --> 00:00:25.631
Bright LED tail lamps and
00:00:25.631 --> 00:00:30.130
fog lamps compliment the headlamps
while enhancing nighttime visibility.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk_seg1.mp4
question: What does the LED lights resemble?
